loans.name: Keji

texts.en: Keji J. is currently in the business of selling used clothing in the market and is requesting a loan to import more clothing from Uganda to sell them in South Sudan. Keji is 20 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Import more clothing from Uganda to sell in South Sudan.

loans.name: Gina Del Rocio

texts.es:
Gina C. de 30 años de edad, su casa esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, tiene agua y luz como servicio básicos, no esta casada pero tiene 4 hijos uno de 3 años, 7 años, 8 años y de 9 años estudian en una escuela fiscal. 

Gina comenzó hace ya unos años atrás cuando algunos conocidos de ella trabajaban elaborando figuras para fiestas con fomix, espuma y pirograbadores ella así poco a poco aprendió este oficio y pudo comenzar con su negocio de fabricación de figuras para fiestas, ella trabaja desde las 08h30 hasta las 12h30.

Gina con el préstamo quiere comprar fomix, pirograbador para poder adecuar mas el negocio haciendo más manualidades, en el futuro quiere agrandar mas el negocio para poderles dar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gina C. is 30 years old and she lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil. She has water & a basic electricity service. She is not married but had 4 kids who are three, seven, eight & nine years old and go to state school.

A few years ago some of Gina's friends were working making figurines for parties using shaped moulds, foam & etching machines. Bit by bit she started to learn this trade & was able to start her business making these figurines for parties. She works from 8.30am - 12.30pm.

With the loan Gina wants to buy moulds and an etching machine so she can stock her business better & make more handcrafts. In the future she would like to enlarge her business to give her kids a better future.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Moulds, paint & an etching machine/FOMIX, PINTURAS, PIROGRABADOR

loans.name: Gertrudis

texts.es:
Gertrudis es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Creceremos en quechua.
Gertrudis es casada, tiene 49 años y 1 hijo, Gertrudis se dedica a la siembra D. alfalfa en sus tierras y también alquila, producto que venD. a diferentes tiendas, el transporte lo realiza con su carro. Además Gertrudis cría animales menores.
Gertrudis necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en el mantenimiento D. su carro.
Los sueños D. Gertrudis son tener una ferretería, negocio que no le genere mucho esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Gertrudis is a member of the Communal Bank “Wiñarisun”, which means “We Will Grow” in Quecha. She is 49 years old, married, and has one child. Gertrudis grows alfalfa on her land and also on property that she rents. She sells her product to different stores and transports the goods in her car. At the same, Gertrudis raises small animals.

She needs a loan of 1000 soles to pay for maintenance of her car. Gertrudis dreams of opening a hardware store, a business that she can start with little effort.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Alondra Jacqueline

texts.es:
Alondra Jacqueline G. L. tiene 26 años, es soltera, y vive con sus padres y 3 de sus 5 hermanos.  Tiene un hijo que se llama Danny de 5 años.

La socia pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas.  La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maiz como los principales cultivos.

Alondra se encuentra ayudando a su mama en la casa con los deberes domesticos.  Su papa trabaja en la agricultura todos los días y siembra maiz, papas, y otros vegetables.  Venden los productos en las ferias de San Pablo semanalmente.  Estudiaba Comercio de Administración en la Universidad de Bolivar y ya acabó sus estudios.  Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos y urea para ayudar a su padre con los cultivos.

Su sueño en la vida es seguir adelante y tener un puesto fijo en su profesión.  En sus ratos libres, se dedica a escuchar música y salir de paseo con su familia.
texts.en:
Alondra Jacqueline G. L., 26, is single; she lives with her parents and 3 of her 5 siblings. She has a son, Danny, who is 5 years old. She is a member of the "San Jose de las Orquideas" communal bank, which is located 15 minutes from the city of San Miguel in the San Jose de Palmas community. Most of the residents of the community are farmers who grow potatoes and corn as the main crops. Alondra helps her mother with the domestic chores. Her father farms corn, potatoes and other vegetables daily. They sell their products weekly in the San Pablo market. She used to study Business Commerce in Bolivar University but she has finished her studies. She is asking for funds to buy fertilizers and urea to help her father with the crops. Her dream is to continue forward in life and to have a steady job in her profession. In her free time, she listens to music and goes on family outings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and urea.

loans.name: Vilma's Group

texts.en:
Vilma B. is from the town of Sto. Domingo, Echague. She is 33 years old. Vilma is the group leader of an eleven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Vilma's group.

Vilma is single. To make a living, Vilma owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $66 a month from these activities.

In 2006, Vilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which also will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 11th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
este cliente es originario de la comarca de boqueron jurisdiccion de quezalguaque, es una productora que se dedica a la crianza de ganado especificamente a l a produccion de leche,
durante los 5 creditos que ha obtenido ha sido con el objetivo de crecer y mejorar su hato ganadero, el cual lo esta haciendo, por que tiene ganado de mejor raza.
texts.en:
This client is originally from the Boqueron district, in the jurisdiction of Quezalguaque. She is a producer who works raising cattle, specifically for the production of milk.

During the 5 loans she has obtained, she has had the goal to grow and improve her herd, which she is doing, because now she has cows of a better breed.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 milk cows

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La señora  Maria Rosario C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres con Decisión, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, localidad emblemática por su hermosa arquitectura, su parque natural  protegido como el Cajas, su gastronomía, su gente, etc. atractivos turísticos de ésta hermosa ciudad del callejón interandino.

María Rosario  tiene cincuenta  años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal  concibió cinco hijos que se encuentran de 31, 29, 27, 24, 16 años, los  cuatro primeros  son casados y viven independientes  en sus hogares, su último hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo no se encuentra en el país el viajó  al extranjero para brindar  a su familia un mejor futuro y gracias al esfuerzo conjunto cuenta con su casa propia de lo que se siente muy orgullosa.

Ella es una mujer muy activa le gusta criar pollos que luego los  vende a sus vecinos de la comunidad y también para el consumo de su hogar compartiendo con las actividades propias de su hogar,  es una señora muy carismática y alegre y lleva  tres años en su banco comunal, con los créditos accedidos  inició su negocio de pollos y con el nuevo credito solicitado comprará más crías de pollos, vitaminas y su alimento para criarlos y venderlos.
 
Su sueño es ver que  todos sus hijos  se superen en el ámbito personal y económicamente.
texts.en:
Maria Rosario C. is a member of the "Mujeres con Decisión" community bank. She lives in the urban city of Cuenca, a place known for its beautiful architecture, protected El Cajas nature park, culinary offerings, people, etc. -- tourist attractions in this beautiful Andean city. María Rosario is 50 years old, married, and has 5 children ages 31, 29, 27, 24, and 16. The first four children are married and live in their own homes. Her last child attends a city high school. Her husband doesn't live in the country; he traveled abroad in order to provide the family with a better future. Thanks to their joint efforts, she is very proud to have a house to call her own. She is a very active woman who enjoys raising poultry that she later sells to neighbors in her community and also uses for home consumption. In addition to taking part in household activities, she is a very charismatic and joyful woman who has participated for the last three years in her community bank. With the loans she has been granted, she began her chicken business, and this new loan she is requesting will be used for the purchase of more chicks, vitamins, and chicken feed so as to raise and sell her flock. Her dream is to see all of her children excel in their personal and economic lives.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of baby chicks, vitamins, and chicken feed

loans.name: Horoljav

texts.en: Horoljav is 66 years old and lives with her youngest daughter Baigali-Erdene, age 24, in Hovd province, Mongolia. Together they operate a clothing trading business at a local trading center called Ih-Buyan. They have been successfully operating their business since 2008. It is a seasonal business, and the demand of her products is high especially during April and May when students purchase suits and other clothing for their graduation ceremonies. Horoljav is a very hardworking person and says, “My business is very important for me as it is the only financial source for my family. I would like to expand my business and product line in the future. In addition, I would like to improve my family's quality of life.” She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan for working capital to purchase more inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing inventory.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde C.  es una señora de 29 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo y sus  cuatro hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Desde hace algunos  años Doña Matilde inicio su propio negocio,  vendiendo desde su casa las verduras que su familia cosecha, ahora que ha visto los resultados ella quiere invertir para hacer crecer su negocio, construyendo un local aparte con más espacio para asi brindar un mejor servicio a su comunidad.

Actualmente ella necesita un préstamo por ¢605.000(seiscientos cinco mil colones) Para comprar materiales para construir el local donde pueda realizar las ventas. Doña Reina comenta que el servicio que ella brinda es muy importante ya que no existen otra verdulería cercana a esa zona  lo que hace que la demanda sea bastante.

Doña Matilde es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito muchas personas se pueden convertir en microempresarios exitosos.
texts.en:
Matilde C. is 29 and lives with her husband and four children in a town called Santa Fe in the region of Los Chiles, Alajuela province; this area is very rural and lies in the northern border region of the country. This region is noted for cattle raising and agriculture, specifically producing grains, sugar and oranges. For some years Matilde has managed her own business, selling produce that her family has grown on their land, and now that she has seen some of the results of her efforts, she seeks to construct a space in order to expand her business to benefit the community. She is seeking a loan of ¢605.000(six hundred five thousand colones) to buy construction materials to expand her produce business. Her business fills an important need in the area as there are no other produce vendors in the region serving local residents. Matilde is a member of the Communal Credit Cooperative "Manantial de Santa Fe", one of 100 organizations which form EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and with it she hopes to achieve personal and economic progress. Thanks to these organizations that facilitate credit many people have become successful entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costruction of Business locale

loans.name: Lucinda Emilia

texts.es:
Lucinda es socia del Banco Comunal Gabriela.
Lucinda es casada, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Lucinda tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realizaba todos los días. Además Lucinda brinda el servicio de bordado de correas, carteras artesanales.
Lucinda necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Lucinda son tener una tienda mas grande y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lucinda is a member of the Communal Bank Gabriela. Lucinda is married, 40 years old, and has 5 children. She has a grocery store within her home and works daily selling vegetables, meats, and groceries in general. In addition, Lucinda can do needlework on home-made belts and wallets. Lucinda needs a loan of 900 Peruvian soles for the purchase of rice and sugar. Lucinda’s dreams are to have a larger store and offer her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Monika

texts.en: Akenese Leone is 39 and is married with four children, ages 2 to 16. She owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale and has four years of experience in this business. Akenese needs a loan of WST 2,500 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the earnings from her business, estimated to be 300 talas (approximately 120 USD) per week, to financially support immediate members of her family. In 2007, Akenese joined SPBD. This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia P. A. tiene 25 años es madre soltera de dos hijos, ella vive con sus padres en la comunidad de Tumuyo zona rural hacia el norte de Colomi, ella se dedica a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca,papa liza.

Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza) y semilla de papa holandesa para poder aumentar aún más su producción agrícola ahora con este crédito quiere sembrar más terreno y poder así incrementa sus ingresos considerablemente. Salir adelante es su mayor prioridad porque necesita trabajar para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella quiere que sus hijos puedan terminar el colegio y poder hacer una carrera profesional ya que ella no pudo terminar ni la escuela porque desde muy pequeña trabajaba junto a sus padres en el campo a la vez nos dice que la agricultura no solo le sirve como ingreso si no también como fuente de alimentación para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Lidia P. A. is 25 years old and a single mother to two children. She lives with her parents in the rural community of Tumuyo, to the north of Colomi. She works on a farm growing potatoes, beans, “oca” (an edible root) and “papa liza” (a tuber grown in the Andean region). She is asking for a loan to purchase organic fertiliser (chicken manure) and Dutch potato seeds to further increase her agricultural production. With this loan she would like to sow more land, which will considerably increase her income. Her main priority is making ends meet because she needs to work to bring up her children. She wants her children to finish high school to have the opportunity of going onto a professional career, as she wasn’t able to finish school because she has worked with her parents on the farm since she was very little. She says that agriculture is not only useful as a source of income but also as a source of food for all the family.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase organic fertiliser

loans.name: Mon

texts.en: Mrs. Mon L. is 54 years old and lives in Tuol Kandal village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Touch L., are farmers who own 4.2 hectares of land where they cultivate rice for a living. Mr. Touch L. also has a horse cart to transport goods for income. Mrs. Mon L. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farming efforts. This couple has four children; one is a soldier, two are students, while the last one is a farmer. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en:
Dolgor T. is 51 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They all live together in a house on their own land. Her husband is a photographer. Her son, Narangerel, is 25 years old and works for a company. Her daughter, Sarangerel, is 22 years old and this year, graduated from university. Now she is helping with her mothers business. 

Dolgor currently operates a construction material and construction equipment business out of a rented stall at the largest market in Ulaanbaatar, called Khar-khorin. Since Dolgor started her business, her family's living conditions have improved. With her earnings, she has been providing money for family expenses and paying her children's education fees. Now she has 4 sales outlets for her business. She is an open and very hardworking person. She has also started to build a grocery business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase construction material to finish the grocery store and purchase current assets fo the new business.

loans.use: To start new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa has recently decided to change her business enterprise from charcoal sales to fish vending. She has been in this new business for a few months. She works in the very market where she used to sell charcoal. She buys fish from the Gaba landing site in Makindye Division in Kampala District. Her primary business challenge is the transport of fish from Gaba to her stall in Owino market, a journey for which she presently uses public transportation. She works six days a week. She wants to use this loan to buy more baskets of fish. She aspires toward a business model of selling solely at wholesale prices. She decided to work with MCDT because she wanted to boost her business by obtaining additional capital. 

Hawa resides in a rented two-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food, and rent. She is a single mother and has three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in Mengo Kisenyi in the outskirts of Kampala city. It is a walkable distance from Kampala city to her residence.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish for sale

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: M. kossiwa est une dame de 46 ans. elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. malgré son âge avancée elle est une femme très dynamique.  elle exerce depuis trois ans déjà le commerce de charbons de bois. elle s'approvisionne en quantité dans la ville de Kara, ce qui lui permet d'avoir une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur ses ventes. son stock de marchandises est en baisse, pour se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter une trentaine de sacs de charbons de bois et assurer le transport de la marchandises
texts.en:
Kossiwa M. is a 46 year old woman. She is married and the mother of 3 children. Despite her advanced age, she is a very dynamic woman. For three years she has run a business selling charcoal. She stocks up in large quantities in the city of Kara, which allows her to have a large profit margin on her sales. Her stock of merchandise is low, so in order to restock she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy some 30 bags of charcoal and to assure the transport of her merchandise.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Rang

texts.en:
Rang N., 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples. N. sells fish for an income of USD 8 per day. her husband is a fisherman, earning an income of USD 3.50 per day. Currently, N. uses her bicycle to transport fish to sell.  

N. is requesting a loan of USD 900 to purchase a motorbike to transport fish to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to transport fish to sell

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie D. is a married woman who lives in Sentro 2, Brgy. Kabac, Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: pig fattening, buying and selling of charcoal, and buying and selling of beverages, rice, and eggs.  Her husband Pedro D., who is 51 years old, works as a Seaman to earn his living. They have three children whose ages range from 20 to 29 years old. 

Annie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Annie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 12th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she could continue to save up for the future by putting up a new business.  Annie is hoping to get into the fishing business, for which she needs to purchase fishing materials and a pump boat. Annie D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase couch covers, colognes, umbrellas, perfumes, women's sandals, and hair conditioner

loans.name: Telma Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Telma del Socorro E. es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como operaria de Limpieza desde hace 6 años, lleva ya 5 créditos con CEPRODEL y ha pagado muy bien.

La señora Telma es soltera tiene dos hijos en edades escolares y habita en el barrio San Agustín, poco a poco ha podido sacar adelante a su familia con empeño y dedicación.
texts.en:
Telma del Socorro E. has been working for the Chinandega city hall as a cleaner for the past 6 years. She has already received 5 loans through CEPRODEL, and is very good at paying them back. 
Telma is single and has two school-aged children. She lives in the San Agustín district, and has gradually been able to improve her family's situation with her hard work and dedication.

loans.use: To buy construction materials (zinc, wood)

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.en:
Nicanor A. is from the village of Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao City. He is 58 years old. Nicanor is single. To make a living, Nicanor owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Nicanor has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP when he sells his raised animal.

In 2010, Nicanor joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nicanor is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Nicanor from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child.one of her children is currently in school.  Edith has had a salon business for seven years.         

To help expand her business, Edith has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase braids.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Edith hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Edith hopes to own a house.   

Edith is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to use money.

loans.use: Braids

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has been operating an open air food stall business for the past three years.  Her customers are neighbours and passersby. Mwanaidi faces a major challenge in competition from other food stall operators. She hopes to establish a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat oil, rice, and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, cooking fat oil, rice, and maize flour

loans.name: Mehujayme

texts.en:
Mehujayme P. is a married woman who lives in  Brgy. Cansalongan, Isabella, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a rice mill and a general store. Her husband Hernani, who is 60 years old, works as a driver to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 28 and 29 years old. 

Mehujayme joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mehujayme has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital for the rice mill and to purchase stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs . Mehujayme P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of her rice  mill and general store

loans.name: Altynbubu

texts.en:
Altynbubu K. is 59 years old and is widowed. She has four grown children; her youngest son lives with her and helps in the household. 
Altynbubu got married and had lived with her husband in a happy marriage for a long time but, unfortunately, in 2000 her husband died of heart disease.
 
To find additional means of income, she decided to continue the business of cattle breeding which was started by her deceased husband. Due to their vast experience in this activity, Altynbubu’s family managed to maintain the farm with 10 sheep and bull calves. In 2009, her son sold most of their cattle and bought a truck, which is now used in a transportation service by him. 

Now Altynbubu is applying for a loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy two cows and spares to repair the truck. Altynbubu is an optimistic woman and believes that her tireless efforts will lead her family to a more prosperous life. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the needs of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Helen Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Helen Maria C. Fernández vive junto a su esposo e hijo. Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en el distrito de Santiago. La Sra. Helen se dedica a la venta de comida hace 1 año. Tiene el negocio en la casa de sus padres. Vende diariamente caldo de gallina y pollo broster. Su esposo trabaja en el municipio de la zona. Su sueño de la Sra. Maria es incrementar su negocio y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agardecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a travéz de este financiamiento.
texts.en: Sra. Helen Maria C. F. lives with her husband and son, in her parent's house, in the Peruvian town of Santiago.  Sra. Helen has operated a business selling food for 1 year.  She operates the business from her parent's house.  She sells roast chicken and chicken broth.  Her husband works for the municipal government.  Sra. Helen wants to expand her business and help her family gain a better quality of life.  She is grateful for the support that this kind of lending provides.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  farming and buying & selling dried fish. Her husband Samuel C., who is 51 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 14 and  23 years old. 

Elena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow, making an income from the sales of products from her farm. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to buy fertilizers such as manure so that she can continue to save up for future improvement of business. Elena is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Coming right from her mouth, Sonia P., 53, admits to being a simple person who lives her life for others. Sonia is a community partner of CCT* in Pasay City. She has no family of her own; nevertheless, her siblings and friends consider themselves blessed because of her. Sonia reached college and is now dedicated to making her business reach new heights.

Sonia rents out the rooms in her house to boarders – students, working professionals and transients.  She has been in this business for 12 years now; so, she has quite a good grasp of managing rooms well and keeping a good, relaxing ambiance in the house. As well, her personality jives with the different individual clients she gets to meet. Monthly she is able to earn 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

Because she is taking her business to new heights, Sonia decided to borrow 25,000 PHP. This is a great help to her business, as she needs the money to buy additional materials, such as metal, cement and other construction materials, to improve the room facilities. She really wants to make the rooms look better and to add more to accommodate more clients. Because the loan enables her to shape up her business, she is also able to give financially to siblings who do not have work.

At present, Sonia battles a health problem, as her stomach frequently hurts. Her head also aches with clients who do not pay their dues on time; sometimes, not at all! Still, these are not enough to stop Sonia from reaching new business heights. She desires to level up her rental services from rooms to a condominium. She plans on buying her own lot and building another house. She dreams of having her own car. Of course, she also has a dream for her siblings. Simple as she is, she wants to be of assistance to them and to others even in the years to come.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Renovation of rooms for rent

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en: Winnie is a 39-year-old dairy farmer who has been farming for the past ten years. She also sells secondhand clothes to supplement her family’s income. Winnie hopes to expand her business to attract more customers in the future. She has requested a first loan of 20,000 KES which she will use to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Angela Monserrate

texts.es:
Ángela de 30años, es una mujer emprendedora que empezó su actividad vendiendo productos de belleza por catálogos para ayudar a su familia.

Ella realiza sus pedido diarios y sale a recorrer por diferentes lugares para promocionar su revista y a cobrar sus ventas a los clientes que dejan a créditos sus productos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar más productos de perfume, ropa, etc. Quiere seguir trabajando para darle todo lo mejor a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ángela, 30, is an enterprising woman who started her activity selling catalogue beauty products to help her family.

She takes orders daily and goes out to various places to promote her catalogue and collect payments from customers who buy from her on credit.  

She wants to use the loan to buy more products: perfume, clothes, etc.  She wants to continue working to provide her children with the best education.

loans.use: to buy perfume and clothes.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is 36 years-old and a widow with one child who is 16 years-old.

Julienne has had a restaurant business for the past year.  She employs five people who help her. Julienne works from 6am until 8pm.  After realizing that she lacks sufficient equipment to offer a quality service in her restaurant, she is requesting her first loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company s.a in order to expand her business by buying new materials.  With this expansion, Julienne hopes to get more profit than before and through that profit, she will be able to buy her own house and save for her child.

loans.use: to buy new materials

loans.name: Winny

texts.en:
Winny J. Y. is a woman of forty-four years, widowed and the mother of five children. They live in Mosop on the outskirts of Eldoret town. She does maize farming and has been doing so for eleven years now. She gets a monthly income of about $150 from selling the maize.


This will be Winny's fourth loan from  KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy maize seedlings and fertilizer. With the income that she will get she wants to buy a posho mill machine (machine used for making maize flour), and also educate her children. 


In future she wants to educate her children, and also continue with maize farming.

loans.use: to buy maize seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es: El Sr. Simón se dedica a la fabricación de anillos, hace treinta años, el fabrica  anillos de diferentes   modelos de acuerdo a los pedidos que le hagan, el Sr. Simon tiene 59 años, Vive la Zona del Plan 3000, tiene cinco  hijos a su cargo ya que tres trabajan y los otros le ayudan con los que aceres de su negocio,  sus horarios de trabajo son de 7 de la Mañana  a 8 de la noche,  los trabajos terminados los entrega a las joyerías  mercado del plan 3000 y de algunas joyerías del mercado de los pozos. Actualmente el necesita el crédito para comprar Barras de gramos de Oro y de plata. Su Esposa se dedica a Atender su tienda la que esta ubicada en su propio domicilio. Son personas responsables, el Sr. Simón es una persona muy trabajadora, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Simón works making rings. For thirty years, he has made rings in different models according to the orders he receives. He is 59 years old and lives in the Plan 3000 area. He is raising five children. Three of them work and the others help with the work duties. His work schedule is from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. He delivers his work to jewelry stores in the market in Plan 3000 and to some jewelry stores in the Los Pozos market. At present, he needs the loan to buy gold and silver gram bars. His wife runs her store, which is located in their own house. They are responsible people. Simón is a very hard working person and is grateful to the institution for the support it has offered.

loans.use: to buy gold and silver gram bars.

loans.name: Salomon

texts.en:
Salomon is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 35 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. Salomon has a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more goods for her general store.

Salomon has been in this business for six years.  In the future, Salomon would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her general store.

loans.name: Rwentobo Tukore Womens Group

texts.en:
Dinah, 60, operates a food sales business in Ntungamo, in Western Uganda. The mother of six has been in this business for 15 years. At her stall, she sells mostly beans, onions and ground nuts.

To begin this business, Dinah needed start-up capital. Luckily, she successfully applied and received a loan and with this, she set forth. Back then, her  only source of income was a small milk sales business. Dinah has worked hard to get where she is in this business. She says was it not for her tenacity and perseverance, she would not have made it this far. Monthly, her business generates profits to the tune of 400,000 shillings. With this loan, she plans to purchase more beans, onions, rice and ground nuts for resale.

loans.use: to purchase beans, onions, rice and ground nuts for resale.

loans.name: Regubertha

texts.es:
Regubertha es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Miguel Arcángel II”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 18 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,  tiene un hijo y solo  estudió hasta 1ro de secundaria.
La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres meses, su primer préstamo, que fue por S/. 500.00 nuevos soles lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de carne porcino -ovino.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, comprará tres animales para su respectivo carneo y poder venderlo, la señora dice que trabaja junto con su  esposo.
Su sueño es tener más capital para mejorar el negocio y así tener mayores ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Regubertha is a member of the communal bank "San Miguel Arcángel II", located in the Llave District, province of El Collao in the department of Puno.  She is 18, has a live-in partner and a son in first grade.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three months.  She used her first loan of 500 PEN to invest in her pork-lamb butchery.

She plans to use the new loan of 500 PEN to buy animals for her butcher shop.  She works with her husband.  Her dream is to have more capital to improve her business and increase income.  What she likes most about the communal bank is how much she can save.

loans.use: To buy three animals for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 49-year-old mother who has three school-aged children. She is a farmer working in the Philippines, and earns 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month. 

Elena is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase additional breeding livestock and feeds. Elena grows hogs, and has been doing this for almost six years.

In the future, Elena hopes to raise more pigs in order to help her husband in gaining income. She hopes that she can be able to improve and maintain this business in order to also improve their status of living.

loans.use: to purchase additional breeding livestock and feeds.

loans.name: Concepcion Yamileth

texts.es:
Concepción, tiene 28 años de edad, vive acompañada de sus tres hijos y su esposo, se dedica a la venta de hamacas, tiene 8 años de dedicarse al negocio, siendo un ingreso permanente para el hogar.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de hilo de seda de distintos colores, para la confección de las hamacas, esta inversión será una gran ayuda para aumentar el volumen de producción y las ventas.
Su aspiración es crecer en la comercialización de las hamacas, generar mayores ganancias para ofrecer una mayor comodidad a sus hijos y llegar a tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Concepcion is 28 years old and she lives together with her three children and her husband. She sells hammocks and she has been in business for 8 years. It is a permanent source of income for the household. 

She requests a loan to purchase silk threads in various colors to make hammocks. This investment will be a great help to help her increase the production volume and sales.

Her aspiration is to increase the sale of hammocks to generate more income. This will help to offer her children with greater comfort and to one day have a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase silk threads of different colors to make hammocks.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 37 years old and is married, with two children, twelve and three years old. She runs a shoe sales business at Gikomba in Nairobi. She has been in this business for ten years now and she says her major challenge is financial constraints. 

She is using her loan of KES 50,000 to buy shoes to sell to the local people. She hopes to grow her business and start importing shoes from abroad. She sees herself opening a shoe shop in the Central Business District, Nairobi. She describes herself as aggressive and honest.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Gles

texts.en:
Gles is 27 years old. He is married and has two children. He is a farmer, while his wife is a housekeeper. His wife also has a sari-sari store (general store) business in which she sells breads, spices, sugar, vinegar, and cooking oil. His wife's income from the business went to the daily consumption of the family.

Gles plants and harvests corn and vegetables. Gles also runs a hog-fattening business to earn additional income. He wants to expand the business and earn a higher income to use for the improvement of their house. Gles wishes to borrow 15,000 PHP to buy piglets to raise.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Bernadette has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Bernadette has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Earng

texts.en:
Earng, 56 years old, is a farmer with her husband and earns $7 per day. This couple has five children; two are studying, two more are farming, and one more is working in a factory, each earning $4 per day. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $7 on electricity, $25 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy fertilizer and hire workers to clear the grass in her field. She wants to divide her field into two parts for planting yams and farming.  She hopes that her new career will make her income improve.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire workers.

loans.name: Guicela Mercedes

texts.es:
Guicela Mercedes  tiene 34 años, tiene  5  hijos de diecisiete, dieciséis, quince, trece, seis meses de edad, vive con  conyugue  y con los hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul.

Guicela Mercedes se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol gandúl. sus productos los compra y los vende en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una casa para poder vivir tranquila.

En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Guicela Mercedes is 34 years old and lives with her husband and five children, aged 17, 16, 15, 13 and 6 months.

The members of San José de los Amarillos community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Guicela is a farmer who grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  

Guicela is requesting this loan to buy corn and rice seeds.  She will buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to own her own home where she can live peacefully.

In her free time, Guicela enjoys taking part in sports and listening to music.

loans.use: to buy corn and rice seeds, supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Tafuta Oaf Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Tafuta OAF Group in Western Kenya! Ronald is the facilitator of the Tafuta OAF Group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Ronald takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Ronald had an excellent maize yield harvesting fourteen bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ronald was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ronald and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Ronald will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.
In 2012, the members of Tafuta OAF Group will each plant  between half and one acre of maize.
In the photograph, Ronald is pictured with his group members, and his field officer on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
This is Nilo, 41, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. A father of  two children, Nilo has managed by the grace of God to support his children's schooling.  He is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nilo oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. They have one unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, which is paying boundary (daily quota) each day. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 1,000 every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy new accessories, spare parts and maintenance of his jeepney. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.

Nilo dreams that his children will finish their education. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his jeepney unit.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 36 years old, married, and has two children. Her two children are still studying. She aims to send her children into higher levels of education, so she is doing her best to support them in their studies. 

She is a dealer of fish sauce and she has been running this kind of business for nine years. She delivers her products to three municipalities: Santiago, Diffun and Maddela. She uses her delivery truck within these municipalities to transport her products. She is grateful because through her hard work and patience she is able to increase her sales and profit. 

Elisa is still in need of additional capital amounting to P50,000, due to the high cost of basic commodities and the expenses of her two children. She will be using her additional capital to buy a stock of fish sauce. She hopes that through her loan she could make her dreams come true and improve their  standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fish sauce for her business.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, es carpintero, vive con sus padres y una hermana mejor, tiene aproximadamente 4 años de estar dedicado a la carpintería, fabricando ataúdes de madera, trabaja por contrato, todos los días de la semana.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera de cedro, pino, laurel, y pagar por el mantenimiento de las herramientas, este préstamo le ayudara para mantener todo lo necesario en el taller y que sus herramientas estén listas en buenas condiciones, esto permitirá que su taller aumente la capacidad para hacer muebles y ataúdes.
Las aspiraciones de Juan son, aumentar su potencial, darse a conocer más en el mercado, aumentando los cliente y la demanda, para hacer más exitoso su trabajo.
texts.en:
Juan is a carpinter and lives with his parents and younger sister.  For approximately four years he has worked making wood coffins.  He works on a contract order basis every day of the week.

He is requesting a loan to buy cedar, pine and laurel wood and pay for the tool maintenance.  The loan will help him keep his workshop up to date and his tools in good working condition.  In this way he can increase capacity to make furniture and more coffins.

Juan wants to increase his business potential and become more well-known in the market.  He hopes this will increase his customer base and product demand so his business is more successful.

loans.use: To buy cedar, pine, and laurel wood.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her father and mother). Madina lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.   
Madina has a business selling bananas. She has been in this business for one year, and works 7 days per week. Madina sells her products at the market, by means of retail. She has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO. She will use her loan to buy more bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Madina include transportation and the increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. 
Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and own a delivery van.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Maripsa Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora Maripsa tiene 37 años y vive en la aldea del Centro en el municipio de Santa Cruz. Maripsa es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos de 8 y 15 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando. 

Maripsa especializa en la venta de mercadería como blusas, pantalones, calcetas, y faldas entre otras cosas. Inició su negocio justo después de que nació su primer hijo debido a la necesidad de tener un fuente de ingreso en su hogar. Lo empezó con fondos propios y el negocio ha superado a través del uso de créditos de L25,000 y L30,000. 

Solicitó este crédito de L10,000 para la compra de blusas, faldas y pantalones para surtir su inventario. Su meta es seguir trabajando con créditos para que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Sra. Maripsa is 37 years old and lives in the neighborhood of El Centro in the town of Santa Cruz. She is a single mother and has two children (ages 8 and 15) who are in school.

Maripsa specializes in the sale of merchandise such as blouses, trousers, socks, skirts, and other items. She started her business right after her first child was born because she needed to have a source of household income. Maripsa established this business with her own funds and eventually utilized loans in the amounts of 25,000 HNL and 30,000 HNL.

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 in order to buy blouses, skirts, and trousers to restock her inventory. Her goal is to continue working with loans so that her business can keep growing.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, and trousers to restock her inventory.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria, tiene 55 años de edad, vive con su esposo y administra una tienda, lleva un año y lo fundó por la necesidad de tener en el hogar una entrada de dinero, cubriendo algunos gastos de ella y su pareja.
Actualmente solicitó un préstamo para comprar mercadería como azúcar, frijol, arroz, aceite, huevos, Pan, incrementando el inventario de mercadería y teniendo una mejor vistosidad para los clientes. Este préstamo será una gran ayuda tanto para María para su esposo ya que dependen de él.
La explicación de ella es fortalecer el negocio para mejorar la condición de vida y tener una mayor solidez de económica en cualquier circunstancia.
texts.en:
55-year old Maria lives with her husband. She has run a store out of her home for the past year and started the business because she needed money for household expenses. Maria is currently seeking a loan to buy merchandise such as sugar, beans, rice, oil, eggs, and bread so she has more goods to sell and a more enticing display for her customers. The loan will be a great help to both Maria and her husband.

Her plan is to build up the business so that they can improve their standard of living and have a more solid economic foundation.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, rice, oil, eggs, and bread

loans.name: Busayra

texts.en: Her first Kiva loan has helped Busayra to purchase cattle. Busayra also used the revenues from her loan to purchase seeds of tomatoes, eggplants and peppers and she was able to widen her business activities by land cultivating, which allowed her to earn about 10.000 KGS seasonally. Now she is applying for her second Kiva loan of 80.000 KGS for purchasing two bull-calves to fatten and resell.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Enhtur

texts.en: Enhtur is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife is a clerk, and his elder kid is a college student. His middle kid is a school student and younger one is a kindergarten student. He started his car repairing business in 2005. His educational background is engineering. Therefore, he's an excellent repairman. Now that his daughter joined college, he has to increase his income. He is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to buy an electric heater for his house.

loans.use: To buy an electric heater

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Mariana es socia del banco comunal Maluay, vive por la comunidad Maluay que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, y se caracteriza por la belleza de la naturaleza y su estructura arquitectónica que se mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente labora en el comercio, cría de animales y en la agricultura, también laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas.

Doña Mariana tiene 60 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, solteros y trabajan para sus gastos personales. Su esposo labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que viven es la recompensa del trabajo en su juventud.
 
La Señora. Mariana se dedica a la agricultura y  sus cosechas son para su consumo. A veces labra terrenos de otras personas cuando le llaman. También cria ganado y cuyes y en sus tiempo libre se dedica a tejer sombreros de paja toquilla.
 
Es socia fundadora  del banco comunal  y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y pollos para engordarles y venderlos.
 
Su sueño es  terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Mariana is a member of the Maluay communal bank. She lives near the community of Maluay, which is part of the Valle parish in Cuenca canton. This is a place with a cold climate, and is noted for the beauty of its natural setting, and for its architecture, which is a mix of the colonial and the modern. Its people have businesses, raise animals, and farm. They also work in the city in various livelihoods.

Mariana is 60, and married. She has three children who are now adults. They are single, and work to meet their personal expenses. Her husband is a farmer. The house where they live is the reward for the work of their youth.
 
Mariana is a farmer, and her harvests are for her own use.  Sometimes she works on other people's land when they call on her. She also raises livestock and guinea pigs, and in her free time weaves toquilla straw hats (also known as Panama hats). 

She is a founding member of the communal bank, and is going to use her new loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens to fatten and sell. Her dream is to finish her house.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es:
Jose es un joven e 25 años de edad. La vivienda de Jose se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad en la cual podemos encontrar muchos atractivos turísticos entre los cuales tenemos la laguna de Huacachina, asimismo se cultivan los productos como la uva, esparrago, algodón, entre otros. Desde muy pequeño a Jose le encantaba mirar como pintaban los autos y motos en un taller que estaba muy cerca a su casa, por ello con el transcurso de los años aprendió como se realizaba este trabajo, por ello actualmente trabaja como ayudante en una taller de pintado automotriz de su ciudad. Jose trabaja en dicho taller alrededor de 8 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar; el cree que esta saliendo adelante en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y realiza su trabajo con honestidad.

Jose está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una compresora para poder poco a poco iniciar su propio negocio de pintado automotriz, de esta manera tendrá la herramienta necesaria para realizar su trabajo y luchar por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y su propio negocio”.
texts.en:
Jose is a 25 year old man. Jose's house is located in the city of  Ica, a city with a lot of tourist attractions. Among them is Huacachina lake. They grow products such as grapes, asparagus, cotton and more. Since he was very young, Jose loved to see how cars and motorcycles were painted at a workshop that was close to his house. That is why over the years he learned how this job was done and now he works as an assistant at an auto painting workshop in town. Jose works in the workshop around 8 hours a day and with the money he earns he helps his parents with the household expenses. He thinks he is getting ahead at his job because he is very responsible and does his job honestly.     

Jose is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to buy a compressor to be able to start his own auto painting business little by little. This way, he will have the tools he needs to do his job and fight to make his biggest dream come true: "having a house and his own business."

loans.use: to buy a compressor

loans.name: Flor De Pino Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias microempresarias una de ellas es Juana mujer de 59 años de edad, soltera, con dos hijos de 23 y 30 años, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos, ropa y comida desde hace 30 años. Tiene 6 años de ser cliente de la institución, el crédito lo solicita para comprar zapatos de diferentes estilos usados, nuevos. ropa nueva como pantalones, camisas, camisetas, blusas, faldas, shores, etc. y una paca de ropa. Prudencia mujer de 52 años de edad su negocio es la venta de tortillas y María mujer 60 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de comida en su comunidad.
texts.en:
This group comprises three businesswomen. One of them is 59-year old Juana who is single and has two children aged 23 and 30. She has been selling cosmetics, clothing, and food for thirty years. Juana has been a client with this institution for six years. She is seeking a loan to buy used and new shoes in different styles, as well as new clothing such as pants, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, skirts, and shorts, and a bundle of used clothing.

The other members of the group are Prudencia who is 52 and sells tortillas, and María who is 60 and sells food in her neighbourhood.

loans.use: Buy used and new shoes and clothing

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Mrs. Gladys A. lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. A 41 years old married with three (3) children stated her business in the year 1997. She needs the above amount for her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en: Thanh is 42 years old. With her husband, Sanh, she has 4 children, aged 12, 10, 4 and 2. Thanh’s family has only a small hut. They do not have any land and no capital. Her husband is a daily laborer and often he cannot find any work, so much depends on Thanh’s fish selling. In the past they had to resort to moneylenders who charged 60%/year. But now she can borrow from the project and their income has increased from $8/person/month to $10. She wants a $50 loan to raise pigs.

loans.use: Pig farm

loans.name: Rang

texts.en: Rang is 40 years old. Her 46-year-old husband sells lottery tickets for a living. They have 2 sons, one in high school and one in secondary school. Rang  sells fruits and vegetables at the local market. Their income is $9 per person/month. Rang wants a loan of $75 so that she can increase the variety of fruits and vegetables that she offers for saL.. They will repay monthly.

loans.use: To offer a greater variety of fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her food selling business

loans.name: Kep

texts.en: Mrs. Kep T., 38, lives with her husband, 37 (pictured) in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Kep T. earns $3 a day making and selling sausages to people in her community. Her husband works buying and selling cows. She would like to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a motor-taxi service when he is not engaged in buying and selling cows. The couple expects that this will bring the family an extra $2 a day.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a motor-taxi service

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina D. is married with two children. Her family lives in the small town of Mikhailovka, Ukraine. Marina runs a small business selling cosmetics and perfumes in the local market. She is very friendly and amiable. Marina started her own venture four years ago; today she has about $4000 in inventory.

Marina is a very consistent entrepreneur. She is constantly trying to improve her business while making money in the process. She is always willing to take risks and accept rewards when they come. Marina believes that this loan of $500 will help her as she further develops her business and works to take it to the next level of long-term sustainability.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
A new business for each new year? In 2006 Emmy K. established a business raising and selling guinea fowl. In January 2007 she added another, selling soft drinks and snacks (like the yummy cakes in the photo). She requires a loan of $525 to purchase additional soft drinks and ingredients like flour, sugar, and eggs in bulk, so that she can increase the quantity and range of her goods. Emmy has already successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA and we eagerly await any business proposals for 2008…

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback arrangement as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are therefore termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional stock such as soft drinks and ingredients for her snacks

loans.name: Rohat

texts.en:
S. Rohat is 47 years old. She and her husband have three children, one of whom is married.

Rohat has been running her clothing store for three years. She sells and rents traditional wedding dresses including the national wedding dress. Traditionally families in Tajikistan are large. Consequently, there are lots of marriages and Rohat has a lot of clients. The stability of her business allows her to make a considerable contribution to the family’s income.

During the previous loan cycle she repaid the loan on time. Rohat is now requesting $300.00 in order to purchase a new wedding dress that she can rent to her clients. She gives her assurance that the loan will be fully paid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase a new wedding dress for rent.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
A few months ago, Carmen decided to invest the money, which cost her time and effort to set aside, in setting up a grocery and beverage store. At first, this business did not seem very lucrative, but little by little with her perseverance, the store yielded good economic benefits. She started out with a small amount of products in an inadequate business space, but now, thanks to her hard work and dedication, things have changed for the better. Her little store currently has many loyal customers, allowing her and her elderly father—who is her only relative—to enjoy financial stability and well-being. Carmen is planning to increase her stock, and for this reason, she is requesting this loan and your generous support. Your generosity can help crystallize Carmen’s dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace algunos meses Carmen, decidió invertir el dinero que le había costado mucho esfuerzo reunir durante mucho tiempo en su negocio de venta de abarrotes y variedad de bebidas, este negocio en un principio no parecía ser muy rentable, pero poco a poco con su constancia le fue trayendo buenos beneficios económicos. Inició con poca mercadería y en un local no muy adecuado, ahora gracias a su dedicación y empeño las cosas han cambiado. Actualmente su tiendita tiene gran cantidad de asiduos clientes permitiéndole así gozar de bienestar y tranquilidad económica en compañía de su anciano padre quien es su único familiar.Carmen tiene pensado ampliar y aumentar el stock de su mercadería, para eso requiere de tu apoyo desinteresado y hace la solicitud de un préstamo. Tu generosidad puede ayudar a cristalizar los sueños de Carmen”

loans.use: Purchase of greater quantity and variety of goods for general store

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is from village Lukavica, near town Gračanica. She was born in 1968 and she is divorced. She lives with her mother  and daughter, 16 years old. Fatima works as a season cook in Croatia and she can earn about 1500- 2000 Euro in a season. She will use this loan in the amount of 600 KM to build a greenhouse and buy seedlings for it. She wants a secure, safe business for the whole year and not just for a season.

loans.use: For greenhouse and seedlings.

loans.name: Sia's Utulivu 2 Group

texts.en:
Sia is 28 years old and is a married woman with one child who is 1 year old. Sia owns a small stationery store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $275 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business inventory. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Doreen, who has a business dealing in cloth sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business inventory

loans.name: Yrma Rosaura

texts.es:
From a very young age Yrma has been in retail. With much effort and the support of her husband, she saved a little capital that she put into the making and selling of hammocks. This has provided her with income to support her children and to afford their schooling.

Presently, she requests a loan of $250 that she will repay in three months to buy thread to make more hammocks. With your help, she will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Yrma desde muy temprana edad se dedica al comercio, y a base de mucho esfuerzo, y con ayuda de su esposo, logro juntar un pequeño capital el cual puso a trabajar en la elaboración y venta de hamacas, lo cual le permite tener un ingreso para mantener a sus hijos y poder costearles sus estudios.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar hilos para fabricar mas hamacas. Con tu ayuda ella saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of Supplies

loans.name: Vadim

texts.en:
Vadim D. is 21 years old. He lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan. He used to work on a collective farm, but now he is engaged in his own business raising and selling livestock. Mr. D. applied to MicroInvest in 2008 when he heard from his brother about its suitable and advantageous loan terms. Thanks to a previous loan he has already been able to significantly improve his existing business. The income stability it generated helped him to repay the previous loan and to qualify successfully for the next loan level.

Now Mr. D. is asking KIVA for a business development loan of $775.00 US to purchase a pedigreed bull.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Tagisia

texts.en: Tagisia T., 28, is married with one child. She has five years of experience in the keke puaa business, selling from her food stall to the villagers five days each week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  This is her first loan with SPBD; these SPBD loans are Tagisia’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan through traditional banks. This loan will assist her in buying supplies for her food stall making and selling keke puaa.

loans.use: Purchase stove, frying pan, oil and case of mutton flaps for her food stall.

loans.name: Hong Nhung Thi

texts.vi:
Since 2003, with supports from TYM, Mrs. Hong Nhung Thi N., a diligent woman, has been borrowing money for her projects on the family’s chicken farm. At the moment, in the farm there are 300 breeding chickens and 200 for-food ones. In order to improve the productivity of the farm, she constantly studies raising knowledge such as new prophylactic methods. Effectively using the money helps stabilizing the income and improving the family’s financial situation. Her husband is a retiree, whose pension is 1,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month, and shares her workload. Their 2 sons are going to school. Next time, she wants to borrow 19,000,000 Vietnamese Dong for new projects.

The family’s income is 5,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2003, chị Nguyễn Thị Hồng Nhung với bản chất là người phụ nữ chịu thương chịu khó, chị đã vào Quỹ để vay vốn phát triển kinh tế dự án chị đầu tư vốn là chăn nuôi gà. Hiên nay gia đình chị đang chăn 300 con gà giống và 200 con gà thịt, để có được hiệu quả kinh tế cao từ việc chăn nuôi gà bản thân chị luôn học hỏi kinh nghiệm trong chăn nuôi cũng như phòng chống các bệnh dịch định kỳ. Với việc đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi có hiệu quả nên kinh tế gia đình chị rất ổn định, chồng chị là cán bộ về hưu lương tháng 1.500.000đ và luôn cùng chị chia sẻ những công việc trong gia đình, 2 con chị hiện đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi gà.

Thu nhập bình quân 5000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising chickens

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy A. is married and has one child. Mercy sells a variety of clothing on the Cape Coast, which she has done since 2008. She is a hairdresser by profession and she owns a salon. Her husband is a driver. Mercy uses her income to provide for her children's education. Mercy will use the loan to increase the stock for sale and also purchase hair products for her salon. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mercy plans to help her husband to build a family house.
