loans.use: To increase stock and purchase hair products for her salon.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel es un comerciante de 31 años, que habita en el municipio de Montemorelos Nuevo León. <

> Actualmente solicita un préstamo por USD$325 a un plazo de cuatro meses para la compra de pantalones de mezclilla para su reventa. <

> La finalidad de la obtención del crédito es contar con recursos sufientes para surtir el negocio que inició hace dos años derivado de la necesidad de contar con más ingresos para los estudios de sus hijos. <

> ¡Los invito a que apoyemos a Abel para que puede obtener los recursos necesarios para la educación de sus hijos! <

>
texts.en:
Abel is a 31 year old merchant that lives in the municipality of Montemorelos Nuevo León.

At present he requests a loan of $325 for a period of four months for the purchase of jeans for resale.

The purpose of obtaining the credit is to have sufficient resources to supply the business that he started two years ago because he needs more income for the education of his children.

We invite you to support Abel so that he can obtain the necessary resources for the education of his children!


Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing for resale, especially jeans.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Mariée à Monsieur HOUNNOU Justin, chauffeur de profession, dame A. Jeanne de nationalité béninoise, est née vers les années 1968 dans le département du Mono  au sud-ouest du BENIN. Elle vend depuis 5 ans des feuilles, racines et des écorces d'arbres utilisées dans la médecine traditionnelle pour guérir plusieurs maux. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour s'approvisionner en feuilles et différentes racines de plantes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jeanne A. is a citizen of Benin and was born circa 1968 in the Mono Department (Southeast Benin). She's married to Mr. Justin HOUNNOU, a professional driver. Mrs. A. has been selling leaves, roots and tree barks, used in traditional medicine to heal several sicknesses. She's seeking this loan to purchase leaves and various plant roots.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 sacks of various tree roots and leaves

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. is a trader in the local market of Tema in the Greater Accra Region of Ghana, where she lives with her family. She is a 38-year-old married woman, with three children who are currently in school. She has been selling maize grain, plantain, cassava and other food from a table in the market for the past eight years. She does not have sufficient working capital to run the business, which hampers her business progress. With the loan, she wants to purchase increased stock to expand the business. She believes the loan will enable her to increase her savings to care for her children in school. She would be grateful for that assistance. She belongs to the group called ‘Morning Star’ Trust Group; members in this group provide assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: The purchase of increased stock of cassava, fresh tomatoes, onions, beans, maize, dried fish etc.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora's family lives in Brgy. Fermeldy Tumauini, Isabela. Teodora and her husband Felipe have five children- three that are in high school, and two who are  high school graduates.

Teodora goes around the village to sell vegetables and other food items, and Felipe tills their farm land. Their combined income is not enough to support their family. Teodora would like to buy additional variety of products to sell in the community. She will need PHP 3,000 to do this but does not have excess money so she is applying a loan to a local financial institution which has a branch in their town. The money will be used to purchase different kinds of vegetables, chicken, fish, pig, and beef which will be sold in the community.

With the increase in their income, she expects to have her own stall and provide a good education to their children.

loans.use: buy various vegetables, meats for sale in the village

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the Imasumacc (“How Beautiful” in Quechua) Village Bank. She is 43 years old and married with eight children. Marcelina has a store where she sells grains and dry goods. She runs the store from her home in the city of Palmapampa, which is located eight hours from the city of Ayacucho in the Ayacuchan jungle. Marcelina also has a small store in her home in the city of Ayacucho. Marcelina needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy general dry goods, like rice and sugar.  Marcelina dreams of saving money for her children’s education, of finishing construction on her house, and of improving her business. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal Imasumacc. 
Marcelina es casada, tiene 43 años y 8 hijos, Marcelina tiene una tienda en su casa que se ubica en la ciudad D. Palmapampa que se ubica a 8 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, en la selva ayacuchana, en donD. venD. cereales y abarrotes. Además Marcelina tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa D. Ayacucho. 
Marcelina necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. abarrotes en general. 
Marcelina sueña con ahorrar para educar a sus hijos, construcción D. su casa y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Buying rice, sugar, and other dry goods

loans.name: Hatuchokani Group

texts.en:
Safia has been a food (bites and chips) seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 10 months. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $35. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more breads for her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business, save money and pay school fees for her children. Safia is 27 years old, married and has five children ages 10, 9, 3 and 2 years, and the youngest 6 months.

Safia will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Asha and Halima. Each woman has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more bread for her food business.

loans.name: Porvenir Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a traves de la Sra.Daniela B. Lezcano, quien se entero acerca de la Fundacion y del programa a traves de una persona que es cliente de la Fundacion del Programa de Comite de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Podemos hablar de la Sra. Angela R., tiene 54años, tiene 5 hijos ella es una mujer sacrificada y sola su esposo habia fallecido en accidente, desde ese momento ella asume la responsabilidad de ser mamá y papá, ella vende mate y terere en la terminal de omnibus de Asuncion.A las 4:00 de madrugada se va al mercado a traer los remedios yuyos para su mate y terere, hace 15 años que esta en el mismo puesto este trabajo lo realiza desde las 5:00 hasta hasta las 11:00 de la mañana. Su hijo mayor le ayuda y prepara para el almuerzo para los miembros de su familia.
Por la tarde ña Angela hace torta y lo vende en los almacenes de su barrio,y dice que grcias a este programa ella esta saliendo adelante.

Nombre y Apellido	Actividad
Daniela B. L.	Vta de Ropa
Myrian M. C.. 	Vta de Remedio Yuyo
Cynthia R. L..	Vta de Cosmetico
Felicita R. G. 	Vta de Ropa
Natalia R.R. 	Vta de Ropa

Edith Y. R. G.	Vta de Lenceria 
Angela R. M.	Vta de Mate y Terere
Diana A.C. G. 	Vta de Lenceria
Wilma G. S. 	Vta de Bijouteri
Marta N.G. de B..
	Vta de Comida.
Susana M.Y. de S. 	Vta de Frutas
Ramona C.R. N.	Copetin
Delcy G.B. R.	Vta de Zapatilla
Gisela C. U. C. 	Vta de Bijouteri
Maria A. P. de S. 	Vta de Comida. 
Elizabeth G. E.	Vta de Diario
texts.en:
This group was created by Daniela B. Lezcano who heard of the Fundacion and the programme from someone who is a client of the Fundacion del Programa de Comite de Mujeres Emprendedoras [Foundation for the Enterprising Womens' Group Programme]. We can tell you about Angela R. who is 54 years old and has five children. She is a self-sacrificing woman who on her own - her husband having died in an accident - had to assume the responsibility for her children and become both mother and father to them. She sells mate and terere [both are traditional herbal teas or drinks] at the omnibus terminal of Asuncion. At 4:00 A.M. she goes to the market to bring her herbal remedies for her mate and terere. She has been in the same spot for 15 years now, working from 5:00 A.M. to 11:00 A.M. Her eldest son helps her and prepares breakfast for the other members of the family. In the afternoons Angela makes pie and sells them in the stores of her neighbourhood. She says that thanks to this programme she has been able to make progress. Name Activity Daniela B. L. sells clothing Myrian M. C.. sells herbal remedies Cynthia R. L.. sells cosmetics Felicita R. G. sells clothing Natalia R.R. sells clothing Edith Y. R. G. sells lingerie Angela R. M. sells mate and terere (herbal drinks) Diana A.C. G. sells lingerie Wilma G. S. sells jewelry Marta N.G. de B. sells food Susana M.Y. de S. sells fruit Ramona C.R. N. sells snacks Delcy G.B. R. sells sneakers Gisela C. U. C. sells jewelry Maria A. P. de S. sells food Elizabeth G. E. sells newspapers

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: clothing such as shirts, blouses, shirts, pants, shorts, snack sales: sandwiches, pie, tortilla, seafood and drinks; shoe sales: shoe designs and multicolored shoes

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es: El señor Luís Humberto N. tiene la edad 43 años habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla , junto a su esposa ella trabaja como cajera en una tienda , para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar ya que tiene a su cargo dos hijos que actualmente estudian su primaria , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , el trabaja como gestor de cobro en la pintura sur , desde hace diez años , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento ya que con su salario y el de su esposa no pueden cubrir los gastos de construcción , los cual el pide financiamiento para terminar de construir y comprar los materiales necesarios para dicha construcción y poder tener una casa digna.
texts.en:
Señor Luís Humberto N. is 43 and lives in the Juna Ramón Padilla neighborhood with his wife, who works as a cashier in a store to support him with their home's expenses since they have two children who are in primary school. His plans for his family are to improve their living conditions. He has worked as a collector for ten years. The most difficult part of his job is the lack of financing since with his wages and those of his wife, they can't cover the construction costs. This is why they are asking for financing to finish building and to buy the necessary construction materials to be able to have a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to finish their house

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Mrs. Angelie A. is presently living at Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, and married with two children.
One day, the Local Government Unit in their municipality facilitated a seminar in raising poultry. Mrs A. and her husband grabbed the opportunity, attending the seminar and applying the thing they learned, which was a big help for them. At the start, she raised 25 hens and 3 roosters with the help of her husband and kids, although she encountered some difficulties in terms of the maintenance and in raising the poultry. As time passed they learned the secrets in raising poultry and they now reap the fruits of their hard work and labor. At present they are able to save money for the education of their children and able to meet daily necessities because they already have avid customers such as restaurants, carenderias and local residents.
Her membership with Paglaum MPC helps her in terms of the finances for the maintenance of the poultry farm.

loans.use: to purchase additional native hens

loans.name: Kvetoslava

texts.en:
Kvetoslava lives with her daughter in Mukachevo city. She has owned her own business for the past six years. Kvetoslava is an honest person, and treats her clients with respect. She offers a wide range of products at an affordable and manageable price. Her customers are always satisfied with their experience.

Kvetoslava is requesting a loan to increase her inventory range. She hopes to increase sales and expand her business further with this loan.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
V. Nguyễn Thị is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, V. owns and operates a business venture raising livestock. Tthe main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. V. has been engaged in this business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, V. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. V. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. V. is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by V. from TYM Fund. V. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Jesús Gilberto

texts.es:
El señor Jesús Gilberto V. está muy agradecido por el gran apoyo que le brindaron con su anterior préstamo.
 Nueva mente está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de material ya que le están solicitando que participe un concurso estatal de proyectos de construcción, el cual le ayudara mucho ha tener mas trabajo y ingresos para su familia.
El desea participar en este concurso por el cual está solicitando su cooperación y así poder participar.
texts.en:
Jesús Gilberto V. is very grateful for the great support he was given with his previous loan. He is asking for a new loan to buy material. They are asking that he participate in making a public tender for state construction projects. This would greatly help him to have more work and income for his family. He wants to submit a tender. That is why his is asking for your cooperation, to be able to participate.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material

loans.name: Khardiata

texts.fr: khardiata S. est parent beneficiaire et commercante en habillement .elle capitalise une dizaine d'annees d'experience dans ce domaine.voulant satisfaire les sollicitations de clientele'khardiata S. sollicite un pret de 100 000frs pour elargir son marche.
texts.en:
Khardiata S. is a client parent, and she is a clothing merchant. She capitalizes on a dozen years of experience in this field. Wanting to satisfy customer requests, she is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to expand her market.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 38 years old and he is living in Barangay Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. Due to difficulties in his life, Richard was not able to pursue his college education and ended up finishing at high school level. He is still single and he dreams of having a successful life someday for his family. He wisely uses his time to earn a living by operating a tricycle transport business in their village.

Through his business, he is able to support his parents and sustain their daily needs at home and also with the education of his younger siblings. Aside from his tricycle, he is also hoping to have a little store to be managed by his mother so that they have another source of income. In this regard, he is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 12,000 that he will use for the maintenance of his tricycle and, hopefully, to start a village store. He believes that someday his business will grow through the continuous support of the lenders.

loans.use: To use for the maintenance of his tricycle and, hopefully, to start a village store

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is 70 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children who are all out of school. She lives with her husband and some of her children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. She is a trader. She deals in bags of salt. Georgina sells at the market square and hawks to sell in her community. She treks to other towns to sell on their market days as well. She has been in business for 30 years and wants a loan to buy bags of salt in bulk to increase her stock. She aspires to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy bags of salt

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: preparation and sale of beans

loans.name: Dolores Alejandra

texts.es: Dolores Alejandra Meléndez se dedica a la venta de candelas y veladoras. Tiene la edad de 47 años. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Dolores tiene que ofrecer sus productos a los departamentos ya que tiene ciertos clientes que le compran sus productos al por mayor,  lo que le resulta mucho más favorable. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, es una mujer que logrado adquirir experiencia y que ha enfrentado muchas dificultades como son los problemas de salud ya que algunas veces no puede recorrer lugares muy distantes, pero a pesar de este problema ha luchado por salir adelante. Ella solicita este crédito para capital de materia prima. Su deseo es comprar una camioneta para el uso de su negocio
texts.en:
Dolores Alejandra Meléndez, 47, has been selling candles for over 20 years. Dolores has to offer her products to the departments because she has certain customers who buy her products wholesale. This turns out to be much more favorable for her. She is a street vendor. She is a woman who has gained experience, and she has encountered many difficulties like health problems. Sometimes she cannot travel to places very far away. In spite of this problem, she has fought to succeed. She is asking for a loan for raw materials. Her wish is to buy a small van to use in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet A. is 34 years old, married and has three children. She makes a living selling drinks, and has been in this business for many years. She lives with her family in Edo State, Nigeria, and has applied for a loan to buy more drinks to sell. She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks  to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase milk in bulk

loans.name: Joy's Group

texts.en: Joy N. is 35 years old and the leader of her group in Rukungiri. She is married and has five children with ages ranging from 15 years to 1 year old. Joy operates and owns a chemical shop in Rwenshaka that generates 100,000 USH per month in profits. She would like a loan of 300,000 USH to purchase more inventory and expand her product offerings. Her future business goals include expanding to several of the other local towns and her personal hope is to be able to pay for the educations of all her children.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes R. operates a business selling goods in a store at the school canteen in her village. She also raises hogs in their backyard. Her husband's source of income is from farming and he also helps Agnes in the hog raising business. At the age of 33, she already has four children. One is in high school and the other three are all in elementary school.

Agnes wants to access a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders to develop and maintain her piggery business. Agnes dreams of developing her business as a source of income to meet the immediate needs of her family. She wants her children to continue their education and finish their studies. Their education is their future – Agnes says that she does not have wealth to give her children other than education.

loans.use: Additional capital to maintain her piggery

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel D. is from the village of Zone 2, Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 36 years old. Samuel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Samuel owns and operates a business venture, buying and selling gold dust in the local community. He engages in gold mining in the traditional way. Samuel has been involved in his business for over five years and earns approximately $107 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Samuel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Samuel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Samuel is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This will be his 4th loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of his family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand his product offering

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Eva Mercedes

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Eva Mercedes H. con mucho esfuerzo se ha dedicado a atender su propia pulpería la que posee desde hace nueve años siendo esta la que le permite obtener los ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos de pulpería como lo son los comestibles tales como golosinas, galletas y otros y también lo utilizará para la compra de periódicos porque también los vende en su localidad. Con este crédito se beneficiará grandemente y logrará mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Eva Mercedes H. lives in the department of León, where she has run a small grocery store for the past 9 years, that has produced earnings to benefit her family. She requests funding to buy stock items for her store like: sweets, cookies and others as well as newspapers that she also stocks. This loan will greatly benefit her because it will allow her to improve the conditions of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy store stock items and newspapers.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine G. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 28 years old. Josephine is married. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Josephine has been engaged in her business for several years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase young livestock to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 44 years old and is a wife and the mother of four kids. Two of her children are in school while the others are learning a trade. She lives together with her family in a community in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Theresa is a very hardworking woman who supports her husband in taking care of the children.

Theresa enjoys selling goods in the business where she makes a living. She has been selling foodstuffs like tubers of yam, cassava, vegetables and plantains for ten years now to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of goods from the farmers, which saves her from intermediaries who buy from the farmers and resell to her at a higher price.

Theresa wants to use the loan to buy yam, cassava, plantain, vegetables, etc., in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school and would be grateful for your assistance.

In this year, 2010, Theresa has set a goal of increasing her savings for future eventualities.

loans.use: To buy yam, cassava, plantain, vegetables, etc., in bulk

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo es socio del Banco Comunal Kallpanchik que significa Nuestra Fuerza en quechua. 
Bernardo es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 2 hijos, Bernardo compra y vende ganados de las diferentes ferias de la región, sus ventas los realiza en la ciudad de Ayacucho y Lima a donde viaja su esposa. Además Bernardo tiene mototaxis las cuales alquila.
Bernardo necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido para repotenciar sus motos.
Los sueños de Bernardo son tener mas capital, comprar un carro para transportar el ganado.
texts.en:
Bernardo is a member of the Communal Bank "Kallpanchik", which means "Our Strength" in Quechua. Bernardo is 43, has 2 children, and lives with his common-law wife. He buys and sells cattle from the various fairs held in the area. He sells the cattle in Ayacucho and Lima, where his wife makes trips. In addition, Bernardo owns mototaxis [taxis built on a motorcycle frame] which he rents out. Bernardo needs a loan of 900 Peruvian Soles, and this money will be invested in the reconditioning of his mototaxis. Bernardo's dreams are to have more working capital and to buy a vehicle for transporting his cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reconditioning of mototaxis

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”,  Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 26 años y es madre de 01 lindo bebe, que aun dependen de ella, presenta Estudios Superiores, Auxiliar en Contabilidad. 

Carmen Rosa, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, hace 05 años viene dedicándose a la  venta de chupetes, ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes, que a día a día la frecuentan, por el sabor rico que le pone a sus chupetes.  Nos cuenta que en la actualidad se siente muy contenta, ya que su negocio le esta yendo muy bien. Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles  compró frutas, cajas de leche, azúcar, etc.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles ,comprará ingredientes para la preparación de sus chupetes  como azúcar en kilos,  cajas de leche y frutas que a diario necesita para la preparación de los chupetes, a diario cuenta con sus productos surtidos, para así poder captar una mayor clientela. 

Carmen Rosa, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen Rosa belongs to the community bank "Las Brisas" (The Breezes) in the district and province of Bellavista, department of San Martin. She lives with her partner, is 26 years old, and is the mother of a beautiful baby boy, who depends on her. She has a higher education as an Accounting Assistant. Carmen Rosa is a very hard-working and enterprising woman. For five years she has been selling popsicles from her own home, in an environment that is very well-equipped for serving her customers, who visit her daily for the rich flavor of her popsicles. She tells us that she is currently very happy since her business is going very well. With her first loan of 300 new soles, she bought fruit, cartons of milk, and sugar, etc. With this loan of 3,000 new soles, she will buy ingredients for the preparation of her popsicles, such as sugar in kilos, cartons of milk, and fruit that she needs daily for the preparation of the popsicles. She needs an assortment of products daily to attract the best clientele. Carmen Rosa feels strengthened to keep working, and perservering day by day. She is thankful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Manuela Ramos Movement) for helping women like her have opportunities to develop themselves in the middle of their circumstances.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the preparation of popsicles

loans.name: Thelma's Group

texts.en:
Thelma S. is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is forty-two years old. Thelma is the group leader of a thirteen-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Thelma is married. To make a living, She owns and operates a general store in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Thelma has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Thelma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thelma  successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. She used this previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. Thelma is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will Thelma's ninth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-five branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Wayna Ccapac Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “WAYNA CCAPAC”, actualmente se encuentra en el V ciclo y esta conformado por 10 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en la provincia D. Urubamba del departamento Cusco.  Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su Centro Histórico, sus paisajes, su historia siendo una ciudad encantadora D. la Región Sur del país.

Las actividades económicas D. los socios a las que se dedican son el comercio como por ejemplo venta D. medicamentos, venta D. productos secos, venta D. animales menores como pollos y cuyes, venta comestible y venta D. bebidas alcohólicas como la chicha y otros brindan servicio D. azafata. El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos D. funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios D. crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo D. permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto D. valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad D. capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Yessica es socia nueva del banco comunal Wayna Ccapac, tiene 28 años D. edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo, ella se dedica a la venta D. medicamentos. La socia Yessica nos cuenta que hoy en día en el Perú es difícil encontrar trabajo permanente pero como ella es una mujer joven y emprendedora decidió abrir su propio negocio y así D. esta manera ayudar al ingreso económico del hogar, ella requiere el crédito para comprar más medicamentos. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (Los socios Reynaldo y Sonia no están en la fotografía porque pedieron permiso a la junta directiva para no estar presentes el día del desembolso).
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Wayna Ccapac” is currently in its fifth loan cycle and consists of ten hardworking and enterprising individuals who view each moment as an opportunity to get ahead. Through their daily efforts, they are able to proviD. a better future for their children. The members of the Communal Bank live in the Province and Department of Cusco. Cusco is a city known for its Historical Center, its landscapes, and its history for being one of the most enchanting cities in the southern part of the country.

The business activities of the members incluD. selling medicines, dry goods, small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs, groceries, alcoholic beverages such as “chicha”, or providing hostess services. The Communal Bank has participated in various loan cycles and the members are content and satisfied with the loans, savings, and training sessions. One ongoing aspect of the Communal Bank that is of value is the group savings account that opens the possibility for building up assets, which is what this service provides.

Yessica is a new member of the Communal Bank “Wayna Ccapac”. She is 28 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Yessica earns a living by selling medicines. She says that it is difficult today in Peru to find permanent work, but she is an enterprising young woman who decided to open her own business so that she could help generate household income. She needs a loan to buy more medicines.

The members are grateful for this opportunity and commit to making their payments on time. (Members Reynaldo and Sonia do not appear in the photograph because they received permission from the directors to be absent on the day the funds were disbursed.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase medicines

loans.name: Reyna Ester

texts.es:
la sra. Reyna Ester L. P. tiene siete años de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de donas.
ha sabido administrar su negocio porque se a convertido en una micro empresa donde paga dos empleados para que le ayuden a la produccion de las donas. una mujer que le  ayuda a la elaboración del producto y un hombre quien es el encargado de distribuir el producto.
Su especialidad es fabricar Donas con cerezas tambien fabrica Donas con Azúcar de diferentes tamaños, y los Relámpagos, todas de un sabor exquisito.
Doña Reyna ya tiene los clientes con quienes tiene contrato permanente y todo el producto que elabora solo lo entrega y no sale a venderlo. algunos de sus clientes son las dueñas de casetas de algunos centros de estudio de nuestra ciudad.
Doña Reyna vive en unión libre y su compañero de hogar trabaja como guardia de seguridad de la Armería con quien procreo 5 hijos pero 2 ya se le casaron y otros 2 trabajan y ya solo tienen la obligación de una niña a la cual le cubren todos los gastos.

Doña Reyna, invertira el crédito en la compra de: Harina, manteca, azúcar, choco , huevos, polipel, margarina, sal y levadura
texts.en:
Reyna has been making and selling donuts for the past seven years. She has done a good job managing her business, and has grown it into a small company. She has two employees who help her make her products and one gentleman who delivers them. Her specialty is cherry donuts. She also makes different sizes of sugar donuts and éclairs. All are delicious. Reyna has contracts with customers to whom she delivers her entire production, so there is no need for her to go out and sell. Some of her clients own kiosks in schools within the city. She lives with her domestic partner who works as a security guard. They have had five children, two of which are married and on their own, and two others work. They only need to support their daughter. Reyna will use the money from this loan to buy flour, lard, sugar, chocolate, eggs, margarine, salt, and yeast.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Tuongozane Group

texts.fr:
Mwadji M. est présidente du groupe de crédit Tuongozane, elle lève sa main sur la photo, cliente au 13e cycle, âgée de 50 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants parmi lesquels 3 étudient  dans un centre de formation professionnelle en mécanique auto et 2 font l’école normale, et 2 autres restent au village et font les travaux des champs, 1 enfant n’etudie pas . Son mari exerce le petit commerce.
Elle  a commencé son petit commerce  avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Ce capital lui a permis d’acheter un bidon d’huile d’une valeur de 12$. Son business est de vendre l’huile de palme dans le  marché cental de Virunga . Il y a 8 ans qu’elle exerce cet activité de vente d’huile de palme.
Avec  le crédit de  l’IMF Hekima,  Mwadji M. souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achétant  24 bidons d’huile de palme et 30 paires des souliers en plastic.
Mwadji M. vend également des souliers en plastic localement appelle Bodaboda ou soza pour accroitre son revenu.
Dans l’avenir, elle planifie de changer  l’activite et faire le commerce général et  s’approvisionner en Ouganda- Kampale. 
Et plus tard construire confortablement sa maison. 
Mwadji M. rémércie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grace à ces crédits, elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants
En plus, Mwadji M.  est restée longtemps loin de ses enfants suite à la guerre en RDCongo, grace  au credit de l’IMF Hekima, elle  a aisement payé le transport  d’avion de ses enfants de Buyimayi jusqu’à Goma.
Ce groupe Tuongozane est  composé de 20 membres majoritairement femmes.
texts.en:
Mwadji M. is president of the Tuongozane credit loan group (she is seen raising her hand on the picture). She is in her 13th credit loan cycle, is 50 years old and the mother of eight children, of whom three study in an auto mechanics training centre, two in the standard school system, two stay in the village and work in the fields, and one does not attend school. Her husband runs a small business. She began her own business with funds received from her husband. With this starting capital she purchased a container of palm oil worth $12. Her business is retailing palm oil at the central market in Virunga, which she has done for the past eight years. With the loan from the Hekima MFI Mwadji M. wants to increase her turnover by purchasing 24 containers of palm oil and 30 pairs of plastic sandals. She also sells plastic sandals locally called “bodaboda” or “soza” to increase her income. For the future, she plans to change activities and go into general commerce, getting her supplies from Kampala in Uganda. Eventually, she wants to build a comfortable home. Mwadji M. thanks the Hekima MFI for the loans she has received although she had no collateral, because they enabled her to meet her children’s needs. What’s more, she was separated for quite some time from her children due to the war in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), and the Hekima loans allowed her to pay for her children’s plane fare from Buyimayi to Goma.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 24 containers of palm oil and 30 pairs of plastic sandals

loans.name: Maria Gladys

texts.es:
Maria tiene 56 años D. edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, D. los 
cuales su hija mayor se encuentra en la Universidad. Ella se dedica a la venta D. 
comida la cual la lleva a las fábricas y a los fundos D. la zona, inicio el negocio 
hace 3 años con un capital pequeño. Inicio con un número pequeño D. clientes, pero 
con la buena sazón y los buenos precios, el número D. clientes ha ido en aumento. El  
sueño D. Maria es poder ayudar a sus hijos a realizar sus sueños D. estudio y que así 
ellos puedan realizarse y tener un mejor porvenir, por este motivo es que inicio el 
negocio y así poder ayudar a los gastos familiares, solicita el crédito para la compra 
D. una cocina y cambio D. alacenas.
texts.en:
Maria is 56 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and their two children; the elder child attends the University. Maria sells food which she takes to the factories and farms in the area. She started the business three years ago with a small amount of capital. She began with just a few customers, but with good seasoning and good prices, she has gained more customers. Maria's dream is to be able to help her children with their dreams of studying so they can have a better future. This is why she started the business, and also so she can help with household expenses. She is asking for the loan to buy a stove and some new cabinets.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a stove

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus repairs electronics in Naivasha town.  He is 28 years old, married to Emily M. and they have one child.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He used the first loan of Kshs 38,000 to buy a new set of tools which he paid well and on time.  He plans to use this loan to buy copper wire and a grider machine. The grider machine is used to cut through steel and metallic materials.

Justus plans to become a big player in the repair of electronics in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy copper wire and a grider machine

loans.name: Sherhon

texts.ru: Алихонов Шерхон проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 32 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Шерхон имеет средне - специальное образование, шофер. Более 12 лет занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшой коровник, где разводит скот. Кроме того он предоставляет услугу, занимается вспашкой земель на своем тракторе. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Sherhon A. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 32 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife is a homemaker. Sherhon has a secondary-specialized education as a driver. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 12 years and a small cowshed, where he breeds livestock. Besides this, he also provides a service of plowing land with his tractor. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni, de 42 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo Rafael (55) y de  sus jóvenes hijos.Se dedica a la atención en su salón de belleza, el cual esta ubicado en su casa. En ese lugar ofrece el  servicio de corte de cabello, teñidos, ondulaciones, laceados, entre otros. Ya cuenta con una gran clientela, gracias a su buen trabajo y carisma en el trato al cliente. Además se siente contenta realizando su trabajo, es por esta razón, que tiene gran cantidad de clientes los cuales la prefieren ante la competencia. En su negocio tiene una gran vitrina donde ofrece variedad de productos de belleza, los cuales al ser tan vistosos y bien ubicados tienen bastante salida, es por eso que sus ganancias son regulares. En el futuro desea equipar  mejor su salón de belleza y contratar a una ayudante para mejorar  su trabajo.Es el primer  préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con los pagos de sus cuotas.Marleni tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado en la compra de  algunos productos para realizar mejor sus peinados, y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Marleni, 42, lives in her own house with her husband, Rafael, 55, and her young children. She runs a beauty salon in her home. She offers haircuts, hair coloring, hair waving and hair straightening among other services. She has quite a few regular customers thanks to her good customer service. She is happy doing her work and this is why she has so many customers that prefer her over the competition. She has a large display case in her salon where she offers a variety of beauty products which, thanks to being so well displayed and well situated, sell well; her profits, therefore, are regular. In the future, she would like to equip her beauty salon better and to hire an assistant to improve her work. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. Marleni plans to use the requested funds to buy beauty products to improve her hair treatments and obtain better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to improve her business.

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhoeun L. and her husband, Mr. Sophal Mov, live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2001 and have two sons, one of whom attends school while the other one is still young. The couple has been operating a silk-weaving business for more than ten years. They sell their products to the middleman in the village who then, in turn, sells in Phnom Penh or other places. Sokhoeun has obtained a Kiva loan one time already. She how is requesting another loan, in the amount of $700, to purchase silk material for continuing her weaving business. She will also use a part of the loan to help finance her mother’s business selling roasted beef and boiled duck eggs.

loans.use: To purchase more silk material for her weaving business and to finance her mother's business

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella A. is from the village of Siare, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 58 years old and married with 6 adult-aged children.

To make a living Estrella sells fish. Estrella has been engaged in her business for 23 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Estrella joined PMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC which she used to purchase additional products to sell.

Estrella is requesting her fifth loan, for 20000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional inventory. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Las Dalias Group

texts.es: Este grupo esta conformado por Doña Faustina Diaz que es la lider de este grupo, doña Teresa Parzan y tomasa B., las tres son mujeres de negocios, doña teresa parzan se dedica a la venta de leña ademas hace comales de barro en su casa y los pone a la venta, doña Tomasa Borror,hace costuras de cortes san juaneros y los vende, Doña Faustina D. se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica, toda clase de blusas, cortes, delantales, guipiles, ella vende en su casa y sale a vender fuera, ahora quiere surtir un poc mas su negocio es por eso que esta solicitando este nuevo credito ya que nos cuenta que quiere invertir en ropa un poco fina que la que le estan pidiendo mas, para asi aumentar sus ventas y satisfacer a todo sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of Faustina Diaz; the group leader; Teresa Parzan, and Tomasa Borar. The three of them are businesswomen. Teresa Parzan sells firewood. She also makes and sells "comales" (clay dishes for making tortillas). Tomasa Borrar makes and sells typical clothing of San Juan Sacatepequez. Faustina sells typical clothes, all types of blouses, traditional Mayan skirts, aprons, and ponchos. She sells in her house, and she also sells away from home. She now wants to stock her business a little more. That is why she is requesting this new loan. She tells us that she wants to buy clothes a little softer, which are being asked for more. That way she will increase her sales and satisfy all of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: El Sr. Santos vive en la localidad de el Torno, Barrio Libertad, de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, distante a 39 km, su actividad es el transporte de pasajeros, también se dedica a la educación en colegios de la localidad, es profesor hace 10 años, es soltero, vive en la casa de sus padres, con una hermana, después de la muerte de sus padres, el se quedo administrando la casa y se encarga también de los gastos del hogar, el crédito solicitado es para comprar un motor para su motocicleta,  el es el que se quedo como padre de su hermanos, por tal motivo tiene que trabar duro para sacar adelante a su familia y así mejorar la calidad de vida de todos sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Señor Santos lives in the town of El Torno in the Libertad neighborhood, 39 km from the city of Santa Cruz. He works transporting passengers and has also been a teacher in the schools in his town for 10 years. He is single and lives in his parent's house with his sister. After his parents died, he stayed to manage the house and took over the household expenses. He will use the loan he is requesting to buy a motor for his motorcycle. He is all that remains as a parent to his siblings. It is for this reason that he works hard to provide for his family and improve the quality of life for all of his loved ones.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motor for his motorcycle

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es: Ada Luz de 28 años, es casada y juntos tienen un hijo a su cargo. Su negocio consiste en la compra y venta de cerdos, recuerda que se inició desde pequeña por sus padres, pero al poco tiempo notó que este negocio tenía mucha demanda, desde luego que siguió con esta actividad. Actualmente  su negocio es la principal fuente de ingresos económicos, además tiene más de 3 años con este negocio ya que siempre esta brindado un buen servicio y esto les gusta a sus clientes. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de su local. Este es su primer crédito se encuentra muy emocionada por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando durante las fechas establecidas. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de cerdos.
texts.en:
Ada Luz is 28 years old, married, and has one child under her care. Her business consists of buying and selling pigs. She recalls starting in this business as a little girl with her parents, but she soon noticed that this type of activity has great demand, so she continued with this business on her own. Currently her business is the main source of her income. Ada Luz has had her business for more than three years and she always provides good service that her customers enjoy. Her plan for the future is to expand her business and improve its conditions.

This is the first loan she has received and she is very excited. She promises to complete her payments on the established due dates. With this loan she requested, Ada Luz plans to invest in the purchase of pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire pigs

loans.name: 02.05.17 Group

texts.en:
Luan L. T. (15) is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Thieu Hoa Thanh Hoa.  luan is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 17 (02.05.17).


Luan is married and has 3 adult children.  To make a living, Luan operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cattL. for saL..  Luan has been engaged in this business for over 30 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2002, Luan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Luan has successfully repaid a previous loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  This will be the 20th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Luan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  L. T. Thoan (39) is a 60-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 8.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  N. T. Bon (30) is a 51-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


luan L. T. (15) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thieu Hoa Thanh Hoa.  luan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 17 (02.05.17).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  luan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 30 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, luan kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND.  Vào 2002, luan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  luan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 20th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. thoan (39) là 60 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 8.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. T. bon (30) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en:
Rodelia G. is a widow  who lives in Purok 3, Talavera, Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating one business venture: a Ready-to-Wear business.  She has three children who are 24 to 30 years old. 

Rodelia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 3 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rodelia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 4th loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future. 

Rodelia G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction material to finish building an outside wall to protect her house

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 41 años, es madre soltera, una mujer muy trabajadora y jovial, vive en su casa que le fue heredada en compañía de su hijo de 19 años. En la actualidad estudia en la universidad pública, la carrera de educación, conveniente para vender joyas en fantasía fina y cosméticos de marcas muy reconocidas en el mercado, negocio que le va muy bien, por lo que se siente muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza. Lo que más le agrada es aconsejar a sus clientes las aplicaciones que debe usar para cada cosmético, así como las joyas que deben comprar. En un inicio vendía éstos productos por catalogo pero no le resultó, desde entonces prefiere llevar la mercadería consigo para ir a mostrarles a sus clientes. Lleva 5 años y medio en este negocio por lo que anhela incrementar su capital y tener stock en cosméticos. Este es su crédito número 19 con MFP, y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas como hasta hoy, ya que le es de mucha utilidad para el incremento de su capital. Con el crédito que solicitó, comprará productos de belleza y joyas, para abastecer los pedidos pendientes que le hacen sus compañeras de la universidad.
texts.en:
Teresa, 41, is a hard working, jovial single mother that lives in her house, which she inherited, with her 19 year old son.  She is currently studying Education at the Public University which is very convenient for her to sell costume jewelry and well-known brand cosmetics.  She does quite well and feels quite happy with the work she does.

What she likes best about the work is advising her customers about the best way to use each cosmetic as well as the jewels they buy.  At the beginning she started out in catalogue sales but this did not have good results for her and since then she prefers to have the merchandise in her possession in order to show it to customers.

She has been in this business for five and a half years and she wishes to increase her capital having more cosmetics to stock.  This is her 19th loan with MFP and she commits to repay as she has done to date because it is very useful to increase capital.

She will use the requested loan to buy more beauty products and jewelry to fill pending orders her fellow university students have placed.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and jewelry  to have more variety to offer her customers.

loans.name: Akylbek

texts.en:
Akylbek B. is the very attentive father of four children. He applies every effort to give them a prosperous future. He was born in Ak-Bulun  village, where he still lives with his tight-knit family. After graduating from secondary school and serving in the army, he returned home and got a job at a local farm. Akylbek worked as a truck driver for 15 years, but after the breakdown of the Soviet Union, he lost his job. Like many people in this situation, Akylbek decided to start his own business in cattle breeding. 

Using his starting capital of 3500 KGS, he purchased a milk cow, and owing to his persistent and hardworking personality, Akylbek managed to multiply his investments. Currently, his farm has three cows, twenty sheep, three bull calves and three horses.
 
Akylbek plans to use this loan of 60000 KGS to increase the number of cattle for fattening and reselling. With the revenues, he plans to finance his son's wedding and give a good education to the younger children.
  
In the future, Akylbek plans to develop a big farm that he can pass on to his children and future grandchildren.
 
Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. It uses Kiva funding to target especially vulnerable populations. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Naseem Mai's Group

texts.en:
Naseem mai lives in Multan, a famous city in Pakistan known for its handmade products and tombs. Naseem mai lives in the area within the city named Qaisarabad with her family in a two room brick house. She came here after her marriage 12 years ago. Naseem mai is a widow and has four sons and a daughter. Due to poor financial conditions she could not educate her children. She is a very caring mother and does her household chores very well. 

Besides her household work, Naseem mai operates two businesses simultaneously. She sells shawls and also does sewing work at her home. She buys shawls from the market of Multan and sells to her local area clients, and she sews clothes for her neighbors and relatives. She earns well from both businesses. She puts in so much effort in order to bring happiness for her family so that her children never feel that they have lost their father.   

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine to improve her work quality. The old machine doesn’t produce quality work and requires too much time to sew one dress. The new machine will allow her to complete her work in a shorter period of time. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem mai.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
42-year-old Merlina H. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has 2 children, aged 18 and 14. To make a living, Merlina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Aside fronm raising pigs, Merlina also runs a sari-sari store and helps her husband maintain their rice farm.

Merlina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Merlina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feeds, vitamins, and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase feeds, vitamins, and other supplies

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: Fortunata tiene 58 años vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años vende abarrotes por medio de viajes que realiza semanalmente a la ciudad de Lima para comercializar diversos productos alimenticios nativos de su zona. Tiene clientes fijos que le solicitan ciertos productos específicos y los lleva en buen estado y de calidad, se consideran fieles a los productos que vende. Por su parte Fortunata se siente muy contenta de realizar esta actividad porque le permite  viajar y socializarse siendo de su agrado a la vez que le permite tener ganancias semanales que son de beneficio para su familia. En adelante desea tener más capital de trabajo. Es su crédito numero 2 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en menestras y quesos.
texts.en: Fortunata is 58 and lives with her husband and child in her own home. For 10 years she has sold groceries by traveling weekly to the city of Lima to sell diverse food products that are native to her area. She has a customer base that requests certain products, and she provides these products in good quality, so her customers are loyal to her products. Fortunata feels very happy to do this job because it allows her to travel and socialize, while she is grateful for making a weekly income that benefits her family. In the future, she wants to have more working capital. This is her second loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, and she is grateful to be part of her community bank because all of the members are people whom she knows. They are responsible and very supportive of each other. She thanks those who will lend money toward this loan that she is requesting. It will be very useful in the progress of her business. With the loan that she is requesting, she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise: mixed vegetables and cheeses.

loans.use: To purchase mixed vegetables and cheeses, products that are in great demand in the capital.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie P. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 25 years old. Melanie is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $227 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Melanie is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and biscuits. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods & biscuits

loans.name: Lenlabh

texts.fr: Madame Lenlabh  a 39 ans et est mariée avec  un enfant en charge. Elle est couturière  de profession mais elle a associé la vente de  pagnes  pour pouvoir participer au menage.  Elle a commencé son activité en 2000 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle revend ensuite  ces marchandises à côté de la station agbalépédo. Elle sollicite un prêt pour acquérir de nouveaux lots de pagnes et satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en: Ms. Lenlabh, aged 39, is married and has one child to support. She is a dressmaker by profession, but she has included with it the sale of pagnes (colorful West African cloth), in order to help out at home. She started her business in 2000 and gets her supplies at the big market of Lomé, the capital of Togo. She then resells her merchandise next to the Agbalépédo station. She is requesting a loan for acquiring new batches of pagne cloth and satisfying more customers.

loans.use: Buying traditional pagne cloth

loans.name: Maja

texts.en:
Maja is from the town of Banga. She is 60 years old, married, and has 5 children. Maja is engaged in farming, particularly plants and rice crops. She sells her rice to traders. Maja also raises chickens in her backyard. She sells the eggs to her neighbors. Maja hopes to acquire more chickens.

Maja joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maja has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI.  She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm supplies and feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and feeds

loans.name: Mirzoali

texts.ru: Мусофиров Мирзоали проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 59 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Сыновья живут и работают в городе Душанбе. Сам Мирзоали зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он разводит скот у себя дома. В этой области уже 6 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Mirzoali M. lives in the J.Rumi region. He is 59 years old. He is married and has four children. His sons live and work in the city of Dushanbe. Mirzoali makes his living by breeding large cattle. He does this at home and has been in this business for six years. He is taking out this loan to buy large cattle.

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Maria Ximena

texts.es: La señora María es una persona joven y muy trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de pollo al espiedo y caldos de pollo. Tiene una tienda en la avenida cuidad del niño de la zona de Pampahasi que se encuentra a veinticinco minutos del centro de la cuidad de la paz. La señora María tiene dos hijos, el mayor ya es independiente y la menor que esta en edad escolar vive con ella.     María tiene la actividad de venta de pollos desde hace dos años y actualmente tiene varios clientes ya que María es una buena cocinera y prepara deliciosos platos de pollo. Su hija menor es la persona que la ayuda más en la atención de la tienda, ya que después de sus clases de colegio va a la tienda de su madre para ayudar. Uno de los mayores anhelos de María es ampliar su negocio para tener más clientes y de esta manera poder ahorrar dinero para comprar una casa y permitir que su hija tenga acceso a una buena educación para ser un día una profesional. Con el dinero del credito comprara material de construccion para poder ampliar su tienda y asi poder atender mejor a sus clientes,  La Sra. María esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Señora María is a hardworking woman who earns her living selling roast chicken and chicken soup. She has a store in Cuidad del Niño Avenue in the centre of La Paz.  

María has two children; the elder has already left home and the younger attends school and lives with her. She has had her business for two years, and her customers say that she is a good cook and prepares delicious chicken dishes. Her younger daughter helps her in the store after classes are over. 

One of María’s biggest wishes is to expand her business and have more customers. That way she can save money to buy a house and provide her daughter with a good education so she can get a good job one day. With the loan money she will buy construction material to expand the store and provide better service to her customers.

María is grateful to Kiva partner Emprender for the support that it provides.

loans.use: to buy construction material

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene una hija de tres años de edad. Vive en casa con su familia en el distrito de Pimentel, a unos veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Su comunidad es pequeña, urbana y recién está en crecimiento.

Desde hace un año, se dedica a la venta de comida, ya que una tía le ofreció un pequeño espacio en la fachada de su casa, para que improvise un pequeño comedor. Desde muy temprano en el día, María va de compras a los mercados mayoristas de Moshoqueque y Modelo para comprar los insumos que le permitirán preparar cebiches y otros platos peruanos. Sus principales clientes son los médicos y otro personal del hospital cerca de su negocio y también estudiantes universitarios de las dos universidades en su comunidad. 

Actualmente, María solo cuenta con tres mesas y unas sillas de madera y de plástico. Desea ampliar su mobiliario con la compra de más mesas y sillas. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles. El más grande sueño de María es llegar a tener un restaurante Turístico. Ella agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por apoyarla en crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is 34 years old, married, and has a three year old daughter. She lives at home with her family in the District of Pimentel, which is approximately twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. This small urban community has experienced recent growth.

For the past year, Maria has been selling food. Her aunt offered her a small space in front of her house which she turned into a makeshift diner. During the early hours, Maria goes to the wholesale markets in Moshoqueque and Modelo to buy the supplies for preparing ceviches and other Peruvian dishes. Her main customers are doctors and other hospital staff who work nearby. She also serves students who attend the two universities in her community.

At the moment, Maria only has three tables and a few wooden and plastic chairs. She wants to expand her facilities by purchasing more tables and chairs. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 PEN. Her greatest wish is to open a tourist restaurant. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for supporting the growth of her business.

loans.use: To purchase tables and chairs.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: La señora Mónica es comerciante, ella tiene un puesto de venta  de juguetes en la zona 16 de Julio, vende los días jueves y domingos su esposo se dedica a la tapicería; el crédito lo requiere para la  compra  de peluches y juguetes. Con los ingresos que obtiene logra cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Vive en casa de su madre en la zona Ballivián de la ciudad de El Alto, es madre soltera  y  tiene un solo hijo. Es cliente nuestra desde el año 2008.
texts.en:
Señora Mónica is a businesswoman who has a stall selling toys in the 16 de Julio area on Thursdays and Sundays. Her husband is an upholsterer.

Mónica is seeking a loan to buy soft toys and other types of toys. With the money she earns, she will be able to pay for the needs of her family. She lives in her mother’s house in the neighbourhood of Ballivián in the town of El Alto. She is a single mother and has a son. She has been a client of this organization since 2008.

loans.use: to buy more toys and increase stock

loans.name: Bimala

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Bimala C..  She is married and has 2 children aged 16 and 12.  In 2000, she established her cow-raising business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy a  young milk-giving cow.  In the future, Bimala plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buys young milk giving cow

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
Aunque Flor María G. es oriunda de Urabá, desde hace tres años se vio obligada a dejar su tierra en compañía de sus tres hijos debido al desplazamiento forzado por grupos al margen de la ley, desde entonces y como madre cabeza de hogar debió dedicarse a su propio negocio con el propósito de subsistir en Medellín, una ciudad para ella y su familia desconocida. 

Flor lucha incansablemente para sacar adelante su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida pero el invierno se ha convertido en una gran dificultad pues al estar expuesta al sol y al agua ello le implica comprar una carpa que le permita mejorar sus condiciones. 

En el futuro esta emprendedora espera llegar a tener un restaurante que le permita mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
