Although Flor María G. is originally from Urabá, she and her three children were forced from their land three years ago by local thugs. Since then, she has dedicated herself to her business activities in order to support her family in Medellín, a city which she still doesn't know very well. 

Flor struggles tirelessly to advance her business and improve her family's quality of life, but the winter season is difficult for her as a food vendor because she is exposed to the sun and the rain. She hopes to buy a tent to protect herself from the weather. In the future, Flor hopes to open a restaurant that will generate better income.

loans.use: To purchase a tent.

loans.name: Tubumwemubikorwa Group

texts.fr: Théoneste est client d’ACB depuis 2011, il est membre du groupe Tubumwemubikorwa, il est né au Rwanda, son éducation est de 6 ans de l’école primaire, il est marié, il a 49 ans, il a 5 enfants entre 21 et 12 ans, tous ses enfants vont à l’école. C’est son premier cycle de prêt, Théoneste va utiliser le prêt pour l’agriculture de riz en paiement de main d’œuvre et achat d’engrais chimique. Sa stratégie est d’augmenter l’étendu cultivé et l’utilisation des felitilisants pour augmenter la production agricole et veut améliorer la qualité de riz cultivé. Dans l’avenir, il veut être capable de s’autofinancer.
texts.en:
Théoneste, 54, has been a client of ACB since 2011. He is a member of the group Tubumwemubikorwa. He was born in Rwanda and he attended primary school for six years. He is married and he has six children between the ages of 36 and 18. Two of his children are attending school. 

This is his first loan, and Théoneste is going to use the loan to grow rice, paying for labor and buying chemical fertilizer. His strategy is to expand the area cultivated and use fertilizer to expand his agricultural production. He wants to improve the quality of rice he grows. In future, he wants to be capable of financing his undertaking himself.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to use to grow rice.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 44 years old and lives in Paynesville.  She is married with eight children, all of whom live together. For the past 30 years she has been selling charcoal, a business which she learned from her mother. One of the challenges she faces is that during the rainy season she makes a lower profit since customers are fewer.
 
Sarah is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for her business. She plans to furnish her place in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business

loans.name: Campanitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CAMPANITAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Aida. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: juguetería, venta de CD’s, venta de comida, albañilería, venta de ropa y artesanía, tienda de abarrotes.
 
La señora Aida,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de CD’s, que viene trabajando hace seis meses, con el apoyo de su familia.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de juguetes, ya que piensa aperturar otro negocio complementario al que en la actualidad realiza. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Campanitas" [Bells] will begin its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Center. It is made up of nine members and led by a directive board headed up by Mrs. Aida. The businesses of the communal bank's members are various. Among them are a toy shop, CD sales, food sales, construction work, clothing and handicraft sales, and a grocery store. 

Mrs. Aida indicates that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer and that she joined at the invitation of a promoter. Currently she has a business selling CDs, which she has had for six months with the support of her family. 
 
The loan she will take out is for the purchase of toys since she is thinking of opening another business to complement the one she currently has. This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family as much as possible, since she lives in a committed relationship and has four children.

loans.use: to purchase toys.

loans.name: Aytakin

texts.ru:
Aytakin 34 qoda. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Ona zamujem i imeyet odnogo rebonka.
Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya molochnogo produkta iz kotorogo ona gotovit Sir. Ona uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Etomu biznessu ona nuchias u svoyey mami.
texts.en:
Aytakin is 34 years old.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her family.  She is married with one child.  

Now she needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to increase her milk production.  She makes cheese from the milk.  She has been working as a herdsman and cattle breeder for seven years.  She learned the business from her mother.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: "La educación es muy importante para así poder forjar profesionales exitosos, emprendedores y con una mentalidad positiva en pos de contribuir de manera correcta a la sociedad. Me veo desempeñándome en un puesto laboral según mis capacidades dando lo mejor de mí para salir adelante. Me inspira Dios ya que sin él no somos nada. El amor que me tengo a mí y a mi familia, todos éstos factores son un motor esencial para avanzar y seguir adelante. Tengo deseos de estudiar, luchar, no darme por vencida ante las adversidades. es así como he finalizado los 5 años de la universidad por medio del esfuerzo, el empeño, la dedicación, responsabilidad y no me detendré, cumpliré mis metas sueños, sin darme por vencido"
texts.en: "Education is very important in forging successful professionals and entrepreneurs who have a positive mentality with respect to contributing to society. I am involved in a work sector that is within my capabilities and I give the best that I have to move forward. I am inspired by God because without Him we are nothing. My self esteem and the love that I have for my family are all contributors, essential to my motivation to advance and to move forward. I wish to go to school, to be accomplished, and to not give up in the face of adversities. It is through personal efforts, determination, dedication, and responsibility that I have spent the past 5 years in university. I will not stop and I will accomplish my goals and my dreams. I will never give up."

loans.use: to pay for her thesis and graduation expenses.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: El señor Luis Manuel tiene 45 años, está casado tiene 2 hijos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Luis tiene su negocio que es la venta y elaboración de comida que realiza con su esposa  desde  hace 4 años empezó con este negocio de venta de comidas rápidas, que esta ubicada en las afuera de una zona franca, es aquí donde ofrece una gran variedad de platillos a sus clientes. Vende todos los días desde las 8 hasta las 10 de la noche y algunas veces se queda más tiempo pues hay algunos trabajadores que salen un poco tarde de trabajar.  Este crédito es para comprar sodas, carnes, arroz, frijoles, plátanos, queso, maduro,  aceite, verduras, entre otros ingredientes. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en: Luis Manuel is 45 years old, married, and has 2 grown children who are independent.  Luis has had a business making and selling food with his wife for 4 years.  He started this fast food business in an area located outside of the free trade zone.  Here he offers a variety of dishes to his customers.  He sells every day from 8am until 10 at night, and at times he stays open later, because there are some workers who leave work a bit late.  This loan will be used to buy sodas, meats, rice, beans, bananas, cheese, maduro (fried plantain), cooking oil, vegetables, and other ingredients.  His dream is to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy sodas, meat, rice, beans, bananas, cheese, fried plantain, cooking oil and vegetables

loans.name: Mahoussi Senade Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUSSI SENADE est composé de deux personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la deuxième fois  que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Houénafa Audrey est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Houénafa Audrey est âgée de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Houénafa Audrey est mariée à un enseignant du nom de Fabrice. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Houénafa Audrey mène comme activité depuis cinq ans la vente des produits divers. Houénafa Audrey s'approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du  Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Houénafa Audrey sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUSSI SENADE, un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
The group MAHOUSSI SENADE is comprised of two persons who are friends. This is the second time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé for elevating their level of business. The group’s representative, by the name of Houénafa Audrey, is the person with her hand raised in the photo. She is 36 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a teacher by the name of Fabrice, and they have three children, who are both in school and in their care.

To support herself and her children, Houénafa Audrey has been running a business for five years selling a variety of goods. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, her group MAHOUSSI SENADE is requesting a second loan.

loans.use: to buy various goods

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.

Evelyn has a shop where she sells  ready-to-wear items like t-shirts, blouses, and underwear. She had this business for 2 years and has requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy RTW items for resale.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear items like T- shirts, blouses and underwear for sale

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta, age 52, owns and operates a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, breads, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan int eh amount of PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale.

She and her husband have one child. 

Violeta has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Violeta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 53 años, es natural D. la ciudad D. Santa Rosa, se considera como una mujer trabajadora. Vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo y sus tres queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad D. vida. La agricultura es una actividad que durante mucho tiempo su familia lo ha ejercido, hoy ella continua con esta tradición familiar y en compañía D. su esposo, trabajan en sus tierras para que sean cada vez más fertiles. 
Los productos que siembra son: cacao y café, ya que estos tienen mayor demanda en el mercado. Por tanto debe procurar cuidar sus plantas D. la plaga D. insectos que puedan perjudicarlos, ya que podría reducir mucho sus ganancias; asimismo debe transportar sus productos hasta la ciudad D. San Francisco, pues es ahí donD. los comercializa. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, y hasta el momento ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores  pagos, es por ello que desea que lo sigan apoyando. Con los 1,000 mil soles, comprará trampas o mallas por metrajes para evitar que los insectos no perjudiquen sus plantas.
texts.en: Antonia is 53 years old, a native of the city Santa Rosa, and considers herself a hard-working woman. She lives in her own home with her husband and their three beloved children to whom she wishes to give a better quality of life. Agriculture is an activity that her family has practiced for much time. Today she continues this family tradition, and accompanied by her husband, they work their land so that each time it is more fertile. The products they sow are cacao and coffee as they have the greatest demand in the market. As such she must try to take care of her plants from the plague of insects that could harm them as this could greatly reduce their earnings. Also she must transport her products to the city of San Francisco as it's there where they're commercialized. This will be her second loan with MFP, and up until now she has been very punctual with her previous payments which is why they wish to continue supporting her. With the 1,000 soles, she will buy traps or lengths of screens to prevent insects from harming her plants.

loans.use: to buy screens to use as traps.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La señora Albertina nació en el departamento Apurímac y vive en la selva del Perú en la ciudad de Salvación de la provincia de Manu del departamento de Madre de Dios.  

La señora Albertina tiene 45 años y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia y trabaja en la municipalidad de Salvación, ella también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de pasamanería. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Albertina requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo betunes, cepillos, relojes, pasadores y otras cosas más. 

Las reuniones de las socias del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación” son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación. 

La selva de Madre de Dios guarda en su fondo muchas riquezas naturales. Los bosques de Madre de Dios son pródigos en entregar singular belleza. En los bosques grandes y misteriosos de Madre de Dios la caza es abundante. La selva de Madre de Dios es cortada por majestuosos ríos sobre los que se puede navegar en canoas o lanchas.
texts.en:
Albertina was born in Apurímac department and currently lives in the Peruvian rainforest, in the town of Salvación, in Manu province, in Madre de Dios department.

Albertina is 45 years old, married, and has four children.  she is a hard-working woman who supports her family and works in Salvación municipality.  She also has a small business selling miscellaneous goods. She has been in this business for several years and is doing very well.  On this occasion, Albertina needs a loan to buy merchandise such as shoe polish, brushes, watches, hair slides, etc.

The 'Nueva Generación' community bank meets once a month in the town of Salvación.

The depths of the rainforest in Madre de Dios hold many natural riches.  The forests offer an abundance of spectacular beauty.  The large and mysterious forests of Madre de Dios, animals abound.  The rainforest is crossed by majestic rivers where one can sail in canoes or boats.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as shoe polish, brushes, watches, hair slides, etc.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Guljuma's Group

texts.en:
Guljuma is the treasurer of this group. She is 25 and married to an electrician. Together with her husband she is bringing up two sons, both of whom are preschool age (under seven). 

Seven years ago Guljuma, with an initial investment of 50,000 soms, started to sell various goods for house coziness. At the moment her business is running well. She has increased the commodity turnover and her monthly profit is about 25,000 soms. She is applying for the loan because she needs additional financial funds to purchase umbrellas, microwaves, teapots, etc. for selling. In the future, Guljuma dreams of building her own store.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase umbrellas, microwaves, teapots, etc.

loans.name: Dai

texts.en: Dai was born in 1953. She lives in Thac Qua village, Duc Tu commune, with her husband and a son. Her husband is a contractor. Her son is a worker in Thang Long industrial park. All of them have income. Mrs. Dai has a general store. She sells groceries. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnam dong (VND). She really likes participating in SEDA because she can save money every week. In 2007 she joined SEDA, and has always repaid loans punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy more groceries for her store.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her store.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana, se decidió a tener otro préstamo, porque quiere mejorar su negocio surtiéndolo de mercadería como: pantalones, camisas, blusas, ropa interior, el propósito de ella es ofrecerles a los clientes más calidad y variedad.Estos prestamos anteriores le ayudaron mucho a mejorar el inventario porque mejoro en los ingresos, esto le permite que su familia se mantenga solo de los ingresos y no presenta ningún problema ya que viven en mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Ana decided to take out another loan because she would like to improve her business, stocking it with merchandise such as pants, shirts, blouses and underwear.  Her goal is to offer her customers more quality and variety.  Her previous loans helped her a lot in improving her stock and she improved her income.  She is able to support her family solely on her income and she has no problems as they are living in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses and underwear

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: La señora Josefa, es una cliente que esta en su segunda secuencia D. crédito, con buena referencia crediticia, ella se dedica a la venta D. salteñas y a la atención D. su tienda D. barrio que se encuentra en el mismo domicilio cabe destacar que es D. su propiedad y este esta ubicado en la zona Alto Tacagua, en la elaboración D. salteñas la ayuda su esposo que también se dedica a la elaboración D.  helados, entre los dos se ayudan mutuamente y podemos ver que son buenos clientes siempre tratando D. pagar sus cuotas al día. El motivo D. este crédito es porque la señora desea elaborar una mayor cantidad  D. salteñas ya que encontró mas puntos D. venta y D. paso también quiere surtir su tienda debido a que se acerca fin D. año y las ventas están aumentando. Con la visita que se realizo a su domicilio y a la vez a su negocio se pueD. ver que la señora tiene mucho entusiasmo en poder expandirse en la venta D. salteñas, pero para ello necesita D. este crédito.
texts.en: Señora Josefa is a member who is in her second loan cycle, with a good credit rating. She sells salteñas (baked empanadas) and takes care of her neighbourhood store which is located in her own house. It should be noted that the house is her own property and is located in the Alto Tacagua area. Her husband helps her make the salteñas. He also makes icecream. Between the two of them, they help each other and we can see that they are good members always trying to make their repayments on time. The reason for this loan is because the lady wants to make a larger quantity of salteñas as she identified more points of sale and incidently also wants to stock her store as the end of year is approaching and sales are increasing. With the visit to her house and her business, it is evident that the lady is very enthusiastic about expanding her sales of salteñas, but needs the loan in order to do this.

loans.use: to buy flour to make baked empanadas (savoury pastries) and buy groceries to stock her neighbourhood store.

loans.name: Josianne

texts.en: Josianne is 33 years old and has four children between the ages of 1 and 12. Three of her children are currently in school. Her husband works as a taxi driver. She has been running a general store for ten years. Josianne would like a loan to buy more salt, sugar, and rice to sell in her store. The profits will be used to build a house. She dreams to one day own a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs such as salt, sugar, and rice for sale.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Las Laboriosas Group

texts.es:
Doña Gloria es la presidenta de Banco Mujer Las Laboriosas, es una mujer muy luchadora como ella misma lo dice, y es capaz de realizar cualquier trabajo, y desenvolverse muy bien en diversas actividades productivas, su edad no es impedimento a sus 56 años, tiene toda la energía que necesita, y muchos deseos de mejorar sus calidad de vida y tener una vejez digna. Ella tiene 3 hijos pero ninguno vive con ella, todos se casaron y se fueron a formar su propio hogar, sin embargo no está sola, vive hace más de 6 años con su marido, un hombre que al igual que ella trabajan hombro a hombro para sacar adelante su huerta.
La actividad de Doña Gloria es la agricultura, siembra diversos productos de muy buena calidad y que vende en la misma comunidad a sus vecinos. Y el crédito va ser de mucha ayuda ya que le va a permitir invertir en; abonos, plásticos para proteger los cultivos, y otros insumos necesarios para la siembra. 
Está mujer tan emprendedora tiene como meta a corto plazo tener una huerta más grande y aumentar su producción con más y mejores cultivos. 
Junto a Doña Gloria están 7 señoras más de la misma comunidad, que desean invertir en actividades como Avicultura, Porcicultura y Comercio.
texts.en:
Gloria is the president of the “Banco Mujer Las Laboriosas,” and, as she says, is a woman who puts forth lots of effort.  She’s capable of completing any task and involves herself in many productive activities.  At age 56, her age is not an impediment and she has all the energy she needs and many desires to improve her quality of life and live a dignified life.  She has three children, but none live with her.  They are married and have established their own homes.  However, she is not alone.  She’s been living with her husband for the past six year and she and her husband work shoulder to shoulder to move their farm ahead.

Gloria is a farmer and raises different good quality products that she sells to her neighbors within her community.  This loan will be of great help and will allow her to invest in fertilizer, plastic to protect her crops, and other supplies necessary for the harvest.

This enterprising woman’s short term goal is to have a larger farm and increase her production with better crops.

There are seven other ladies from the same community [in the photograph] with Gloria, who also want to invest in activities such as raising poultry, pigs, and other businesses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fabrics and a sewing machine for textiles.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Tessie works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of bananas business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock. Tessie is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell for her business.

Tessie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: 4.2.3 Nam Ngạn Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Vinh is 41 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Mrs. Vinh has a retail business selling medication. Vinh has been involved in this business for 4 years. The main harship that Vinh faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase medicine to resell.
She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 2.3 Nam Ngạn solidarity group. 

In 2008, Vinh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Vinh has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Vinh hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase medicine to resell

loans.name: Divino Maestro Group

texts.es: El grupo está conformado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es María mujer de 53 años de edad, acompañada, con un hijo de 18 años, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos desde hace 5 años, sus productos los comercializa en su comunidad y alrededores. Tiene 4 años de ser cliente de la institución. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosméticos como perfumes, lociones, labiales, cremas, faciales, cremas corporales, protectores solares, set de perfumes Barbie de niñas, lencería y cubiertos para el hogar. Juana mujer de 60 años de edad su negocio es una pulpería, venta de zapatos y ropa. Ana mujer de 26 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapatos.
texts.en:
This group is formed of three entrepreneurial members. One of them is Maria, a 53 year old woman, who is in a relationship and has an eighteen year old son. 

She has sold cosmetics for the past five years. She sells her products in her community and neighboring areas. She has been a group member for four years. 

She is requesting the loan to buy cosmetics such as perfume, lotion, lipstick, face cream, body cream, sun screen, a set of Barbie perfumes for girls, lingerie, and cutlery for the home. 

Juana, a 60 year old women, owns a grocery store, and sells shoes and clothing. 

Ana, a 26 year old woman sells clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as perfume, lotion, lipstick, face cream, body cream, sun screen, barbie perfumes for girls, lingerie, and cutlery for the home.

loans.name: Enagnon Group

texts.fr: ENAGNON est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Odile (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 24 ans. Odile est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Jean. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Odile vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Odile et son mari. Pour cette raison, Odile vend divers produits depuis huit ans et des condiments de façon secondaire, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Odile s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Odile sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe ENAGNON, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter de la tomate, des cubes en carton et des sacs d'oignon.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: Mrs. Vera B., a LAPO client of distinguished features, cherishes talking about LAPO loan and the poor in Nigeria. She is married with three (3) children and she hopes if given this loan she will expand her business in a better way.

loans.use: To buy provision & drinks for sale

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Auntie Doris lives in Nkurankan, Ghana. She operates a drinking bar. She wants to upgrade to a pub. She is seeking a loan of $1000.00 from Kiva to enable her to realize this dream.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Hak

texts.en:
Hak K. S. is 56 years old and is a widow with five children. She lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since her husband passed away a few years ago, she has to work hard to feed all her children. She sells grocery products and plants rubber trees in her small plantation. She usually makes around $3/day in revenue. One of her children is a barber; two help to finance the family by driving tractors to plow soils during the cultivating season; and the rest work at a garment factory. Hak says, "I really want to grow some rubber trees in my small plantation because I think it will bring me huge amount of benefit in next seven years. I hope the loan will help me purchasing rubber trees.”
In the future, Hak would like to keep growing rubber trees in her plantation and open a big grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase some grocery products and to buy some rubber trees to grow on her plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to add more chickens and buy supplies for them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stocks for her business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
52 years old Nguyen Thi D. is a great example of how to raise above poverty. Before joining TYM fund, she only have a two-compartment cottage, while raising her children and not having any fund to start her business of raising cattle. In 2002, when TYM arrived, Mrs. D. took out a loan of 75 USD to invest in her business. Now, she has a bigger house, a television, and a motor-cycle with daily earning of 3 USD. She is requesting for an additional 325 USD loan to expand her cake-store to sell at nearby hamlets.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Đường, 52 tuổi, là một trong những tấm gương điển hình về xóa đói giảm nghèo. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị chỉ có hai gian nhà tranh, nuôi con hết sức vất vả, không có vốn sản xuất chăn nuôi. Năm 2002 khi có Quỹ về chị đã vay vốn với mức vay 75 USD dùng vào buôn bán đến nay chị đã có ba gian nhà via và mua sắm được ti vi, xe máy, với mức thu nhập mỗi ngày là 3 USD. Dự tính vòng vốn tiếp theo chi xin vay 325 USD để mở rộng cơ sở làm bánh tiêu thụ ở các xã lân cận.

loans.use: Make more cakes.

loans.name: Khatira

texts.en: Khatira is 45 years old. She is married, has 5 children and lives in Khachmaz town. She started her business five years ago selling glassware and dressing gowns at retail.  She needs a loan of $950 to buy glassware, dressing gowns and bathrobes to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy a lot of glassware, dressing gown and bathrobe

loans.name: Saidalieva

texts.en:
Saidalieva M. lives in Nausky rayon; she is married and has 2 children.  Saidalieva M. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2005.  She recommended herself as a serious and strongly-motivated client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures.  Loan sums are continually increased, which shows business stability and income increase.  

Mrs. Saidalieva M. is very experienced in her business (about 10 years) and it is the family business.  She is the security guard in the rayon typography.  She is also engaged in the business of livestock raising and selling, milk production and work out.  She dreams to purchase a horn pedigree bull and milk cow for further meat and sour-milk goods production (she supplies it to the bazaars).  It is planned to include in the assortment the following milk and sour-milk products: pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd, etc. 

Now Mrs. Saidalieva M. requests a loan of $475 for business development, which will permit her to significantly increase the family income and plan further business development and assortment widening.  She dreams, as any mother, to give a good education to her children.

loans.use: For business development

loans.name: Ijah

texts.en: Ijah is a 40-year-old widow. Her only child has already married. To support herself, she sells food at her small stall in front of her house, earning about $10 a day. She is requesting a loan of $125 to buy more goods for her stall and as a member of MBK she will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her food stall

loans.name: Lusmery

texts.es:
Lusmery is fifty years old. She has been seperated form her husband for 16 years, which is why she was forced to work in a factory, welding steel tools. Nevertheless, she has to abandon this after ten years of hard work due to an accident. She recalls that she was doing her daily work when suddenly a big tool fell on top of her. The doctor said she could not return to work after that. This was reason enough for her to immediately look for another way to earn a living. So she began making clothing with the little knowledge she had about dressmaking. But, at the same time, she took a course about how to prepare fertilizer and plant flowerpots. This is why she know works selling clothing and also plants. What she would like most is to buy the machines needed to improve the way she makes clothes, since she can’t currently achieve a good finish on her garments and their low quality leads to a low selling price. Lusmery’s needs increase when you take into account the education of her youngest daughter and the cardiac health care needed by her oldest daughter..

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Lusmery es una mujer de cincuenta años. Desde hace 16 años que esta separada de su esposo, razón por la cual se vio obligada a trabajar en una fábrica soldando herramientas de acero. No obstante tuvo que abandonarlo después de diez años de trabajo arduo a causa de un accidente que tuvo. Ella cuenta que cuando se encontraba en una faena diaria de repente le cae un fierro grande encima. Y el doctor le prohibió volver a aquel trabajo. Motivo suficiente para que de inmediato busque otra forma de ganarse la vida. Así que empezó a confeccionar ropa con los pocos conocimientos que recordaba sobre costura. Pero a la par también aprovecho para tomar un curso sobre cómo preparar abono y plantar en macetas. Es así que ahora se dedica a vender ropa y también a vender plantas. Lo que más le gustaría a ella es poder comprar las maquinarias necesarias para una mejor confección de sus productos, ya que no le puede dar un buen acabado a sus prendas y su baja calidad desmerecen un buen precio de venta. Las necesidades de Lusmery crecen cuando debe tomar en cuenta la educación de su hija menor y los cuidados de la enfermedad cardiaca de su hija mayor..

loans.use: To purchase machines to improve the finish of her clothing

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María is married to Pedro, and they have a beautiful baby together. Pedro is a taxi driver who has his own taxi stand in the city’s downtown area.

María is a hairdresser who learned this trade thanks to her parents, who paid for her studies in a renowned institution in the city. She has established a beauty salon with a great number of customers who drop in from Tuesday through Saturday so that she can attend to them.

She is a hardworking person who takes responsibility in her duties. She used the loans that she had previously obtained, which she repaid in a timely manner, for the purchase of beauty supplies. She is now requesting a new loan so that she can expand her business space because she wishes to progress, and to provide a bigger and better area for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

María esta casada, su marido se llama Pedro y juntos tienen un hermoso bebé. Pedro es taxista y posee su parada en el micro centro de la ciudad.

María es peluquera, ella estudio el oficio gracia a la ayuda de sus padres que pagaron sus estudios en una conocida institución de la ciudad. Hoy día tiene un local formado con una buena cantidad de clientes que de martes a sábados acuden a su local para que ella los atienda.

Es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable a sus obligaciones, los créditos que retiro anteriormente los utilizó para la compra de insumos para su peluquería y los ha pagado de forma puntual. Hoy, ella esta solicitando un nuevo crédito para la ampliación de su local ya que desea seguir progresando dar un mayor y mejor espacio para sus clientes.

loans.use: Expansion of beauty salon

loans.name: Abdul Latif

texts.en: Abdul Latif lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and the father of 2 sons. He lives with his own family. He has a retail shop. He was in the army, but when he was injured he left the army and opened a retail shop. His business is going well but he is unable to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to complete his stock and make a good income to help himself and his family.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Khuraman

texts.en: Khuraman is a mother of 2 children. She was born in 1966.  This is a picture of Khuraman with her husband. They live in Khachmaz region. They started a cattle breeding business 8 years ago. Now this family requests a loan of $975 to buy 2 calves.  They promise to repay the loan in full on time.

loans.use: to buy 2 calves

loans.name: Ajmal

texts.en:
Ajmal, son of A. H., graduated from high school last year. He is 23 and has three children. Ajmal and his family returned to Afghanistan in 2002 from 18 years of living in refugee camps in neighboring Pakistan. Ajmal and his extended family live in Jalalabad city of the eastern Ningarhar province.

Ajmal originally wanted to go to college and enter medical school; however, due to economic difficulties surrounding his household, he was not able to pursue his higher education goals. Instead of taking the college tests, he had to turn to his father’s retail shop to make a living. His father’s business, however, is not big enough to support the whole household, including Ajmal’s wife and kids.

Ajmal has decided to join his father’s business and enlarge the store’s inventory to increase profitability. With taking out a loan, Ajmal will be able to not only increase the family store’s daily profit and support the cost of living for the household, but also be able to pursue his educational goals. He will attend to the shop half the day and go to college the second half. He has applied for a 50,000 Afghani loan to achieve this goal.

loans.use: To buy many things for his shop

loans.name: Mwanahawa's Tusongembele Group

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is 24 years old, married, and has 2 children, 2 and 3 years old. She became a bites (cake and chapati) seller in 2008. Every day, Mwanahawa works from 6 a.m. to 12 p.m., earning a monthly profit of about US$20.

In the past, Mwanahawa has taken out a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for an additional loan to buy more items for sale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses dealing with charcoal and firewood sales and bite sales.

loans.use: Purchase of items for a food sales business

loans.name: Dina

texts.fr: Dina A. est âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est revendeuse depuis 3 ans en gros et détail des sacs du charbon de bois à Apéyémé, un village situé à environ 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite par ce crédit acheter de nouveaux  sacs  de charbon, afin d’augmenter la capacité de son commerce et faire face aux besoins de sa clientèle. Les profits tirés de son activité lui permettront de prendre en charge une partie des besoins de son foyer
texts.en:
Dina A. is 33 years old. She is married and the mother of one child. For three years, she has sold coal wholesale and retail in Apéyémé, a village about 170 kilometers from the Togolese capital of Lomé. With this loan, she hopes to buy new sacks of coal in order to increase the size of her business and meet her clients' needs. The profits she earns in this way will allow her to help meet the financial needs of her household.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of coal

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora, de 50 años de edad, trabaja en la venta de comida, también cuenta con el alquiler de habitaciones (6) en su casa, actividad que  viene realizando hace 5 años y medio, y le va muy bien. Dora es una mujer con visión de negocio, quiere seguir ampliando sus habitaciones, así como también mandar a refaccionar algunas estructuras que están en mal estado de sus habitaciones, ya que su trabajo de vender comida, debido a su edad, ya no es seguro. Ella es madre de 4 hijos, todos independientes ya. Dora piensa y actúa tratando de asegurar su vejez, ya que es soltera.Espera invertir la cantidad que necesita en sus habitaciones.
texts.en:
Dora, who is 50 years old, sells food and also rents out rooms in her home. This is something she has been doing for the past 5 years and it is going well for her. Dora is a woman with a business vision. She wants to continue extending her rooms as well as repair some of the structures which are in poor condition because selling food, due to her age, is no longer secure work. She is the mother of 4 children who are all adults. Since she is single, Dora thinks and acts toward trying to assure her old age. She hopes to be able to invest what she needs to in her rooms.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her working capital in order to make improvements to the rooms she rents.

loans.name: Khuon

texts.en:
Khuon S. is 34 years old and lives with three children and her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Since 2006, she has had a business selling sugar cane juice from her home. She typically makes US$6 in revenue each day, while her husband is a construction worker and sometime operates a motor-taxi whenever he free from construction. He earns a combined US$5 each day. All the children are students and she spends around US$15 on their education.
Khuon S. would like to take out a loan of US$500 to create another business by selling porridge from her home in the morning. In her future plan, she wants all the children to get a higher class.

loans.use: Selling porridge.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Юсупова Шарофат жительница Гиссарского района. Живет в одном из дальних районов Гиссара. о каждый день приезжает в центр наработу. Очень активная женщина , которая обеспечивает свою смью. Уже 12 лет она занимается бизнесом в сфере орговли. Продает одежду на центральном рынке. У знав, про нашу рганизацию решила получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sharofat U. lives in the Gissar District. She lives in one of the district's remote areas, and every day travels to the center for work. She is a dynamic woman and supports her family. For 12 years she has had a business in sales. She sells clothing at the central market. Having found out about our organization, she decided to take out a loan to use to increase sales. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing Sales

loans.name: Ehiorobo

texts.en: Ehiorobo is 50 years old and is married, with 3 children. She sells provisions and drinks. She started this business in 2004. She is requesting a loan to puchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says, "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Carmen Lucrecia

texts.es:
Carmen S. es una dama cuyo oficio es la venta de cosméticos y productos comestibles los cuales son comercializados en su propia casa de habitación en la ciudad de León.

La señora Carmen ha logrado salir adelante gracias a sus grandes sacrificios por lo que ha logrado mantener su núcleo familiar y ha permitido que sus dos hijos estudien, el pequeño en secundaria y su hija joven en la universidad.
EL motivo por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel hoy en día es para solicitar un crédito que le permita la compra de los cosméticos para comercializarlos a lo inmediato. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente y de igual forma beneficia a sus familiares.
texts.en:
Carmen Salina is a woman whose profession is selling cosmetics and food products from her home in León city. Carmen has been successful thanks to her great sacrifices which have thus maintained her immediate family and enabled her two children to study. The younger son is in high school, her older daughter in the university. The reason she has approached Ceprodel today is to ask for a loan which would allow her to buy cosmetics to then sell. Both she and her family will greatly benefit from this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics

loans.name: Ediltrudes

texts.en:
Ediltrudes E. sells coco shells for "calamay" (sticky rice), a type of delicacy that Bohol is known for because of its sticky sugary taste. Because more and more people make "calamay" as a business, all the more people need coco shells to market their products. Ediltrudes is still single and has adopted 2 kids.  She started her business in 1998 with the capital of Php 3000. By now, she has her business growing and established. 

She is asking for a CEVI loan of Php 20,000 to buy more coconuts. In this way she will be able to sell the meat to have income. Through her loan she would have more coco shells too, so that she could sell them to "calamay" makers. Her previous work was a gardener but she was not happy about her salary. So she decided to have a business, a coco-shell supply for "calamay" makers.

CEVI helps Ediltrudes sustain her business. She is provided with credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage to make her business grow.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts to sell the shells for making calamay

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino es chofer asalariado, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, y su esposa es costurera y trabaja a domicilio.
Vive en la zona de Llojeta de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa en anticrético.
El crédito será destinado para el mantenimiento y la compra de repuestos para su vehiculo.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, con este crédito mejoran su calidad de vida ya que es con la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta porque su esposa gana  poco.
texts.en:
Marcelino is a salaried driver. He has two school-age children. His wife is a seamstress and works from home. Marcelino lives in the Llojeta zone in the city of La Paz in "anticretico". [Translator's note: "Anticretico" is a legal arrangement by which the owner of a house, in exchange of a stipulated sum of money, grants a room, an apartment or a home to a renter who is allowed to live there for a period of time and at the end of the contract term the owner of the house promises to return the original sum of money.] This loan will be used for spare parts and cost of maintenance for his car. This is the first time that Marcelino has requested a loan from IMPRO. With this loan he will improve his quality of life since his car is the only source of income for his family as his wife earns little.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance and purchase of spare parts for his car which he uses in his job as a driver.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo Tomas y su hija de 15 años llamada Roxana, la cual es su principal apoyo en su negocio, ellos viven en su casa propia. Se viene dedicando a la venta de frutas desde hace 9 años en el Mercado Pachacutec, que está ubicado en cerca de donde vive, siendo ésta su principal fuente de ingresos; en este trabajo la ayuda su hija Roxana la cual atiende el puesto cuando su mamá sale a comprar más mercadería o se le presenta algún contratiempo. A Susana le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que siempre está en contacto con la gente y ha hecho muy buenas amigas con sus vecinas del mercado, además las ganas que le pone y la alegría con la que atiende logran que la venta sea buena y le arroje buenas ganancias. Pero como toda una microempresaria Susana quiere expandir su negocio y hacer que sea mucho más próspero para lo cual quiere ponerle un techo nuevo a su puesto. Susana ha trabajado con MFP, desde aproximadamente 3 años, siendo una cliente muy puntual y responsable en sus pagos, ahora tiene un préstamo individual, pero trabajó primero con un banco comunal con el cual estuvo muy feliz ya que hizo buenas amigas y todas eran muy responsables. Invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería y en arreglar su puesto para así brindar una mejor atención a su clientela, Susana está muy feliz y espera seguir progresando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Susana is 45 and lives in her own home with her husband Tomas and her 15-year-old daughter Roxana, who helps with her business. For nine years, Susana has sold fruit in the Pachacutec Market, located near her home, and her business is her primary source of income. Roxana minds the fruit stall while her mother goes to buy more merchandise or is called away for an unexpected problem.

Susana really likes her work, as she enjoys interacting with people and she has made many good friends among her neighbors in the market. Also, the effort she puts forth and the joy she takes in her work have resulted in more sales and therefore good earnings. But, like all small businesspeople, she would like to expand her business and be much more prosperous, and for this she would like to put a new roof over her stall.

Susana has worked with Microfinanzas Prisma for about three years, and has been punctual and responsible with her repayments. She now has an individual loan, but first she was part of a community bank, which made her very happy as she made many responsible friends.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of more merchandise and in making improvements to her stall to provide better service to her customers. Susana is very happy and hopes to continue moving forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and make improvements to her stall

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Mrs. Lucresia B., 49 years old, is married and lives at Dapitan City. During her two years of membership in Paglaum MPC, she has had a good record of being a good payer. Her three previous loans justify this assessment. And because she likes the benefits that are being offered to the members, she continues to patronize PMPC.

She has now applied for a loan of 9,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy additional stocks of food for her food vending business, as well as snacks that ship passengers demand.

All she is wishing is to send her children to school, despite any crises they might encounter.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of snacks and food.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida M. is 30 years old. She is divorced and mother of five children. She says with the help of God all her children will be able to attend school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits and babies products like napkins, feeding bottles etc. in her neighborhood. She lives at Akim Wenchi in the eastern region of Ghana. With her five years business experience Vida has been very supportive to her family. Vida is a single parent and because of that, all the family responsibilities rest on her shoulders.

Fortunately her business is positioned at a strategic location within the town where she lives. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school. Vida belongs to a village bank called ‘wonderful Jesus’.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar etc.

loans.name: Donald

texts.es:
El Señor. Donald T. tiene 37 años de edad,, habitantes del barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, casado, su esposa se dedica al comercio, tiene tres hijos. Los planes es terminar la construcción de su vivienda.  Se desempeña como guardia de seguridad desde hace 17 años lo mejor es que su meta es ofrecerle a sus hijos mayor seguridad mediante prestamos ya que los costos de construcción son muy alto.
Con el préstamo que solicita comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, cerámica a la sala de su casa, pintura y repellar las paredes permitiendo que su proyecto de ir mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda a si como tener un mejor patrimonio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Donald T., 37, lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Managua. His wife is in commerce. They have three children. The plan is to finish construction on his house. He has worked as a security guard for seventeen years. The best thing about his goal is to give his children better security. He needs to do this through loans because construction costs are very high. With the loan he will buy construction materials like cement, ceramic tiles for the living room floor, paint, and plaster for the walls. This will allow him to continue with his project of improving the infrastructure of his home and having a better patrimony for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to plaster the walls and put down ceramic tile flooring in the living room

loans.name: Analinda

texts.en:
Analinda is married to Benjamin Sr. She is now 37 years old and her family is happily living in Barangay Abinganan Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. They were blessed with four children who are all in school. They want them to finish their studies until college so that they will find a good job some day. With the support of her husband, Analinda is doing her best to improve her business and to earn enough money to support their children's studies.

Analinda's husband is a farmer and, sometimes, she helps him to plant vegetables. Analinda hopes to borrow a loan of PHP 12, 000 so she can develop her store, which is located inside their house. She wants to have a separate stall where she can display her merchandise.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal Luz y Vida.
Nelly es soltera, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Nelly viaja  a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra animales menores, quesos, productos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho y en algunas oportunidades lleva a la selva ayacuchana. Además Nelly se dedica a la elaboración de papa seca (papa sancochada, pelada, picada y que es secado al sol) producto que es utilizado en la preparación de platos típicos
Nelly necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa y pago de peones.
Los sueños de Nelly son mejorar sus negocios y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of Banco Comunal Luz y Vida.

Nelly is single, 32 years old and has 3 children. Nelly travels to different markets in the region where she buys young animals and cheeses, products that she sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho and sometimes brings to the Ayacuchana jungle. Nelly also makes dried potatoes (potatoes that are parboiled, peeled, chopped and dried in the sun), which are used in the preparation of local cuisine.

Nelly needs a loan of 750 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of potatoes and to pay laborers.

Nelly’s dreams are to improve her businesses and offer a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potatoes and pay laborers

loans.name: Genese

texts.en:
Genese D. is from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 39 years old. Genese is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Genese owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising ducks. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising ducks for sale. Genese is just starting this business.

In 2008, Genese joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genese has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase ducklings to raise & sell in future. Genese is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed & other supplies for the ducks. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Genese from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family and tuition of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Suzane Yessa

texts.fr: Suzane Yessa D. est une femme mariée de 44 ans qui s’active dans la plantation de banane, l’élevage et la vente de boeufs. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre d’entretenir sa plantation et d’acheter des boeufs à revendre. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
The business of Suzane Yessa D., age 44, consists in growing bananas, as well as raising and selling cattle. The loan she's seeking will enable her to look after her plantation, and to buy cattle. Her goal is to improve the living standard of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow bananas, and raise and sell cattle

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
E. Mahbuba is a hard working mother. Since she married, she has been breeding and selling cattle. She is quite efficient thanks to her years of experience. She works very hard to support her dear children in their education. The desire of this virtuous mother is to grant her children the opportunity to finish their studies an opportunity she never had due to the scarce economic resources of her family when she was young. She is requesting a loan to help achieve her goals. She will use the capital to invest and obtain a bigger profit from selling her animals. Let's help Mahbuba and her beautiful family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients present a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz tiene 40 años, vive junto a su pareja y sus dos hijos, con quienes habita en la casa que su esposo logró adquirir hace diez años. Sus deseos de cooperar en casa fueron uno de los motivos por el cual incursionó en la venta de cosméticos, actividad que viene realizando durante cuatro años. Gracias a la amistad que tiene con algunas promotoras quienes la enseñaron cómo y dónde ofertar los productos de belleza.  Ya que al iniciar no tenía relaciones con muchas personas y con el pasar de los años fue teniendo experiencia y ahora conserva una gran cantidad de conocidos a quienes ella visita cada semana con la finalidad de incrementar sus pedidos por catálogos y tener puntos de ventas adicionales que le beneficia recibiendo premios y obsequios que brinda la empresa de belleza. Tiene proyectado instalar un puesto de venta en su domicilio, donde pueda ofrecer cosméticos de diversas líneas de belleza y de calidad a sus vecinos y conocidos con el fin de tener ingresos diarios sin esperar la entrega de los productos de pedidos por catálogos. Ella ya tiene seis créditos con Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera seguir contando con su confianza y apoyo, desea también seguir integrando su banco comunal que le brindó oportunidades para el progreso de su negocio y la de sus compañeras con quienes son socias dentro del grupo. Con los 1000 soles que solicita, serán invertidos en la compra de productos de belleza por docenas pues es una estrategia para aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is a widow with seven children. She is 45 years old. She sells garri, which is made from cassava. She has been in the business for a long time. Comfort lives in Edo State and hopes for the loan amount of 60,000 NGN to purchase more bags of garri to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for the loan

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Abimbola

texts.en: Abimbola is 48 years old and she is married with 4 children. She sells foodstuffs like tomatoe paste,noodles,cooking oils,spices,etc. she has been in this business for long.she hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.She is a hard working woman and she hopes to lift her business and family above poverty.She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine owns a restaurant where he sells drinks and cooked foods. He is 26 years old and single without a child. He has been in his business for two years. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more drinks and to renovate his shop. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and to renovate his shop

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio H., 53 years old, is married to Lolita, who is a market vendor in their town. The couple is blessed with four loving children: Marites, 28, who works in a tutorial center; Richard, 26, who is a tricycle driver; Marilyn, 17, who is a first-year college student; and the youngest, Donabel, 10, who is currently enrolled in elementary-level education.

The family resides in Sta. Maria, a small village of Alicia, Isabela. Florencio's main source of income is through motorcycle transport, where he earns a daily net income of 500 PHP. Aside from that, he also cultivates the small farm at the back of their house to have additional income. His desire to acquire more income motivated him to borrow a loan in the amount of 6,000 PHP from some lenders for additional working capital in his business. According to him, patience and diligence are the best characteristics for a productive life.

loans.use: The maintenance and repair of his motorcycle

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia, de 27 años, es una mujer muy empeñosa en lo que realiza, vive en la casa de uno de sus familiares y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su puesto de ventas está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca). Se dedica a la venta de tejidos artesanales, los cuales ella misma confecciona en su taller, es por eso que los modelos que vende son únicos y sus clientes no los pueden encontrar en otro lugar.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar los fardos de tejidos artesanales desde su taller hasta su puesto de venta. 
Para el futuro, espera tener una tienda más grande, donde pueda vender con más comodidad sus prendas.

Este es el primer préstamo de Cecilia con MFP, espera ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y siempre participa en todas las reuniones. Con los mil soles solicitados comprará más lana para elaborar más tejidos artesanales y así incrementar su stock.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 27, is a very determined woman in everything she does. She lives in a relatives' home and what she most desires is to improve her quality of life. She has a sales stall in the San José market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). She sells artisanal weavings which she makes herself in her workshop. This is why her items are unique and her customers can't find them anywhere else. What she likes most about her work is being able to chat with her fellow merchants. She has had this occupation for 7 years and believes that the most difficult part of it is moving the bundles of woven goods from her workshop to her sales stand. Her future plans are to have a larger store where she can sell her wares more comfortably. This is Cecilia's first loan with MFP. She expects to make her repayments on time. She is a very active member of her communal bank and always participates in all the meetings. With the one-thousand sol loan requested she will buy more wool to weave her articles and increase her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Chourn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chourn R., 24, is married to Mr. Yeun Sophorn, age 25, who appears in the photo. This couple has three kids who attend school.

Chourn R. is a garment factory worker who provides her salary to help meet her family’s financial crisis. Her husband catches fish to earn a living. Chourn R. is taking out her loan to purchase more fishing equipment for her husband to fish with.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing equipment for her husband to fish with

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Ganzorig is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two-year-old daughter in a house in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Ganzorig’s brother gave him his house and shop building when he left the country in order to work in a foreign country. Ganzorig took the shop building and opened a grocery store there in 2007 with working capital of 6,000,000 tugrugs (~4140 USD). Since he began his business, his monthly earnings have increased to between 300,000 and 350,000 tugrugs (~205-240 USD) and he has been able to purchase furniture for his home. He would eventually like to purchase an apartment where his family would be more comfortable.

Ganzorig is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase groceries for his growing business.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for his business

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 28 years old. He is married and father of one child. Micky, as he is popularly called by his peers, is an achiever. He is a creative and hard working, talented young man who does not play with his work. He is a cobbler and slippers manufacturer. He manufactures slippers for both sexes and treks them through his apprentices. He has won the hearts of many through his work and commitment towards the community. He started this business as a cobbler and he was sewing torn flip-flops and polishing shoes. Now, he says, through hard work and the favor of God he manufactures Ghana-made slippers and sells them across Ghana. He has been in business for six years now, with three apprentices who are learning skills for their future dependency. His major problem has to do with funds to buy raw materials in bulk. He says that the price increase of materials, due to the dollar difference to the Ghana cedi has made business difficult. He therefore requests for the loan assistance to buy raw materials like leather, glue, nails and thread, etc. This will enable him to meet targets set by his customers. He would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy tools and working materials like leathers, glue, nails and thread etc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth, es una mujer muy respetuosa, vive en el distrito de Manantay, región Ucayali, tiene 29 años, es madre de dos hijos, ambos menores de edad, ella se dedica a administrar su bodega, a la venta de productos de belleza, al alquiler de su motocarro y por las noches a la venta de pollos broaster (comida al paso), todas estas actividades las realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es chofer de camiones. Ruth forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas de Ucayali”, desde un año.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la venta de bebidas.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, que será invertido  en la compra de productos en general para su bodega. La meta de Ruth es tener una tienda bien implementada y más grande.
texts.en:
Ruth is a very respected woman. She lives in the Manantay District, in the region of Ucayali. She is 29 years old and is the mother of two children (both minors). She works as a small grocery store owner. She also sells beauty products. She rents her car to customers. At night she sells roasted chicken (take out). All of these activities she does from her home with the support of her husband who also works as a truck driver. For the past year, Ruth has been a member of “Las Brisas” Community Bank. The first loan she received (for 300 soles) she used to buy drinks to sell. Now she would like a loan for 1200 soles that she will use to buy more products for her store. Her goal is to have a store that is well run and larger.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to buy various products for her store.

loans.name: Raby

texts.fr: Raby T. est une femme de 58 ans, elle est veuve et mère d'un enfant et a la garde de sa petite fille. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara-Ouest2 depuis 7 ans et a une bonne expérience en matière de crédit pour en avoir bénéficié à 14 fois de suite. Son activité est la vente d'arachide, elle collecte son produit à partir des villages environnants pour le revendre au niveau de marchés hebdomadaires. Son objectif est de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins et d'assurer sa nourriture, celle de son enfant et de sa petite fille.
texts.en:
Raby T. is a 58-year-old woman. She is a widow and mother of one child and also takes care of her granddaughter. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois de Vélingara-Ouest2 for seven years and has good experience concerning credit, having benefited from it 14 consecutive times. She sells peanuts; she collects her goods from neighboring villages to resell them at the weekly markets. Her goal is to be able to meet her needs and to secure enough food for herself, her child and her granddaughter.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build up her small business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia K. is from the coastal town of Talim, Binangonan, Rizal. She is 39 years old. She is married and has 5 young children. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish in her village and nearby town. 

Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a week for these activities. In 2009, Virginia joined ASHI to secure access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASHI. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fishnet and bamboos. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Virginia from ASHI. She plans to use the additional proceeds generated from the business to develop her business.

She hopes that, with the help of ASHI and the KIVA field partner, she can reach her ambition to step out from poverty, expand her business, and pay for the needs of her five children in school.


About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishnet and bamboo.

loans.name: Seanghour

texts.en:
Miss. Seanghour K., age 22, is single and lives with her sisters, brothers and parents in a small village off of National Road number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Seanghour is not shown in the photo, her parents were available instead. 

Seanghour has been a farmer for 7 years. She grows rice and vegetables on her farmland in the village. She doesn’t have enough capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice and vegetable farm, so she is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1,100 to help her capital.

loans.use: To use for farming.

loans.name: Vicente Manuel

texts.es: Vicente Manuel tiene la edad de 41 años. El es un hombre muy trabajador y tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000. La actividad económica de Don Vicente es la venta de mariscos. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. El dio inicio con muy pocos productos, pues no tenía el capital suficiente pues decide recurrir a los financiamientos los que fueron de mucho apoyo, además en esos momentos el no tenía trabajo y encontró este medio de vida, el ofrece sus productos en un pequeño termo en donde prepara sus deliciosos ceviches. El financiamiento está destinado para capital de trabajo por lo que podrá comprar conchas, camarones, pescados y termos. El siempre tiene el sueño de obtener su propio local.
texts.en:
Vicente Manuel is 41 years old. He is a hardworking gentleman who has been partnering with Fundación León 2000 for quite some time. Don Vicente has been in the business of selling seafood for more than nine years. He began with very little inventory since he did not have sufficient capital. This is why he decided to utilize the loans, which have been of great help.

There is not enough work for him at the moment. Since this is how he must make a living, he started offering his products by preparing his delicious ceviches and offering them in small cups. This loan will be used as operating capital to buy clams, shrimp, fish, and cups. He always dreams of having his own vending location.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy clams, shrimp, fish, and cups

loans.name: Ayobami

texts.en: Ayobami is 35 old, married, and has 4 children. She lives in Ibadan town, in Oyo state, Nigeria. She sells medicine and she has been in this business for the past 10 years. Ayobami is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She is requesting for the loan amount of NGN50,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thanks to you all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: El Chanchito De Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL CHANCHITO D. SANTA ROSA”; Ellos son 10 miembros socios y amigos emprendedores y trabajadores; Ellos viven en la ciudad del Cusco en el departamento D. Cusco, se reúnen cada 19 D. cada mes en el distrito D. Huanchac en el local central D. la asociación Arariwa.

Nuestra socia es la Sr. Silvia, tiene 30 años D. edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos D. 9 y 2 años D. edad; Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades con la compra y venta D. carne, la socia venD. carne en el mercado el molino 2, ella hay tiene su stand en la sección D. carnes, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar carne al por mayor D. su proveedor y D. este modo continuar con su pequeño negocio.
 Nuestros otros socios alternas sus actividades con el comercio minorista, ellos se dedican a vender comida en el mercado, comprar repuestos para su combi, otro implementar su tienda D. abarrotes, mejorar el negocio D. venta D. quesos, y otra socia para recargar su celular para prestar el servicio D. alquiler D. llamadas a celulares por minutos.

Los socios agradecen el préstamo y se comprometen a seguir cumpliendo con el pago D. sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the community bank "El Chanchito D. Santa Rosa." There are 10 members who are hard-working and enterprising friends. They live in the city of Cuzco in the district of Cuzco. They meet on the 19th of every month in the Huanchac district at the central office of the Arariwa Association.

Mrs. Silvia is 30 years old and lives with her partner. She has two children who are 9 and 2 years of age. She works buying and selling meat. She sells meat at the El Molino 2 market at her stand in the meat section. She needs the loan to buy meat in bulk from her dealer and keep her small business going.

The other group members work selling food in the market, buying parts for buses, running a grocery store, in cheese sales, and in cell phone rental to charge by the minute for calls. The members are thankful for the loan and are committed to repaying their debts on time.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat in bulk

loans.name: Erika Elena

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “KILLA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Erika,  ella tiene 34 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 17, 15 y 9 años de edad, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tiene un bar restaurante, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio en especial su bar con copas y bebidas alcohólicas.
 
La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
