Our client is a member of the Killa Communal Bank. She lives in the Huanchac district of the Cusco province, department of Cusco.

Ms. Erika is a 34-year-old married mother with three children ages 17, 15, and 9. Our client alternates her household duties with her duties as a small business owner; she owns a restaurant & bar. She is requesting this loan in order to restock her business, especially her bar, with glasses and alcoholic beverages.

Our client values and is very grateful for the support she has been given through this organization and she commits to making her payments according to the pre-established terms.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase glasses and alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma V. is from the village of Sugbongcogon, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years-old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Elma owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from selling personal products from Avon and other brands.in the local community. Elma has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elma joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
la sra, Blanca Rosa C. O. tiene 67 años de edad, vive en la colonia San Miguel de la Ciudad Capital, Blanca se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene poco tiempo de tener su negocio el cual le genera ingresos para cubrir sus gastos personales. Blanca es una persona de la tercera edad, esta es su unica fuente de ingresos, nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que este negocio hace sentirse activa y no estar sentada sin hacer nada todo el dia, blanca es una mujer muy trabajadora pero a su edad ya no puede hacer mucho.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mas variedad de productos y mas surtida su pulperia.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir sus gastos como ser alimentacion, vestuario y vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca Rosa C. O. is 67 years old and lives in the San Miguel neighborhood of the capital city of Tegucigalpa. She sells popular consumer products. Blanca has managed her business for a short period of time and started it so that she could generate income to cover her personal expenses. Since she is a senior citizen, this is her only source of income. Blanca says she is happy with this business because it keeps her active and prevents her from doing nothing all day. Despite being a hardworking woman, she is not able to do much at her age.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise so that she can have a wider variety of products and a well-stocked store. The income that she needs will go toward covering expenses such as food, clothing, and shelter.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Garnik

texts.en:
Garnik A. is 38 years old and married with two children.  He is the family’s main breadwinner. His wife takes care of their two young children. The family lives with Garnik’s parents.
 
Garnik owns an internet club and DVD rental shop. The big demand for information exchange in Armenia is being hampered by high internet costs and low internet penetration. Only 7% of the population are internet users. Therefore internet clubs are highly popular in Armenia, giving internet access to the large number of people who don’t have permanent access to the internet.
 
Garnik has been in this business since 2005. He rents the club’s premises in one of the busy streets of the capital city, Yerevan. Currently there are 10 computers with internet access in the club. Taking into consideration the large demand for more desks, Garnik has applied for the loan to purchase 5 more computers and desks.

loans.use: To purchase computers and computer desks

loans.name: Mayra Jeanette

texts.es: Mayra Jeanette A. C. de 34 años de edad, reside en Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella posee una venta de productos desechables como platos, vasos, cucharas y tenedores, así mismo comercializa huevos, granos básicos, aceite de cocina, cremas y talcos para bebés, salsas y otros productos más. Mayra vive junto a su esposo de 36 años de edad, un hombre muy responsable con su hogar, y también vive junto a sus dos hijas menores de edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. El negocio de Mayra esta ubicado en el mercado municipal de San Martín, siempre en el departamento de San Salvador, en donde posee su negocio desde hace 2 años, tiempo en el cual se ha ido dando a conocer y obteniendo clientes. El mayor deseo de ella es el de poder surtir aún más su negocio comprando todos los productos antes mencionados por mayor, debido a que en la zona que se encuentra ubicada, la mayoría de personas llegan a comprar en grandes cantidades con el fin de surtir negocios más pequeños como tiendas. Mayra solicita un préstamo y así de esta manera poder realizar el deseo de mejorar en su negocio, y de esta forma mejorar sus ventas y salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Mayra Jeanette A. C. is 34 years old and resides in Illopango, which is located in the Department of San Salvador. She has a store where she sells disposable products such as plates, cups, spoons, and forks. In addition, she sells eggs, basic grains, cooking oil, lotions and talcum powder for babies, sauces, and other products. Mayra lives with her husband, who is 36 years old and a very responsible man, and their two young daughters who are enrolled in school.

Mayra’s business is located at the municipal market in San Martín, which is also in the Department of San Salvador. She has been in business for two years and during that time she has been able to create publicity and attract customers. Her greatest wish is to increase her inventory by purchasing all of her products in bulk. In the area where her business is located, most of the people who come to shop buy in large quantities to stock their own businesses, such as smaller general stores.

Mayra is requesting a loan so that she can improve her business. By increasing her sales, she will be able to move forward together with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase disposable products & food items

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es: Ana Mirian F. T. de 47 años de edad, es muy responsable y trabajadora, reside en el municipio de San Agustín ubicado en el departamento de Usulután, en donde vive junto a su esposo. Ana se dedica a la venta de pescado, negocio el cual esta ubicado en el mercado municipal de San Agustín en donde se encuentra en las zonas de mariscos, por lo que posee gran cantidad de competencia. Es por esta razón que Ana desea invertir en el negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de pescado, así mismo mayor variedad de mariscos como: camarones, cangrejos, y otros más, lo cual le garantice estar sobre su competencia. Ana cuenta con varios clientes quienes compran sus productos semanalmente, lo que le ha permitido contar con un negocio estable, pero lo que Ana más desea es poder contar con una venta más fuerte y de esta forma aumentar sus ventas, lo cual es muy necesario para el mantenimiento de su casa, ya que de esta forma tanto ella como su esposo podrán contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Ana Mirian F. T., 47 years old, is very responsible and hardworking. She lives in the town of San Agustín which is located in Usulután Department, where she lives with her husband. Ana sells fish, and her business is located in the municipal market of San Agustín, which is found in a shellfish area, so there is a large amount of competition here. For this reason Ana wants to invest in the business, buying greater amounts of fish as well as a greater variety of seafood like shrimp, crabs and others, which would guarantee that she can outdo the competition. Ana has several customers who buy her products weekly, which has permitted her to count on a stable business, but what Ana wants most is to have a stronger business that will increase her sales. This is very necessary in order to maintain her house, since in this way both she and her husband will be able to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seafood to sell

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is a married with two children; neither of her children goes to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She owns a charcoal stall in Mengo Mackay selling charcoal.  She buys bags of charcoal from Natete market and so uses public transport to and from shopping. She plans to use this loan of 200000/= to buy more sacks of charcoal.   

Prima has been in  this business for six years. She sells to all people around the area but mainly retail. She works six days a week and depends on this job for a living. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big and buying a delivery van.

Prima decided to join MCDT because of low interest charged.  She  resides in and rents  a house which has electricity and  piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes food, rent and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Bissimilahi Group

texts.en:
In the photo are the members of the “Bissimilahi” group. They are people with small-scale businesses based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan that these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Aruna T. who is age forty-five and was born in Magbese village. He is married to a businesswoman and they have four children.

For ten years now, Aruna has been selling stationery (papers, pens, envelopes, etc.) and he also photocopies documents for a fee. He will use his share of the loan to buy ink, paper, pens, etc., in large quantity.

loans.use: To buy ink, papers, pens, etc., in large quantity

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen belongs to an industrial city of Pakistan called Gujranwala. She lives in a two-room brick house with her family. She is 40 years old and married to M. H., who has a construction-supplies business.
  
A very talented lady, Parveen is involved in embroidering clothes. She crafts beautiful embroidery designs on clothes, which helps her in attracting more customers toward her talent. She has been making embroidered clothes for the past six years and is getting good earnings from it. 
  
She is the mother of five children. Only her two youngest children are able to get an education. She has delivered her talent to her elder daughters, who now also help her in completing the orders. Her son has a business of selling crockery.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, he will buy construction supplies such as cement, bricks and sand in large quantities.
  
Parveen is hopeful that this investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s work and his monthly income will go up. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and has proved herself a responsible client.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for the business

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Flordeliz S. is a married woman who lives in Purok 1, Tiling, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: pig fattening, dealer of Avon, Natasha and Sara Lee, and a fishing business.  Her husband, Igil, who is 43 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are 7 to 18 years old. 

Flordeliz joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1991 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 22 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Flordeliz has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $127, thus raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 23rd cycle loan, she is borrowing 19,500 PHP which she intends to use to purchase fishing gear and more pigs so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Flordeliz S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To fund operations of her three businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows to resell

loans.name: Palmira Del Belen

texts.es: Palmira tiene dos hijos los cuales estan en edad escolar, ella trabaja en su bodega que esta ubicada en su propia casa, su sueño es poder darles a sus hijos todo lo mejor y tener una calidad de vida buena, ya que ellos son aún muy pequeños, ella  solicita el crédito para compra de mercaderi y poder ampliar su negocio, se le brinda el crédito por contar con buenas referencias personales y capacidad de pago.
texts.en: Palmira has two children who are school-age. She works in her store that is located in her home. Her dream is to be able to give her children all the best and to have a good quality of life. Since they are still very small, she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to be able to expand her business.  She is being granted a loan because she has good personal references and the ability to pay.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
Irshad is a very supportive lady. She has a dairy business. She does this business at her home by getting milk from the buffalo. She sells milk to her nearby areas and generates income for the family. 

She comes from a city named Pakpattan, famous in Pakistan for its agriculture industry. She is a widow and lives in her father’s home. Her father sells a Punjabi food item named "Gool gappay" ( round balls filled with yogurt and spicy sauces) to his customers on a four-wheeled cart  and earns income for the family. Her brother also lives with her and he operates a CD center in the market. He sells different video CDs and DVDs to his clients at reasonable prices. 

Irshad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother’s business. With the loan, he will buy CDs and DVDs in bulk to sell at his CD center. He has been in this business for over 10 years and Irshad is hopeful that an investment will help his business and take it to more profitable position. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy CDs & DVDs for CD center business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A. is from the village of Bonbon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 34 years old. Evelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling seafood products like sardines, mackerel and milkfish in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.(photo is with Evelyn's daughter).

In 2010, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional  tons of fishes to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tons of fishes to sell

location.town: Bonbon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Galiphah

texts.en:
Galiphah is a married woman who lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing.

She has operated a cafe business for the past two years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Galiphah faces a major challenge of seasonality and competition from other cafe operators. She hopes to expand her business and establish a restaurant in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of cooking flour, baking flour, sacks of rice, cooking oil and sacks of beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of cooking flour, baking flour, sacks of rice, cooking oil and sacks of beans

loans.name: Hurelbaatar

texts.en: Hurelbaatar D. is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent and fence in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. His wife works as a teacher for a local school, his oldest daughter is university student and his youngest daughter attends a local secondary school. He operates a transportation business between local towns and cities. He started his own business in 1996 by operating a consumer goods trading business at the local market which is currently managed by his wife during summer months. After years of successful operation, he was able to start new business of transportation business in 2004 and has since built a stable operation with his new business. One day, Hurelbaatar would like to be able to purchase a larger bus in order to transport more people between towns. He is a talkative, open minded and hardworking man and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan so that he can purchase new machinery parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase a larger bus in order to transport more people

loans.name: Rosemarie's Group

texts.en:
RoseMarie E. resides in the village of Campo 4, Ramon, Magsaysay. She is 52 years old and lives with her loving family. She is the leader of the three-member member group loan offered by Paglaum Multipurpose Cooperative. The name of the group is RoseMarie E.' Group. While each of the members take out individual loans, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loan of someone in the group who defaults.

RoseMarie started her business three years ago to support to her family's needs. Since she became a good member at PMPC, she has earned a lot with her food vending business.

Through her generating income by selling in local communities, she requests another loan amounting 7,000 PHP for additional capital, which will help increase her business.
Rosemarie access here business since she joined PMPC and helping them to improve living situation.PAGLAUM MULTIPURPOSE COOPERATIVE is one of Progressive Cooperative,reaching out to rural  communities.About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria M. G. es conocida por ser una excelente vendedora, en la Canalete de Alajuela.
Aprovechando sus habilidades decidió   empezar su negocio de ventas por catalogo, en donde vende todo tipos de  productos, desde electrodomésticos,  hasta productos de uso personal y ropa que ella misma confecciona.
En este momento ella necesita un préstamo de  ₡598000 (Quinientos noventa y ocho mil colones) para la compra de más productos  con el fin de  generar mayor diversidad  y mayores ganancias  para su negocio. 
Ella es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Maria is known for being an excellent saleswoman in the Canalete de Alajuela. Taking advantage of her abilities, she decided to begin her business selling everything from electrical appliances to personal use items and clothing that she makes herself. 

She is requesting a loan of 598000 colones to buy more products with the goal of having greater variety and generating more income for her business. She is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, one of 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Sasine Ole

texts.en:
Sasine Ole N. is 42 years old, married, and a father of six children. He has been farming in Narok for ten years.

Sasine learned about KADET from a member of a group that is registered with KADET. This will be his first loan, and he plans to use it to buy farm inputs and prepare the land for planting.  He plans to use the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan to re-invest in the farm.

Sasine's hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and to be able to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and prepare the land for planting

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda is a 63-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  buy and sell of peanuts and pig fattening.   She lives in San Carlos City, Negros Occidental.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  By working hard in her buy and sell of peanuts and pig fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000.  Emelinda is borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can purchase new equipment. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP 5,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Emelinda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.  

A

loans.use: to purchase new equipment

loans.name: Federico

texts.es: El señor Federico es chofer y trabaja con su movilidad en servicio de transporte de pasajeros. Está afiliado al sindicato de transportes Eduardo Avaroa; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de un motor nuevo para su vehiculo, ya que es la fuente de ingreso para mantener  a su familia. Vive en alquiler ubicado en la zona de Villa Tejada Rectangular de la ciudad de El Alto; es casado y tiene dos hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se el otorgaron, pues es cliente nuestro desde el año 2008.
texts.en: Señor Federico is a driver and uses his vehicle to transport passengers. He is a member of the Eduardo Avaroa transportation union. He needs the loan to buy a new motor for his vehicle, since it is his source of income for maintaining his family. He lives in a rented dwelling in the Villa Tejada Rectangular zome of the city of El Alto. He is married and has two children. This loan client is very satisfied with the loans that have been granted to him; he has been a client since the year 2008.

loans.use: to buy a motor for his vehicle for passenger transport

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is a farmer from Qalqilia. He has a plot of land that he plants with seasonal vegetables, besides the fruits trees he takes care of. This makes up his only source of income.

Ammar is a father of three daughters and three sons.  Ammar wants to increase the variety of vegetables he plants, so he took out a loan from FATEN to purchase more and different seedlings.

Ammar is photographed in the picture here.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings of seasonal vegetables.

loans.name: Alianza Group

texts.es:
El comité Alianza nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando también en la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
Este comité está integrado por mujeres que se distribuyen tanto por la ciudad de San Lorenzo como de Capiatá, fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas.
La Sra. Fidelina F., presidenta del grupo, tiene 29 años, ella es una mujer emprendedora e innovadora, se dedica a la venta de ropas, es muy activa y amable, por eso posee una gran cantidad de clientes, pues quedan muy satisfechos con su trato además de la calidad de los productos que ofrece.
Hoy día, solicita el crédito a Kiva para adquirir abrigos, pantalones, medias y bufandas, pues desea poder tener muchas mercaderías que ofrecer en esta estación de frío, próxima a invierno.
texts.en:
The Alianza (Alliance) committee was born after much effort and with the help of another committee that was also working in the city of San Lorenzo. The present committee is composed of women who are distributed throughout the cities of San Lorenzo and Capiata. They chose as their principal objective the growth of each member.

Fidelina, president of the group, is 29 years old. She is an enterprising and innovative woman who sells clothing. Fidelina is very active and friendly and, for this reason, has a large number of customers who are very satisfied with how she treats them, in addition to the quality of the products she offers.

Now, Fidelina is requesting a loan through Kiva to acquire coats, pants, hose, and scarves. She wants to be able to obtain a lot of merchandise to offer during this chilly season, just before winter.

loans.use: TO BUY SEASONAL COATS, PANTS, STOCKINGS, SCARVES, ETC., TO SELL

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de materiales de construcción, ella provee a las diferentes tiendas, ella vende cemento, clavos, arena entre otros materiales, la socia trabaja en forma independiente por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de materiales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Elizabeth belongs to the Communal Bank “Los Angeles” (The Angels) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 32 years old and in a common-law marriage. Elizabeth divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling construction materials to different stores. She offers cement, nails, sand, and other materials. Elizabeth works independently and her job enables her to help her children get ahead. She wants to expand her business of selling construction materials, so she is requesting a loan to buy more of these items.

Elizabeth is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to acquire construction materials to sell.

loans.name: Darlyn Margarita

texts.es:
Este cliente es originaria del poblado de la mina el limón, es casada de profesión Licenciada en Enfermería, tiene  
 Hijos los cuales estudian en los colegios de la localidad,  actualmente esta laborando en el centro de salud de la misma población, con 25 años de servicios ahora ocupando el cargo de Director del mismo desde hace 2 años, ha sido cliente de la empresa con 4 financiamiento recibidos y este ultimo atravez del convenio con el mismo centro del que ella representa, dichos financiamientos les han ayudado a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
This borrower is originally from the town of La Mina El Limon. She is married and is a licensed nurse. She has children who study in the local schools. Currently, she works in the health center in her town which has been in service for 25 years. For 2 years now she has been the director of the center.

This is the fourth loan that she has received and the last one was made through an agreement with the same center that she works for. The loans have helped her to improve her living conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cinder-blocks, rebar, cement, stones and laborers.

loans.name: Atyrkan

texts.en:
Atyrkan lives in Tashkomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 48 and married to a private entrepreneur. Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 20,000 soms, Atyrkan rented a shop and started to sell clothes, bags, and toys. At the moment her monthly profit is 48,000 soms. With money earned from the business, she repaired the house and started building a café. Atyrkan applied for this loan because she needs additional funds to purchase summer clothes. She hopes that the loan will help increase the turnover of her commodities. In the future, the family plans to celebrate their daughter’s wedding.

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more lapper, handbags, and eggs to offer for sale

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es: Maria Jesus nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 38 años de edad. Actualmente, Maria Jesus vive en la misma ciudad donde nació junto con su pareja y su único hijo. María Jesús tiene una pequeña pollería donde trabajan dos ayudantes el pollero y mozo, ella también tiene un restaurante que tiene de nombre peculiar “Choza Rustica”. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Maria Jesus requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del local. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Hatun  Rumiyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: María Jesús was born in the city of Cusco, Peru, and she is 38 years old. Maria now lives in the same city where she was born, along with her partner and their only son. María Jesús has a small chicken stand where two assistants work, the poulterer and a service boy. She also has a restaurant which has the appropriate name, "Choza Rustica" (Rustic Hut). She has already had this business for a number of years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. At this time María Jesús needs the loan to do some maintenance on her premises. This communal bank member is a responsible and hard-working person, and because of these qualities, her fellow bank members invited her to participate in the communal bank "Hatun Rumiyoc" of the Arariwa Association.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her restaurant premises.

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en: Mr. Enkhbold is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three children, 19, 16 and 14, two of them in secondary school. He has been working as a salesman in a small construction retail and service company since 2010. His wife runs a private business of construction decoration. The family is planning to renovate their house to improve their living conditions, which he thinks will be important to the further education of his children.

loans.use: To renovate his house for better living condition.

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este hermoso lugar conocimos a la señora Digna. Tiene 59 años de edad está casada y fruto de  relación tienen  cuatro hijos ya todos son mayores de edad pero el menor de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa.
 
Es un ama de casa que para ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (perfumería, artículos de belleza y accesorios para damas), también hace poco empezó a vender ropa por catalogo y según nos cuenta ha tenido muchas ventas de estos productos y estas ventas las realiza al mismo tiempo que vende sus otros productos, su forma  de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres a cuatro días por semana en sus entregas y cobros ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada dia domingo. Nos cuenta que lleva en la actividad comercial  por más de diez años y que ha tenido sus altas y bajas pero nunca se ha rendido porque es una mujer muy luchadora.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cosméticos, cremas y bisutería. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que reciben para seguir en sus negocios. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'San Esteban' community bank meet in the town of Charapoto.  This town is known for its traditional culture and also for the fact that it is located just a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

In this beautiful place, we meet 59 year-old Digna who is married and has four children who are all now grown up.  Her youngest still lives with her.  Her husband works in a company.

Digna is a housewife who, in order to help with her household expenses, sells Avon products (perfumes, beauty products and ladies' accessories).  She also recently started selling clothes through catalogs.  She tells us that she has sold a lot of these products and makes these sales at the same time as she sells her other products.  She makes her sales door to door and works three to four days a week, delivering goods and collecting payment.  She leaves her goods with her customers on credit and collects payment every Sunday.  She tells us that she has been buying and selling for more than ten years.  The business has had its ups and downs but she has never given up because she is a fighter.

Digna will use this loan to buy clothes, perfume, cosmetics, creams and costume jewelry.  She is a founding member of her community bank and she likes it because of the help they receive to continue in their businesses.

Digna's dream is to keep going with her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfume, cosmetics, creams and costume jewelry

loans.name: Zeyneb

texts.ru:
Zeyneb zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoim mujem i detmi. Zeyneb 30 let. 
Ona seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kurici dlya pereprodaji. Ona uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom . Etomu biznessu ona nuchilas u svoyey mami.
texts.en:
Zeyneb is married and has two children.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her husband and children.  Zeyneb  is 30 years old.
 
She now needs 2000 AZN to buy chickens for resale.  She has been poultry farming for five years.  She started this business with her mother.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a 34 year old married man, father of one child. Moustafa has been a school bus driver since 4 years ago. He has also been a mechanic for 12 years.

Moustafa started working double businesses because he planned to provide his family with a better brighter future. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua because he wants to exchange his bus with a modern new one. A new bus will iensure his students' comfort and increase the number of students he can serve.

This is Moustafa's third cycle with Al Majmoua. All of his previous loans helped in improving his business and reflected positively on his social and financial situation. He is a borrower in good standing. His good reputation helps a lot in encouraging a lot of families to assign him to transport their children to and from school. He hopes to increase the number of buses he owns to expand his working area.

loans.use: to buy a new bus to replace the one he has.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 49 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 6 children.

Rosalinda works in the fish industry and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for 25 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 3000 to buy 1 box of fish to sell at retail. Rosalinda joined PMPC this year. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy 1 box of fish to sell at retail

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Rex

texts.en:
Rex is 27 years of age and is single. He lives with his parents, brothers, and sisters. Rex has been managing his hog-raising business for 10 years. After taking care of the hogs for four months, he sells them earning P2,000 per head. Rex wants to help his parents uplift their standard of living.
Sometimes, Rex has had difficulties in providing feed for his pigs. This was the reason he decided to request a loan of P25,000 to buy feed for his pigs. He will look to the success of his business to extend his help to his parents in times of financial shortage.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Grâce Divine Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GRÂCE DIVINE est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Prudencia est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Prudencia est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un informaticien du nom de Thomas. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé et qui vit avec eux. Prudencia assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la maison. Prudencia a arrêté l'école au cours primaire. Depuis une dizaine d'année, Prudencia vend des tissus et des feuilles de bissap par le système de distribution. Prudencia s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Prudencia sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GRÂCE DIVINE, un troisième crédit. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
GRÂCE DIVINE Group is made up of three friends. For the third time, this group is seeking financial help from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

The group's representative is named Prudencia, and is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 35 years old, and married to a computer specialist named Thomas. The couple has one school-attending child who lives with them. Prudencia and her husband take care of the various household expenses together.

Prudencia dropped out of elementary school. For approximately ten years, she's been selling fabrics and hibiscus leaves through the distribution system. She gets her supplies in Benin. Eager to meet customer demand and increase her revenue and income, she's seeking a third loan, together with the other member of the group. The previous two loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and hibiscus leaves

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
L. señora Martha cuenta con L. edad D. 39 años y está casada con el señor Isidro desD. hacen 19 años, juntos tiene 3 hijos génesis, Emanuel y sarai quienes están estudian, L. mayor curso el segundo año D. prepa, uno más segundo año D. primaria y L. pequeña tercer año D. preescolar, se dedica a L. elaboración y venta D. pan desD. hacen 10 años.
Dice que se animo a invertir en este negocio, ya que quería buscar L. forma D. apoyar a su esposo con los gastos D. L. casa y a sus hijos con sus estudios, también para gozar D. un mejor nivel D. vida, al igual que una buena solvencia económica, el crédito que le otorgaron lo va a invertir en L. compra D. mas insumos como son: harina, manteca, azúcar, levadura, caneL., bicarbonato, leña, etc. Para continuar con L. elaboración D. su producto.
Doña marta comenta que uno des retos que tiene en su negocio es el D. hacerlo crecer un poco más, ya que quiere poner una panadería, para así tener una amplia variedad D. productos, así incrementar y mejorar sus ventas e ingresos, puesto que le ayudan a seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios superiores.
“Estoy muy agradecida con fundación realidad por este gran apoyo que han dado, ya que podre ampliar un poco más le negocio y tener una mejor calidad D. vida junto con mi familia”. Gracias
texts.en:
Martha is 39 years old, and has been married to Isidro for 19 years. They have 3 children, Génesis, Emanuel and Sarai, who are in school. The oldest girl is in her second year of high school, the boy is in his second year of elementary school and the little girl is in her third year of preschool. 

Martha has worked making and selling bread for 10 years. She says she was inspired to start this business because she wanted to find a way to support her husband with the household expenses and her children with their studies, and to enjoy a better standard of living as well as economic solvency. She is going to invest the loan money in purchasing more baking supplies, such as flour, oil and butter, sugar, yeast, cinnamon, baking soda, firewood, etc., so she can continue making her products. 

Martha says that one of her business goals is to make it grow a little more. She wants to have a bakery shop so she can have a wiD. variety of products, thereby increasing and improving her sales and income, so she can continue supporting her children with their education. "I am very grateful to Fundación Realidad [FRAC] for this great support they have given, so that I will be able to expand the business a little more and have a better quality of life for me and my family. Thank you."

loans.use: to purchase more supplies such as flour, oil and butter, sugar, yeast, cinnamon, baking soda, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a divorced woman with three children who attend school. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Saumu has operated a charcoal-selling business for the past three years; her potential clients are the people who come to the marketplace. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase more stocks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of access to loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is 29 years old and lives in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past nine years, Jamila has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, where she sells bed covers, blouses, skirts and traditional Ugandan dresses called gomeses. Jamila is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jamila who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

To help expand her business, Jamila is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cloth and will help Jamila to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for her family. Jamila hopes that in the future she will be able to open up other clothing stores nearby.

loans.use: to buy cloth to make clothes

loans.name: Sara Esther

texts.es: Sara Con su credikiva anterior compró productos que vienen en sus guias especializadas y ganó descuentos por el volumen y es sistema de su compra, pues recurrió a los que presentaban grandes descuentos. En la actualidad comprará productos al pormayor para obtener descuentos por volumen , pues se acerca la temporada de mayor movimiento comercial, el final del año,  y espera aprovecharla para hacer de esta inversión todo un éxito. Ella dice a sus financiadores de Kiva : " Estoy muy agradecida por la ayuda recibida"
texts.en: With her previous Kiva loan, Sara bought merchandise to sell in her specialized catalogues. She received discounts due to the large volume and her system of purchasing, and she returns to those who offer the larger discounts. Sara will now continue to purchase wholesale products in order to receive bulk discounts - the busiest end-of-year shopping season is approaching which she hopes to take advantage of and make this investment a success. Sara tells her Kiva funders; "I am very grateful for the help I have received"

loans.use: to purchase wholesale cosmetics in order to obtain discounts

loans.name: Martin Njuguna

texts.en: Martin is a 25-year-old married man. He describes himself as vigilant. He operates a transportation service where he provides "tuk tuk" transport services. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in Nakuru. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the traffic police disturbance. He will use the Kes 95,000 loan to buy spare parts and save for buying another "tuk tuk". His business goal is to own more "tuk tuk"s within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and save to buy another "tuk tuk" (small transport vehicle).

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria sells "wakye" (cooked beans and rice), "banku" (maize dumplings) and cocked rice and stew at Besease. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer.  

Victoria has been selling "banku" and rice for seven years. She assists her husband to provide for the family. She will use her loan to buy rice and maize in bulk for food preparation and sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and maize in bulk for food preparation and sale.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela, de 19 años, es una señorita muy amable, buena y trabajadora, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive a lado de sus padres y sus cuatro hermanos a quienes apoya mucho en sus estudios y algunas necesidades que tienen y son propias de su edad. El trabajo de Graciela consiste en la venta de comida, desde muy temprano trabaja yendo al mercado en busca de los mejores ingredientes y las verduras más seleccionadas, de ahí en su casa prepara los distintos platos para que pueda ofrecer a sus clientes, por lo que se va a los aserraderos de la ciudad en donde tiene contrato con algunos trabajadores a quienes les brinda pensión. Recién lleva tres meses en el negocio, antes trabajaba en su bodega, pero con el tiempo tuvo que cambiar su actividad ya que no le brindaba muchas ganancias, ahora trabaja tranquila junto a su tia y su madre quienes la apoyan en todo.
Al principio tenía muchas dudas y dificultades, pero gracias al apoyo de su familia pudo superarlos, ahora esta muy contenta ya que trabaja tranquila con el apoyo de todos ellos, actualmente atiende un promedio de 30 platos diarios solo pedidos y hace unos 20 más que son su respaldo. Desea mas adelante poner su restaurante y así seguir trabajando a lado de su familia y progresando juntos. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, además se compromete a ser una cliente responsable y sobre todo colaboradora con su banco comunal al que esta muy feliz de pertenecer ya que le brindan mucha confianza y solidaridad. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará materiales, ingredientes e insumos para seguir haciendo su trabajo ya que tiene mayor demanda y desea satisfacer a todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Graciela is 19 years old.  She is a very pleasant, kind, and hardworking young woman.  She is single and does not have any children.  She lives with her parents and her four siblings, whom she helps with their studies and with some of the difficulties they have which are typical of their age.  

Graciela makes a living selling meals.  She begins her work very early, going first to the market in search of the best ingredients and the choicest vegetables, then going home to prepare various meals that she can offer her customers.  She then goes off to the city’s sawmills, where she has a contract with some of the workers to bring them meals daily.  Graciela has only been in business for three months; she previously had a bodega, but she had to change her economic activity because it was not bringing in much profit.  She now works happily with her aunt and her mother, who help her with everything.

At first Graciela had numerous doubts and difficulties, but thanks to help from her family she was able to overcome these problems.  She is now very happy, since her work is easier with all of their help.  She currently serves an average of 30 pre-ordered meals per day, and prepares about 20 more meals as backup.  Graciela would like to set up a restaurant eventually, which would allow her to continue working with her family and to improve their lives together.  This will be her first loan with MFP, and she hopes that working with the organization will help her continue toward her goals.  She promises to be a responsible customer and is very happy to belong to her communal bank, since the other members bring much confidence and solidarity.  Graciela will use the amount she is asking for, 2000 soles, to purchase materials, ingredients, and supplies so that she can continue with her work, since demand has increased and she wants to meet all of her customers’ needs.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for preparing meals.

loans.name: Nemie

texts.en:
Nemie is 45 years old, and married with six children. With two children in school, Nemie works very hard to provide for them.  Nemie runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Nemie has been in this business for five years, and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, milk, shampoo, bread, sardines, etc. In the future, Nemie would like to save enough money, so she can afford to send her two children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children. 

Anabella has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Anabella has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Anabella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Saidbek

texts.ru:
Саидбек молодой и жизнерадостный мужчина 38 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Саидбек со своей семьей живет в сельской местности. У него большое хозяйство. Родители Саидбека также живут вместе с ним.
Саидбек сам торгует на рынке фруктами. Он покупает оптом фрукты и продает в розницу. Так Саидбек зарабатывает на жизнь. У Саидбека свои постоянные клиенты. От данного дела у него хороший стабильный доход. 
Сейчас Саидбек хочет расширить свой бизнес. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд за кредитом. Кредит Саидбек хочет использовать для расширения своего бизнеса.
Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary O., a 38 years old woman sells food items to people. She is married with five (5) children. She is proud of her business and promise to effectively use the above amount to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Madame K. lives in Nkurankan, Ghana and sells a variety of pharmaceutical products.  She attends to a lot of customers in a day. She needs a Kiva loan of $1100.00 to enable her to buy more drugs to stock her shop.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamed M. is 26 years and had no opportunity for formal education.  During the civil war in Sierra Leone, M. was a refugee in Guinea where he learned tailoring.  When he returned from Guinea, M. settled in a village with his family and life was not easy for him.  He then came to Kabala and began to sew clothes for people using a friend’s sewing machine.

M. joined SMT and with his first loans purchased two sewing machines and rented another two.  He asked four other young men to assist him in his sewing business.  M.’s business has continued to progress and he would like to expand it.  With a new loan he plans to buy a embroidery machine and specialized thread.  M. has made himself responsible for his young sisters' and brothers’ education expenses, and his business has managed to provide continuing employment for the four other young men.

loans.use: Purchase emboidery machine and specialized thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more fish and kerosene to sell

loans.name: Soum

texts.en: Mrs. Soum N. is a 57 year old mother who works with her husband on their plot of farmland growing vegetables. However, she can typically make only a meager sum. To help supplement their household income, one of their children and their son in-law are employed at a garment factory, earning together around $180 per month. Now, Mrs. Soum N. is requesting a loan to purchase fashionable clothes for her children to resell to their coworkers at a good price.

loans.use: To purchase fashionable clothes to sell to their coworkers at a good price.

loans.name: Shamsi

texts.en: Shamsi H. is a 39-year-old man who owns a small farm and raises livestock in the southern Azerbaijani region of Sattli. Shamsi is married and has three sons. He does everything possible to improve the conditions of his family. He has more than ten years of experience in this field. But during the last two years this business brings him less and less income. Currently Shamsi has two calves. As soon as they are raised he will sell them. Selling claves for meat production is the only o financial source of income in his family and he works very hard. Beef is in very high demand among Azerbaijani people and people use meat in their everyday cuisine. Shamsi decided to expand his business and purchase three calves each for 300 USD. For this purpose he has applied for 900 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase three calves

loans.name: María Bertola

texts.es:
María belongs to the Las Esmeraldas Communal Bank, AA. HH. San Juan Ucayali Pasaje José Balta S/N, Calleria District, Ucayali state. She is 62 years old and is mother to 11 children. Her husband is a farmer, but the income doesn't meet the household expenses, so María, with the first loan from Manuela Ramos for 300 Soles (US $100.00), decided to invest in beauty products.

To date, her beauty product sales and customers have increased, and now she sells various well-known brands of beauty products. She gets up very early to do her household chores, then she dedicates herself to selling products. She sells to customers house to house and also from her home.

With the recent loan from Manuela Ramos for 1,500 Soles (approximately US $502.00), which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy a large quantity of beauty products (500 Soles in 5 fragrances, 8 powders, 5 lotions, 10 deoderants, 15 creams, 4 shampoos, etc.), all of which will help her have a good supply of stock.

María is very happy to have her 11 healthy children and to have achieved that they have finished their studies. The older children now have their own families but she still has to educate the youngest children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Esmeraldas, AA. HH. San Juan Ucayali Pasaje José Balta S/N, del Distrito de Calleria del departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años y es madre de 11 hijos, su esposo es agricultor, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos del hogar, es así que María, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decide invertir en productos de belleza.

A la fecha, la venta de productos de belleza ha incrementado así como su clientela, ahora vende productos de belleza de varias marcas conocidas, se levanta muy temprano para atender las labores de la casa, luego de ello se dedica a la venta de sus productos. La venta la realiza casa por casa pero también atiende a sus clientes en su propio domicilio.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,500 (US$ 502.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza (S/. 500.00 en 5 fragancias, 8 talcos, 5 lociones, 10 desodorantes, 15 cremas, 4 champúes, etc.), todo esto le servirá para contar con un buen stock.

María está muy contenta de tener a sus 11 hijos sanos y haber logrado que terminen sus estudios. Los mayores ya tienen familia pero aun falta educar a los más pequeños.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products (cosmetics and perfumes)

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en: Teddy is 43 years old. Her current business is brick-making and selling her own bricks. She wants to use the profits from her business to construct a bigger house.

loans.use: To make and burn more bricks

loans.name: Aliagha

texts.en: Aliagha F. is a 56 year old man, married, with four children. He lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He owns and operates a small butcher shop. Aliagha established his business last year, and he does not have many customers. He applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan in the amount of $1100, and he plans to purchase some sheep and sell the meat at his butcher shop. He thinks this loan will help his business be very successful.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Having to support her children made Flor rent a small stand in the market and begin selling food. In those days she was having serious problems in her marriage.

For 4 years now Flor gets up very early to begin her sales during breakfast hours. This is what she does every morning, sell her most requested dishes, red noodles and ceviche. She alone, with her 12 year-old sister’s help, tends to her stall. Although she incurred costs to start her business, she says that it has been worthwhile and today she is motivated to work as she now has a newborn son.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La necesidad de mantener a sus hijos llevó a Flor a alquilar un pequeño puesto en el mercado y a empezar a vender comida. En aquel momento pasaba serios problemas en su matrimonio.

Desde hace cuatro años Flor amanece muy temprano para empezar con sus ventas a la hora del desayuno. Es así que todas sus mañanas transcurren vendiendo sus platos más requeridos, tallarines rojos y ceviche. Ella sola, con la ayuda de su hermana de doce años atiende su puesto. Aunque le costo empezar, dice que todo valió la pena y hoy tiene más motivos por el cual trabajar ya que acaba de dar a luz un nuevo hijo.

loans.use: Buy a larger stove and food supplies.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
Sr. Justo A. is 56 years old, and his wife, Sra. Blanca González, is 47 years old. They have four young children. They live together in a house that he managed to build after a great deal of effort.

Sr. Justo makes planters, tables, and laundry tubs out of stones. He makes these products by cutting and working with the stones. His wife has a nursery where she sells various kinds of plants that she also delivers to her customers.

They tell us that the income from these activities is used to give their children a better quality of life. The money was also used to complete the construction of their house that at the moment also serves as their place of work.

Sr. Justo’s dream is for his children to complete their education and become professionals. He is asking for a loan to buy cement and stones.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Justo A. de 56 años de edad esta casado con la Sra. Blanca González de 47 años, tienen cuatro hijos menores de edad y todos viven juntos en una casa que logro construir con mucho sacrificio.

Don Justo se dedica a la fabricación de macetas, mesas y lavaderos de piedra. Justo elabora estos productos tallando y trabajando las piedras, su esposa tiene un vivero donde comercializa plantas de distintas variedades y se encarga de la distribución de los mismos.

Ellos nos cuentan que gracias a los ingresos que adquirieron de estas actividades logrorom dar mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y construir su casa en donde hoy día también constituye su local comercial.

Sueña que sus hijos puedan culminar sus estudios y llegar a ser profesionales. Solicita el préstamo para compra de cemento y piedras.

loans.use: Purchase cement and stone

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam K. is 29 year old resident of Kinondoni in Dar Es Salaam. She runs a tie and dye-making store, which she has been doing for five years. She makes traditional attire, commonly known as vitenge, at her store and usually bought by ladies. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her traditional clothing business

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou S., aged 58, is married with three children in her care, and has been a member of the Manguiline Santhiaba Village Bank in Bignona for seven years. She sells fans and pearls that she buys in Ndiassane. Fatou wants to strengthen her business. With her income she provides for herself and contributes towards the family expenses. The loan she is requesting will be repaid after six months in one installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatou S., 58 ans, mariée, 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Santhiaba à Bignona depuis 7 ans. Elle vend des éventails et des perles qu’elle achète à Ndiassane. Fatou veut renforcer son commerce. Avec ses revenus elle se prend en charge et participe aux charges familiales. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Business selling fans and pearls

loans.name: Salafai

texts.en: Salafai U., 72, is married with eight children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business growing taro, yams, and bananas. She sells to the village and general public 4 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~$187 USD).  SPBD loans are Salafai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be used to improve her business and help out with family expenses.

loans.use: Salafai would like to make home improvements and pay for her kids' school fees.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort C. sells Banku, a local meal which she prepares for public sale. She is married and has three children. Her husband works as a farmer but does not earn enough money to support the family. Demand for Comfort's goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business in order to increase her profits.

She is requesting additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her Banku business.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.es:
Asteria tiene 47 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos que cursan estudios universitarios, vive junto a su esposo. 
Desde hace 12 años, se dedica a la venta de medicinas, negocio en el que le va muy bien y atiende casi durante todo el día, recibiendo el apoyo de su esposo Mariano, quien es médico. . Gracias a este negocio está solventando los gastos de la universidad de sus hijos, le gusta su trabajo porque puede tratar con muchas personas, sobre todo darles una buena atención y acogida. Como para toda madre, para Asteria es difícil tener lejos a sus hijos (por la universidad) y no verlos a diario. 
Con el dinero del préstamo quiere ampliar e implementar su negocio, posteriormente, junto a su esposo, tener un consultorio médico.
texts.en:
Asteria is 47 years old, and she has two children that are currently attending college. For the past 12 years she has been selling medicines, a business that she attends most of the day and in which she gets the support from her husband, Mariano, who is a doctor . Thanks to this business she is able to provide for her sons' education. She likes her work because she gets to talk to people, and she is able to provide them good attention and care. For Asteria it is very difficult (like for any mother) to be apart from her children, and to not see them daily. With the money that she will get from the loan she would like to expand her business so that later on she can open a medical practice with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cereceda, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount and variety  of the medicines that she sells, and in the future open a medical practice.

loans.name: Mrs. Phum Pheng's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phum P.'s Village Bank has 14 members and each will use their loan for different purposes. The members live in Peareach Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Phun P., president of the village bank and leader of this loan group, owns a small grocery store in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Oak Sam Art, is a farmer who now faces a small problem because his plantation field has infertile soil which has reduced crop yields. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Phun P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers for the field. Mrs. Phun P. is 28 years old and does not have children.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her husband's farm land

loans.name: Loa

texts.en:
Loa V., 55, is a widow and lives with two of her children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Since 1998, she has been working selling food to earn a living and is able to make US$ 6 each day. One of her children is married and one stays at home and helps manage the housework.

Loa would like to take out a loan of US$ 200 to install a public phone for extra profit. She will purchase a few cell phones with different lines of companies to serve the people in the area. In Cambodia, some people purchase a small booth and then install many kinds of phone lines to serve people. Normally, they charge US 10-15 cents per minute.

loans.use: To install a phone line.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn O. is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She and her family live in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Evelyn sells foodstuffs and she has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Evelyn appreciates the efforts of Kiva lenders in eradicating poverty. She says "thank you" to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Lufuka C- Nansubuga Aisha Group

texts.en:
Aisha N. is 28 years old. She is a single mother of two and a hardworking and polite person. She sells charcoal and also fries snacks like cassava chips, mandazi, pancakes, and samosas in Lufuka. Her businesses are still at a crawling stage and hence earn her UGX 50,000 per week. From the profits, she pays rent of UGX 15,000 per month.

She would use this loan to boost her business by purchasing more sacks of charcoal and also stocking some matooke for sale. Her dreams are to sell second-hand clothes in Owino market, educate her children, and build a decent home for them.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal and stock some matooke to sell.

loans.name: Marithza

texts.en:
Marithza is a member of the Paraíso (Paradise) Village Bank. Marithza is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Marithza sells catalog cosmetics on credit to her family and friends. Marithza also travels to different markets to sell sweets. Marithza needs a loan of 600 soles to buy cosmetics. Marithza dreams of building her own house, of having a store, and of going to school to study accounting.  
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Marithza es socia del Banco Comunal Paraíso.
Marithza es soltera, tiene 21 años y vive con sus padres, Marithza vende cosméticos por catálogos a amigos familiares al crédito. Además Maritza viaja a las diferentes ferias en donde vende golosinas.
Marithza necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cosméticos.
Los sueños de Marithza son construir su casa, tener una tienda y estudiar contabilidad.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou S. est une brave commerçante qui tient un shop au marché central Saint Maures des Fossés. Cette veuve vend divers articles et entretient sa famille.
Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son commerce.
texts.en:
Fatou S. is an honest tradeswoman with a shop in the Saint Maures des Fossés central market. She is a widow supporting her family, and she sells various items. Madame S. is requesting this loan to grow her business.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow her business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 39 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en la casa de su suegra. El arte del bordado siempre fue lo que le llamaba la atención desde jovencita, tuvo la oportunidad de trabajar bordando hace 4 años desde que conoció a su mejor amiga, quien le enseñó esta labor y la impulsó para trabajar bordando prendas para exportación, pues todos los días tienen grandes cantidades pedidos que realizar. Desde entonces, viene trabajando todos los días dentro de su hogar donde puede sentirse cómoda junto a sus seres queridos. Lo difícil de su trabajo es cumplir con las grandes cantidades de prendas pues es muy cansado mantener su mano trabajando al mismo ritmo continuamente. Gladys espera que en el fututo pueda tener un taller de bordados, donde las máquinas puedan ayudarla a producir mayores cantidades de prendas. Hace 4 años que trabaja con MFP, y está muy contenta de formar tan bonito grupo de trabajo junto a sus amigas. El dinero que solicita lo utilizará para comprar mayor cantidad de materiales; como hilos y telas para sus bordados.
texts.en:
39-year old Gladys lives with her husband and two children in her mother-in-law’s house. The art of embroidery has always attracted her ever since she was a child. She got the opportunity to work in embroidery four years ago when she met her best friend who taught her how to do it. Her friend encouraged her to embroider clothes for export as they always have a large number of orders to complete. Since then, she has been working every day from her home where she feels comfortable close to her beloved family. The difficult part of her work is to complete the large number of clothing orders since it is very tiring for her hand to maintain the constant rhythm. Gladys hopes in the future to have her own embroidery workshop where machines can help her produce a larger quantity of clothing. Four years ago she started working with Kiva partner MFP and is very happy to be part of such a nice group and to be working alongside her friends. The money she is asking for will be used to buy a larger quantity of supplies such as thread and material for her embroidery.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy embroidery supplies

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom S. is 24 years old and resides in the Kampong Cham province with her husband and two of her children. To earn a living, she sells vegetables in the local market, and she typically makes US$2.5 every day. Her husband operates a motor taxi business. On average, he earns US$3.5 profit per day. Mom S. is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike so her husband can run a motor-taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Logotaeao

texts.en: Logotaeao K., 45, is married with nine children. This loan is for bush knives, small taros, fertilizer, and chemicals for weed control. She has three years of experience selling to the general public, six days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (~245 USD). SPBD loans are Logotaeao’s only access to capital because she has  never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase bush knives, small taros, fertilizer, chemicals for weeds

loans.name: Wilber Javier

texts.es: Wilber Javier C. A. tiene la edad de 26 años, su estado civil es soltero. Wilber tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. El se dedica a la actividad económica de una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio ofreciendo la venta de productos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite y frijoles. Ya que su negocio fue una herencia de su abuelo. Por lo que el principal negocio de Wilber es satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes ofreciéndoles lo que ellos solicitan. Es así como recurre a Fundación León 2000 ya que por medio ella las organizaciones amigas dan el apoyo necesario y solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, gaseosas, bisutería y leche en bolsa. El deseo de Wilber es convertir su negocio en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Wilber Javier C. A. is 26 and single. He has 2 children, both in school. His business is a local store, which he has had for more than 6 years. Since he inherited his business from his grandfather, he started selling basic products such as rice, sugar, oil and beans. Now Wilber's primary business is satisfying the needs of his clients, giving them what they want. So he comes to Foundation Leon 2000 so that the contributing organizations can give him the help he needs. He is requesting working capital to buy basic grains, candies, carbonated and non-carbonated soft drinks, costume jewelry, and containers of milk. Wilber's ambition is to become a distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es: La Sra. Maria Lucrecia, casada, de 54 años de edad, trabajadora del MINSA desde hace 14 años, esta solicitando su 9no credito el que sera utilizado para la construccion de un dormitorio, ya que no tiene las condiciones suficientes, su casa es de un proyecto aleman que ejecuto la iglesia catolica, pero esta era de madera, con sus creditos anteriores logro hacerla de concreto y construir cocina y letrina, ahora quiere ampliar con un cuarto para tener mas comodidad.  Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja en un complejo lechero, sus hijos esta fuera del pais de quienes tambien recibe ayuda, de ellos dependo un nieto de 2 años quien ha estado al cuidado de ambos.  Se ha caracterizado por su responsabilidad y moral de pago, pues en sus creditos anteriores no ha presentado mora, y esta consciente que los creditos sirven de mucho, sobre todo a los asalariados que es su unica fuente economica, siempre ha preferido a AFODENIC por su buena atencion y calor humano.
texts.en:
Maria Lucrecia, married and 54 years old, has been working in MINSA for 14 years. She is requesting her 9th loan, which will be used to build a room since she doesn’t have enough space. Her house was originally from a German project implemented by the Catholic Church. It was, however, made of wood but with previous loans she managed to convert it to concrete as well as build a kitchen and bathroom. She now needs to expand by adding one room to live more comfortably. She counts on the support of her husband, who works at a dairy complex. Her children are outside of the country and also send assistance to her. She also supports a 2-year old grandson, who is in their care. She has characterized herself by being punctual and principled in her previous loan repayments, and she is conscious that the credits are a great deal of help to her. She has always preferred AFODENIC for its attentive service and kindness to people.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of a room.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester C. owns and operates a manicure and pedicure business for local community members at the same time as a RTW (ready-to-wear) clothing business. She is 42 years old, married and has two adult children. They are from the village of Katipunan, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Ester has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.
