El préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho ya que logro poner la energía eléctrica y ahora ya pueden ver televisión y de esa forma han logrado vivir mejor con su familia y han mejorado las condiciones que anteriormente no tenían.
texts.en:
Juan has decided to take out another loan. In order to improve his business, he will buy a new camera to offer a video and photography service, and in this way provide a good service to his customers. 

The previous loan helped him a lot, as he was able to install an electricity supply and they can now watch television. As a result, he has been able to enjoy a better quality of life with his family and conditions have improved from before.

loans.use: to buy a new camera.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
El señor Tomas tiene 53 años de edad, esta acompañado con dos hijos.
Él aprendo los trabajos de la agricultura, desde los 10 años de edad. Fue su papá quien le enseño. Se levanta a las 3:00 a.m. para darle de comer a su ganado y luego los lleva al terreno que esta a tres kilómetros de su casa, luego se dirige a trabajar en su milpa durante cinco horas y en la tarde se va de jornal.   
Tomas debe abordar dos autobuses para ir a la ciudad donde compra los insumos agrícolas y el alimento para el ganado, una vez adquiere los insumos se regresa a su casa y tiene que caminar a pie hasta llegar a su casa.   
Él esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar insumos agrícolas para su milpa y comprar una yunta de bueyes, para poder transportar los insumos y el alimento para el ganado hacia su vivienda. 
 Con esta inversión Tomas estará seguro de dar a sus cultivos un manejo adecuado y a tiempo; y venderlos a mejor precio. Al mismo tiempo se le facilitara el trasporte de los mismos a su vivienda y mandara a elaborar una carreta para que la halen los bueyes y transporten los insumos. 

De los ingresos que reciba, espera reparar su vivienda, ya que le hacen falta las puertas y ventanas, los cuales tiene cubiertos con láminas y se siente inseguro, por eso desea hacerlas de matal.
texts.en:
Señor Tomas is 53 years old. He has 2 children. 

He learned to farm from, starting when he was 10 years old. His father taught him. Tomas wakes up at 3:00 a.m. to feed his livestock and later he takes them to a pasture which is 3 kilometers from his house. After that, he goes to work in his fields for 5 hours, and in the afternoon, he works as a day laborer.

Tomas must take two buses in order to get to the city where he purchases agricultural inputs and feed for his cattle. After obtaining the inputs, he returns and must walk on foot to arrive at his house.

He is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo, in order to purchase agricultural inputs for his fields and to purchase a pair of oxen so that he can transport the inputs and the cattle feed to his residence.

With this investment, Tomas will be certain to adequately care for his crops on time, and sell them at a better price.  Additionally, it will facilitate transporting the crops to his home. He will have a wagon made for the oxen to pull and transport the inputs.

With the income he will receive, he hopes to repair his home because it needs doors and windows. They are currently covered with sheets, which makes him feel unsafe. He would like to have metal doors and windows.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for his fields and to purchase a pair of oxen.

loans.name: Kueni

texts.en:
Kueni is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Pitonuu Satupaitea.  She is married and does not have any children. To make a living, Kueni plants and harvests yams for sale. Kueni has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 1,200 Samoa Tala (WST) a month from these activities.

In 2009, Kueni joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Kueni has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  

Kueni is now requesting a new loan of 1,000 WST, which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers, seedlings and gromozone (an herbicide). This will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  

Kueni plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

Please note that the dates in the photos are wrong because of the mistake made by our Loan Officers for not resetting the dates and year of the camera. I hope this won't happen again.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers, seedlings and gromozone (an herbicide).

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has 2 children. 

Melinda has a food shop where she sells snacks like tempura and kikiam. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

Melinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Melinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

loans.name: Belen De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Belén se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de prendas de vestir y productos de belleza por catalogo, esta actividad le brinda los recursos necesarios para el sustento de su hogar y en especial para el bienestar de sus dos hijos. La mercancía es vendida a familiares, amigos y vecinos. Aunque la señora Belén presenta dificultades de salud en su columna es una gran trabajadora y desea comprar surtido nuevo para ofrecer a sus clientes en la temporada de fin de año. El sueño de la señora Belén es tener su propio almacén y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Belen has been selling clothing and mail-order beauty products for ten years.  This business provides her with the income to support her household and especially to ensure the well-being of her two children.  She sells her merchandise to family members, friends, and neighbors.  Although Belen has back problems, she is a very hard worker and she wants to buy new stock to offer her customers for the holiday season.  Belen's dream is to have her own warehouse and to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock up on women's clothing

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is 55 years old, and married with 12 children.  Asuncion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal making business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more coconut shells used for making charcoal. 

Asuncion has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been her business for three years, and also earns an income from general store and pig fattening. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more coconut shells for business.

loans.name: Kanymbu

texts.ru: Канымбу 30 лет, замужем и растит трехлетнюю дочь и 10-месячного сына. В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Канымбу начала свой бизнес в торговле продуктами питания и  оказание услуг общепита.  Магазин, в котором торгует Канымбу, наполовину обустроен как столовая, где можно перекусить и закупить необходимые продукты. Канымбу приложила все усилия для развития бизнеса и добилась успехов – ее бизнес приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  На сегодняшний день, ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, поэтому Канымбу обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS). Закуп товаров позволит ей расширить ассортимент, увеличить количество клиентов и повысить продажи.
texts.en: Kanymbu is 30 years old and married.  She has a 3-year-old daughter and a 10-month-old son.  In search of a source of income for her family, Kanymbu decided to launch her own food sale and catering business.  The shop in which Kanymbu works also serves as a dining room.  One can have a bite to eat and buy the necessary food products.  Kanymbu has worked very hard to develop her business and has been very successful:  her business now brings in close to 10,000 som (KGS) per month.  Today, Kanymbu doesn't have a wide range of food items.  This is why she has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners and requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS).  This loan will allow her to buy a broader range of merchandise, attract a larger number of customers and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy a broader variety of food products.

loans.name: Duo Vista Hermosa De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Vista Hermosa La señora Vicenta, Despuès de haber tenido su bebè  le agradece mucho a Dios por recupera fuerzas para continuar su rutina de vendedora ambulante ya que por su situación no lo hacia como tenia que hacerlo.  Sus clientes la buscan y llaman para hacerle pedido de blusas ya que tiene un gran carisma para vender, y es muy amable y respetuosa. esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa nueva para vender ya que este negocio le a permitido ayudar mucho a sus hijos ella tienen grandes sueños y metas por lograr, y seguirán negociando para ofrecerle lo mejor a sus hijos que son lo mas importante para ella.

loans.use: Compra de ropa nueva para la venta

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Benkadi Yologosso 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi Yologosso 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Kouroubadougou, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  NANGNO, 2 eme assise de la droite vers la gauche, sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte  acheter des intrants, semence, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour  pour l’exploitation de 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 165.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi Yologosso 1 group are married women who are, on average, 38 years old, and have an average of five children each. They all live in traditional families in Kouroubadougou, a village in San, the fourth-largest administrative region in Mali.

They are working with the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their agricultural work during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution. The previous loans were correctly repaid.

Nangno, the second person seated from right to left in the photo, grows peanuts.

With her loan, she plans to buy inputs, seeds, small farming tools, and pay the labor costs for 1 hectare of land. After the harvest, the production will be sold in the village and at the San market to a clientele made up of men and women.

She plans to earn an average monthly profit of 165,000 FCFA per harvest. The profits will allow her to pay back her loan and help her husband cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs, seeds, small farming tools, and pay the labor costs

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is a 18 year old single woman who supports 1 family members from Baqa'a Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for various products such as clothes, accessories and makeup to sell. In the future she wants to expand her project and would like to help her family increase their income.
Since Farah is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan.
Farah is a conservative woman,she is unwilling to upload her photo in the internet the photo is for her father

loans.use: to pay for various products to sell

loans.name: Yhair

texts.es: Yhair, tiene 26 años de edad es bachiller, soltero tiene sueños de seguir estudiando pero por falta de recursos económicos no puede, actualmente vive con sus padres, quienes son personas mayores ya de tercera edad no pueden costearle los estudios a su hijo pero el muchacho es trabajador lo comentan sus amigos y vecinos por ahora se dedica a trabajar en una parcela de lote agrícola que le otorgaron sus padres tiene cultivos de plátano y arroz pero no le es suficiente para que ahorre y continué con sus estudios a nivel profesional por tal motivo quiere mejorar sus ingresos con sus cultivos en su chaco (plátano). Yhair necesita  mucha ayuda económica para mejorar sus ingresos y así el joven pueda ser un gran profesional, nos comentaba que quiere ser abogado para coadyuvar a su familia.
texts.en:
Yhair is 26 years of age, single, and is a high school graduate. He dreams of continuing to study but because of a lack of economic resources he cannot.
Currently he lives with his parents, who are elderly people, whose advanced age means they cannot fund their son's studying. However, the boy is hardworking, as his friends and neighbours affirm. For now he works on a plot of farm land given to him by his parents. He has crops of plantain and rice but this is not enough for him to save money and to continue his studies to a professional level. For this reason he wants to improve his earnings with his farm (plantain). Yhair needs a lot of economic help to improve his earnings and so the young man can be a professional. He told us that he wants to be a lawyer to assist his family.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his plantain plantation.

loans.name: Ayeki

texts.en: Mrs. Ayeki O. is a 42 years old woman, married with two children. A dynamic client of LAPO who specializes in the sale of food item for people in her environment. She is eager to get more money to buy food items in order to meet her customers’ demand.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale (Coconut)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Imelda Teresa

texts.en:
Imelda is a very hard worker. She is married and has four children--two sons ages 9 and 11 and two precious daughters ages 5 and 7. Her husband works for a security company and to help with the family expenses Imelda has been selling shoes out of catalogs for 3 years. Her orders have increased and to fill them Imelda now needs a loan for $475. She promises to repay the loan within 6-12 months. This is the time to help someone who needs it. Please do not hesitate to help improve the quality of life of this family.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Imelda es una mujer muy trabajadora, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, dos niños de 9 y 11 años de edad y dos preciosas hijas de 7 y 5 años. Su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa de seguridad, y para ayudar con los gastos del hogar Imelda trabaja desde hace tres años vendiendo calzado por catálogo, este negocio le ha permitido atender a su familia y obtener un ingreso extra para apoyar a su esposo.

Ahora los pedidos de sus productos se han incrementado y para poder surtirlos Imelda necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 dólares, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Hoy es el momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, tú puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, no lo dudes más.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rosa  Ysela

texts.es:
ROSA YSELA is 44 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband works in the fields as a farmer. She makes traditional meals and breads in her home and sells them from home. She is a member of the group Brasilia 2 along with doña Gladis Ramírez López (who sells perfumes and cosmetics) and Pradería Hernández Saldaña (who has a grocery store). With the loan, Gladis will buy more products and Pradería will increase the amount of food products available at her store. Rosa will design a place in her home for selling her meals.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

ROSA YSELA, tiene 44 años, casada, cuatro hijos, su esposo trabaja en el campo como agricultor. Ella en su casa hace comida tradicional y pan y lo vende repartiéndolas a domicilio. Pertenece al grupo Brasilia 2 junto con doña Gladis Ramírez López (venta de perfumes y cosméticos) y Pradería Hernández Saldaña (tienda de abarrotes). Con el préstamo Gladis comprara más productos y Pradelia aumentara la mercancía de productos comestibles, Rosa acondicionara un lugar en su hogar para la venta de comida.

loans.use: Selling traditional food

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
H. is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and two children at Soc Son district, Ha Noi. Being an attractive lady, she is mindful that she should make herself and her society beautiful. Ten years ago she opened a fabric shop in the ‘Flanel Market’. With her flourishing business, and the increasing capital that she could borrow over the years, in 2005 she opened another store to sell ready-made clothes. Her store is a well known address to the women who need to look good. Her next project is to open a cosmetic shop and for that she is requesting for a loan of $1200.

Translated from Vietnamese by Hien Lam, Kive Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị H. năm nay 47 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại Sóc Sơn, Hà Nội. Bản thân là một phụ nữ có nhan sắc, chị luôn tâm niệm phải biết làm đẹp cho mình cũng như xã hội, chị đã mở 1 quầy hàng kinh doanh vải vóc tại chợ Nỉ cách đây hơn 10 năm. Công việc kinh doanh thuận lợi cộng với số vốn được vay tăng dần qua các năm, năm 2005 chị mở thêm một quầy hàng bán quần áo may sẵn. Cửa hàng của chị đã trở thành địa chỉ quen thuộc cho những phụ nữ có nhu cầu làm đẹp cho mình. Dự định của chị sắp tới sẽ mở thêm quầy hàng mỹ phẩm và có nhu cầu được vay thêm 1200 USD.

loans.use: add a cosmetic shop to her existing business of clothings.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi H., 46 years old, has been in TYM for 4 years now. Her husband is a fisherman so he is frequently away from home. The work off-shore requires the fisherman to be away for a whole month each trip. During these trips, Mrs. H. stays at home to brew rice wine and sell fishes at the local market. Her sources come from her husband as well as other fishermen. Even though life is still hard, it has been much better than how it used to be prior to joining TYM. Now, they have an additional source of funds to buy fishing equipments and increase the efficiency. The average income is about 200 USD per month for each of them. They also have 5 children, 2 of which are still going to school. Mrs. H. would like to take out a loan of 325 USD to buy new fishing-net and more rice to brew wine.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị H., 46 tuổi đã vào Quỹ được 4 năm. Chồng chị là người dân vùng biển nên việc vắng nhà thường xuyên đã trở thành thông lệ. Việc đánh bắt cá xa bờ đòi hỏi người đi biển phải ở trên thuyền có khi cả tháng trời. Chị H. ở nhà nấu rượu và đi chợ buôn bán cá. Mỗi lần anh về chị mang số cá anh đánh được đi bán còn thường chị lấy hàng từ những người đánh cá khác. Cuộc sống tuy còn nhiều vất vả nhưng đã khá hơn so với khi chưa tham gia Quỹ, anh chị đã có thêm nguồn vốn vay dùng cho việc đầu tư mua thiết bị đánh cá nhờ đó hiệu quả lao động tăng lên. Thu nhập của gia đình mỗi tháng khoảng 200 USD chia đều cho 2 vợ chồng. Anh chị có 5 người con trong đó hai người còn đang đi học. Chị H. đang xin vay 325 USD để đầu tư vào mua lưới đánh cá và mua lúa về nấu rượu.

loans.use: Buy fishing-net, rice for brew rice wine

loans.name: Please

texts.es: Client posted twice by mistake.

loans.use: Para comprar mas mercaderia y poder asi atender a mas clientes

loans.name: Abdurahmanova

texts.en:
Abdurahmanova G. lives in Spitamen; she is married and has 2 children.  She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007, and she recommended herself as a serious and executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures.  She is engaged in commercial and trade services.  

Mrs. Abdurahmanova G. has a business in the wholesale food products sales industry.  She has a wide assortment and she has a straight supplier, which is why the prices for her goods are lower than the bazaar prices.  She is very polite, which is why she has repeat customers who want to buy only her goods.  

Abdurahmanova G. is very experienced in the business.  But working in the trade sphere, she meets stiff competition, which is why she wants to provide a wide assortment.  Now Mrs. Abdurahmanova G. requests a loan of $650 for business development and increasing her assortment.

loans.use: For business development and the increasing her assortment of goods.

loans.name: Arubaine 4 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Elixabeth A.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to increase inventory in her charcoal business. Elixabeth is 44 years old and is married to a business man. She has 7 children ranging from age 13 to 27 and three of them go to school. Each week, Elixabeth makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the increased profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. Elixabeth has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before which she paid back on time.

Elixabeth is joined in her small group by Alice A., Erios N., Vivian Nakaibale, and Rose N.. Alice A. has a business selling charcoal and wants to start selling firewood. Erios N. is currently operating a business selling charcoal and wants a loan to increase stock. Vivian Nakaibale sells used clothes and wants to purchase more clothes to sell. Rose N. currently sells new clothes and is requesting a loan to expand business.

loans.use: To increase inventory in charcoal business

loans.name: Kamukamu A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rose K.. She is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to add to her business. Rose is 38 years old and is divorced. She has 5 children ranging from age 5 to 14 and her children go to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

Rose is joined in her small group by Edith N., Alayisha N., Safina D., and Hadija S.. Edith N. has a business running a retail shop and wants to add more items. Alayisha N. is currently operating a business selling clothes and wants a loan to widen stock. Safina D. operates a business of selling fish and wants to invest in her business. Hadija S. is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To purchase large volumes of clothes and increase stock

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
Arnaldo is 28 years old, he is single and lives with his parents in the city of Carapeguá. He is studying Business Administration at one of the local universities, and is in his final year. Once he has completed this he will be able to fulfill his dream of starting a professional career.

Arnaldo has worked hard from a very early age, starting by selling clothes with his father. Thanks to this, he managed to earn his own income and generate enough capital to stand on his own two feet. Four years ago he started buying his own goods to sell; goods such as sports shoes, clothes and bedspreads. He has a well-established customer base, thanks to the large number of contacts he now has.

He is applying for a loan so that he can buy goods such as bedspreads, sports shoes and trousers in larger volumes, which will enable him to get good discounts on his purchases.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Arnaldo es un joven de 28 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Carapeguá, ésta cursando el último año de la carrera de Administración de Empresas en una de las Universidades de la zona, dando así cumplimiento a un anhelado sueño que es la de ser profesional.

Desde muy temprana edad tuvo inclinación hacia el trabajo se inicio trabajando con su padre en ventas de ropas , y gracias a esta actividad se fue ganando sus propios ingresos que le genero un capital importante para independizarse. Es así que hace 4 años empezó a comprar sus propias mercaderías para la venta como calzados deportivos, ropas y sobrecamas, gracias a la gran cantidad de conocidos que tiene hoy día ya posee muy buena clientela formada.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercaderías como sobrecamas, calzados deportivos y pantalones en grandes cantidades, pudiendo así conseguir buenos descuentos en sus compras.

loans.use: To buy goods such as bedspreads, sports shoes and trousers in large volumes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is thirty one years old and she has one child. Her daughter is in school. She has her own store and she sells grocery products such as soft drinks, rice, sugar, washing powder, vegetables, and spices, in her community. She wants to use her loan to buy more products in order to increase her inventory and to avoid price hikes in the products.

Elizabeth is a member of the group called "By His Grace." Members in unity agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Elizabeth appears in the photo with her daughter.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget I. is 36 years old and single. She lives in Benin city,  Edo state, Nigeria. Bridget sells cellophane. She has been in this business for the past three years. She is an LAPO client. She needs the loan of $875 to buy more materials for her cellophane business.

loans.use: To buy materials for cellophane sales

loans.name: Hoy

texts.en: Hoy S. farms and raises pigs in Ponleur Preahphos Village, Siem Reap Province, earning about $1.50 per day, while her husband buys chickens from a villager to sell in the market. They have two children, one of whom is married, while the other works in Siem Reap Province, earning about $1.50 per day. Now Mrs. S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to transport the chickens to the market .

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to transport chickens to market.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Komla A. is 45 years old, is married and a father of 3 children. He lives and works in his own welding workshop in Avétonou, a village located approximately 100 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. To provide for the needs of his family, he manufactures and resells various metal objects and machine tools at the main local market. With this credit, he would like to build his supplies by buying iron sheets for manufacturing outdoor objects. The profits from this activity will make it possible for him to support the needs of his children and to improve their living conditions. Mr. A. is a good customer since he has already profited from more than three loans and his refunds were respected.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Komla A. est âgé de 45 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il habite et travaille dans son propre atelier de soudure à Avétonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille il fabrique et revend divers objets métalliques et des machines à outils sur un marché général. Avec ce crédit, il souhaite approvisionner en achetant les tôles de fer destiné à la fabrication des objets à exposer. Les profits qui se dégageront de son activité lui permettront de supporter les besoins de ses enfants et améliorer ses conditions de la vie. Monsieur A. est un bon client puisqu’il a déjà bénéficié de plus de trois crédits et les remboursements ont été réguliers.

loans.use: Purchase of iron sheets for manufacturing outdoor objects

loans.name: Min

texts.en:
Min K., 55, is a rice farmer who lives with two of her seven children in Kampong Cham. She normally makes US$2.00 per day and is aided by two of her children who work in a garment factory and a car garage. Her husband, Mach Veang, 58, works collecting palm juice and boiling it into palm sugar. He earns approximately US$3.00 profit per day. Mrs. Min would like a loan from Kiva of US$500 to purchase more tools to increase the amount of palm sugar her family is able to produce.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more tools to increase palm sugar production

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mr. Chea P. is a villager in Veal Srae Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a farmer with a plot of land on which he can cultivate rice. In this plantation, he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough animals to plow the rice field. Thus, he has decided to request a loan to buy another cow to help plow the field. His wife, Mrs. Kouk Samorn, owns a small grocery store in the local market. Mr. Chea P. is 51 years old and the father of four children, three of whom are employed in different businesses while the youngest attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy another cow to help plow the field.

loans.name: Nhoem

texts.en: Mrs. Nhoem C. was born in 1959 and now lives in Pa Hy village in Kampong Chnang Province. She owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice, and she makes baskets. Her husband, Mr. Pring Pak, is a palm juice collector. His business is facing an obstacle, so Mrs. Nhoem C. decided to ask for a loan to buy firewood and palm juice collecting equipment. With this loan she hopes to earn much money to support her family. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a palm juice collector and the other who is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy firewood and palm juice collecting equipment.

loans.name: Amadou Tidiane

texts.fr: Ce jeune a choisi de faire fortune au pays contrairement à ceux qui ont choisi l'immigration clandestine. Il exploite une librairie-papeterie non loin du marché central de Ziguinchor. Sa clientéle est composé pour l'essentiel des éléves, des étudiants et autres administrations publiques et privées. Il sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son fond de roulement en cette période d'année scolaire.
texts.en:
This young man has chosen to make his fortune in his own country as opposed to those who engage in clandestine immigration. He runs a little stationery store and bookshop not far from the central market of Ziguinchor. His clientele is essentially composed of school children, students, and representatives of public and private offices. He is requesting this loan to bolster his working capital during the back-to-school period.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stationery shop and bookshop

loans.name: Mellap

texts.en:
In 2002, Mellap N. A., an enrolled nurse, retired from the Provincial General Hospital of Rift Valley in Kenya and decided to open a medical clinic. The Rapha Medical Clinic, which serves the Nakuru free-area, provides general outpatient services, family planning, immunizations, and maternity services to children and adults who usually live in the surrounding slums.

The clinic is characterized as medium sized, with 4 rooms, each with 2 beds. Not all of the rooms are entirely complete, so Mellap is working to finish them. She employs 1 clinical officer, 1 nurse, 1 support staff, and 1 lab technician and says that the clinic has a moderate patient flow. Mellap would like to expand the clinic, adding another nurse and more beds.

Mellap is requesting a loan of 90,000 Kenya Schillings (1,200 USD) in order to purchase more beds, mattresses, bed linens, complete construction on current rooms, and purchase a septic tank.

A widow since 2001, Mellap has 5 children, all of whom are working adults. One of her sons used to work with Mellap at the clinic but has since moved to another job. Now Mellap works with one of her daughters, who is a registered nurse. A dream of Mellap’s is to have a big hospital, and with a growing maternity ward, she is beginning to see a start to the realization of her dream.

loans.use: To purchase a septic tank, beds, mattresses, bed linens, and to complete renovations.

loans.name: Mrs. Yoy Mang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people living in Kampong Pou village in Kandal province comprise this village bank, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Yoy M., the 31-year-old village bank president, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces a problem because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crop.

In order to solve this problem, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Vann Tha, is a fisherman. Mrs. Yoy M. is the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer  to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Safa

texts.en:
Sara R. is currently in the business of selling beans and rice at a little hotel and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Sara is 26 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has 3 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Boscaneanu

texts.en: Boscaneanu L. was born in 1975 and her main activity is agriculture. She also grows animals. She is helped by her father who is war veteran and a specialist in agriculture. L. needs money to build a greenhouse for fruit and vegetables because she has a lot of clients who would like to buy both fruit and vegetables from her. She requested a loan from MicroInvest to build the greenhouse so she can have a rich harvest in 2009.

loans.use: To build a greenhouse

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Mukaddas D. applied first in 2002 for a business development loan. Thanks to previous loans, she could start her business making the national traditional bread. She works together with her sister, who makes the special dough and bakes it. Mukaddas sells it in the bazaar; she also makes the dough.

Mukaddas is requesting a business support loan of 3,600STJ (US$975) for four months to open a specialized trade outlet and purchase coal. She thanks Kiva for its support and small business development.

loans.use: To open a trade outlet and purchase coal

loans.name: Mohammad Hashem

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is M. Hashem the son of M. R.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with eight children. He is a farmer and has worked as a farmer since 1990 and he is a very experienced farmer.

He would like take an individual loan of 30,000 Afghani for the term of 12 months to buy the essential materials for farming. He would like to say this is an effective process that can support the entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy the essential materials for farming

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en: Josephine N. is a smart, hard-working and devoted mother who is married with 5 children, and she cares for 6 orphans. She is the leader of Suubilyamukama women's group. When she tells you about the business she does, you realize that she is really fit for it. She sells new clothes for ladies, men and children. Some are already made but she sews most of the clothes herself. She makes clothes of various designs -- both bitenge (Nigerian wear) like the one she is putting on with a red cap, as well as traditional wear (gomesi). On top of this, she has a shelf where she sells the accessories like jewellery that go with the clothes she makes; hence her customers find a variety to choose from. Josephine needs another loan to be able to stock more clothing materials for sale and for sewing.

loans.use: Buying more clothes and clothing materials for her business.

loans.name: Femmes Commercantes 1 Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The five women of this group have been good neighbors for a long time. They are in a federation of all the women of the town of Thies. This larger group has been subdivided into groups of 5 to facilitate management.

The groups were created based on the affinity of the women themselves. They are engaged in various money-earning activities and help their husbands support their respective families. The group is auto-financed through an internal dues system, but with the loans from IMCEC, they can obtain larger sums and get financing for their businesses without a long delay. Most of the women have stands in the central market of the town of Thies where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, cloth, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of produce at local weekly markets and in fishing zones for resale in town

loans.name: Meok

texts.en:
Meok R. is a 42-year-old, married woman and is the mother of four single children; one of whom is working as a rice farmer. She is married to Em Ny, 42, who earns a living selling firewood from home. Meok R. presently raises many pigs in a medium stall behind her house. She sells all her pigs to buyers three or four months after she begins raising them.

Meok R. has requested a loan in order to purchase more food to fatten her family's pigs, as her pigs are nearly ready to sell. Meok R. was not available for photographing, so her husband is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To purchase more food for her pigs

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia A. is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to two daughters. One is in the senior high school while the other is in university. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Dwenase, in the Western Region of Ghana. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Dwenase is a commercial and farming town. Her husband is a trader. Cecilia is also a trader. She trades in domestic goods such as plates, glassware, blenders, etc. She sells from a container at the lorry station in her community. Cecilia has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy plates and drinking glasses in bulk.

loans.name: Sorm

texts.en:
Sorm S. is a domestic farmer, 47-years-old, who lives with her own small family in Siem Reap Province. Her husband is 66-year-old Mohn Duch, a farmer. On the other hand, her husband also catches fish for additional income. This couple has three children who are still young and who assist with their parent’s jobs when they are not studying.

The fishing season is coming; the river is full of fish. Sorm S. is looking for a loan for her husband to buy additional tools to successfully fish. She and her husband are hopeful that this loan will allow them to accrue more income in order to make sure their family attains a good standard of living.

loans.use: To buy additional tools for her husband's fishing business

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy A. is from the village of Labuyo, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Juvy is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Juvy owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Juvy has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juvy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvy is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Juvy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional chicks and feed as well as medicine.

loans.name: Mary Fe

texts.en:
Mary Fe T. is from the village of Purok 5, Montol, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Mary Fe is single and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Fe owns and operates a sari-sari, or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling frequently-used retail products in the local community. Mary Fe has been engaged in her business for more than 6 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Mary Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Mary Fe is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Mary Fe from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Simon

texts.fr: G. Simon est né en 1973 dans la commune d'Akpro Missérété et y vit avec sa famille. Simon est en effet marié et père de 03 enfants. Simon est couturier. Mais Simon ne dispose pas d'assez de machines à coudre pour honorer ses engagements vis-à-vis de sa clientèle. Ceci fait que  Simon  met assez de retard dans la livraison des tenues à sa clientèle. Alors, pour mieux satisfaire cette clientèle, Simon sollicite un crédit d’ALIDé pour acheter une nouvelle machine.
texts.en:
G. Simon was born in 1973 in the town of Akpro Missérété.  He lives there with his family.  In fact, he is married and the father of three children.  Simon is a tailor, but he doesn't have enough sewing machines for honoring his commitments relative to his customers, resulting in him being pretty late when delivering some outfits to his customers.  So, to satisfy his customers better, he's requesting a loan from ALIDé for buying a new machine. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Ntoogo's Group

texts.en: W. Ntoogo is the leader of his lending group in Wandegeya. He is a friendly man and married with 3 children with the eldest being in secondary school. W. is a business man selling motor vehicle spare parts from Soweto Zone in Wandegeya for 15 years. He is able to make profits that enable him take care of his family as well as accomplishing family development goals. W. needs a loan to help re boost his business after using a lot of money to clear his children’s school fees.  He needs to buy more spare parts for increased stock.

loans.use: Buying more spare parts for his shop.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela is a 48-year-old married woman with nine children. She sells provisions and rechargeable phone cards within her community. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thank you to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry yields patience and diligence for the success of her business. She has managed a retail store in their village for almost five years, where she sometimes sells vegetables. Her weekly net income in her store is PHP300. They have also a half-hectare of rice farm, which is being manage by her husband. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 from KIVA lenders for additional capital in her business. She will use the funds mainly for buying stocks of commodities such as detergent soap, biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks and many other products. 

She is married to Aurelio Q., who works as a farmer and a tricycle driver. They have been blessed with a son, named Niloor Bonnil, who is only 4 years of age. They are harmoniously residing at the rural area of Sta. Maria, Alicia, Isabela. She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her request of a loan to help her husband in earning money to support their daily needs.

loans.use: Additional capital for buying more commodities for her retail store.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthorn N. is a villager in the village of Trapeang Srangae in Takeo Province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery products to sell. Her husband, Mr. Maen Chan, uses electricity to charge a battery for income. Mrs. Chanthorn N. is 42 years old and the mother of four children. One of her children is working in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Motorcycle transport is the primary source of income for Nida and her husband in the village of Barangay Capatan Tuguegarao, City. Aside from her transport business, Nida is also engaged in selling fruits and vegetables as an additional source of income. Carlos, her husband, is the one who operates their motorcycle business to earn an income for their daily basic needs.
For the continuous development of their transport business, Nida is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 from KIVA lenders. She hopes that her loan will again be approved to enable her to repair her motorcycle to keep it working. She will also use some of the loan for her vending business.

The couple is working double time for the welfare of their children. They hope that their children will finish their college degrees.

loans.use: To maintain her husband's vehicle

loans.name: Sotoewa

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère d’un enfant, l’activité qu’elle exerce est le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, son époux est un chauffeur et son revenu ne lui permet pas de couvrir toutes les charges de la famille, avec  son revenu elle apporte sa contribution financière à son foyer. Elle veut profiter des fêtes de fin d’année pour bien vendre, raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour compléter son stock avec 15 boîtes de tomates, 3 paniers de tomates naturel et 5 cartons de pâtes alimentaires.
texts.en:
This woman is married and has a child and she buys and sells food. Her husband is a chauffeur but his income does not cover all the family expenses. With her income she contributes to the home finances. She wishes to take advantage of the holidays to improve her sales, therefore she is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to complement her stock with 15 cans of tomatoes, 3 baskets of fresh tomatoes and 5 boxes of pasta.

Translated from French by caroline Mrejen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food (tomatoes and pasta)

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Mrs.Trinidad O. is from the village of Calaran in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. She is married and blessed with only one school-aged child. Trinidad is a church worker earning 500 Php per month. Trinidad and her husband are also busy working in a farm in their own cultivated riceland. She has been engaged on her business activities for more than 10 years now. She earned 7,000.00 monthly from the said business. In 1999, Trinidad joined PMPC to access the programs and services of the said Coop. Trinidad is requesting a new loan of 30,000.00 PHP which will be used for additional capital of her existing project. This loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Trinidad from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of farm inputs for her rice fields

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en:
Remelyn C. is from the village of Salimpuno. She is 23 years old. Remelyn is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Remelyn owns & operates a store where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Remelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Remelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Remelyn is requesting a new loan of 55,000 PHP, which will be used to fully pay for a transport vehicle to improve her business. She will also use the loan as additional capital for her mini grocery store. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Remelyn from PMPC and the second loan funded by Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To fully pay for a motorcycle

loans.name: Gerardo Modesto

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandaga, el señor Gerardo G. se dedica a trabajar arduamente en un centro de labores con el fin de obtener los ingresos para el beneficio propio de su familia y su casa de habitación que tanto necesita de él.
Actualmente el señor Gerardo está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de útiles escolares para sus dos pequeños hijos debido a que estos están en la escuela y él debe de mantenerlos para que se desarrollen y lleguen a ser grandes profesionales.
Espera confiadamente que el crédito será otorgado y a lo inmediato comprará los útiles escolares y también pagará la matricula de sus hijos para que estos estudien.
texts.en:
Mr. Gerardo G. works very hard at a work center in the Department of Chinandanga. His goal is to provide for his family, who depend on his earnings, and his home. Mr. Gerardo has requested this particular loan to buy school supplies for his two small children. They go to school and he supports and provides for them with the goal that they will become important professionals when they grow up. He will use the loan as soon as he receives it to buy school supplies and enroll the children in school.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies for his school age children

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en:
Khiev N., 47, has a business selling brooms at the local market of Takeo province. She earns approximately US$3 each day while her husband, who is a rice farmer, makes less than US$1 a day.

This couple has three children: one is a student and two are employed as garment factory workers. Khiev N. told a loan officer that every month she needs to spend around US$45 on food and US$15 on utilities.

Khiev N. has been making and selling brooms since 1998. Her brooms are made from a kind of long grass which grows in the forest.

Khiev N. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work. This will help her children reduce transportation costs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her childen to use for commuting

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia T. is a 42-year-old married woman who lives in Tabao, Zone 2, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by engaging in a retail store selling dried fish, bananas and other products she she can sell. Julia’s husband works as a driver and also helps her in running the business. They have three children between 3 and 12 years old with two of them currently going to school and also helping out in the business as part of their daily chores. Julia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1989 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her business. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 12,000 from her business activities. Julia is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 25,000 was used to fund operations for her retail business which had a positive impact on both the business and on the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 25,000 for her 13th loan, which she intends to use in her retail business. Julia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additonal working capital

loans.name: Dem

texts.en: Dem C., age 42, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Daoun Keo District, Takeo province, Cambodia. She and her husband are in the business of selling chickens and ducks, earning a gross income of about USD 60 per day to help cover the family expenses. Their standard of living has been improved since they have started this business. C. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more chickens and ducks for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and ducks for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more indomie noodle, eggs and tea to sell.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “CRISTO MORENO”; Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Mariluz,  ella tiene 38 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 7  de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de lavar ropa de otras personas los fines de semanas, Nuestra socia es técnica en obstetricia pero por muchas diferentes razones no estaba ejerciendo su carrera, ahora ella está dispuesta a aperturar un consultorio obstétrico en su casa y el dinero que solicita lo invertirá en este nuevo proyecto.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our applicant is a member of the Cristo Moreno communal bank. She lives in the city of Cusco.

Sra. Mariluz is 38 years old and lives with her two children, ages 11 and 7. She alternates her household activities with a weekend job washing the clothes of other people. She is trained as a midwife but for a lot of different reasons has been unable to practice her profession.

Now, she has decided to open an obstetric office in her house, and she will invest the money she is applying for in this new project. Sra. Mariluz appreciates the support offered through the loan and promises to meet all her debt payments according to the established installments.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the opening of an obstetric office.

loans.name: Matias Modesto

texts.es:
Matías de 51 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su esposa vende legumbres. Ellos tienen un hijo de 25 años. Por la falta de oportunidades y la desesperante idea de tener dinero para mantener a su familia el invirtió todos sus ahorros en legumbres para vender afuera de su casa en el suelo (en Ecuador es muy común que la gente venda comida afuera de su domicilio).

Matías al ver que le iba bien en la venta de legumbres hizo una carpa de tablas y compro mas legumbres para vender, el ahora se mantiene en este negocio, su esposa para ayudarlo vende también legumbres en el mercado del suburbio. Ellos trabaja desde las 05h00am hasta las 14h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cebollas tomates y empezar a vender arroz para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Matías, 51, lives in an urban zone in El Suburbio, Guayaquil. His wife is a vegetable merchant. They have a 25-year-old son. Due to lack of employment opportunities and the maddening need to have money to maintain his family he invested all his savings in vegetables to sell on the ground outside his house (in Ecuador it is very common for people to sell food outside their homes). As Matías realized that the vegetable sales were good he built a shelter out of boards and bought more vegetables to sell. Now, he supports himself with this business and his wife helps him sell vegetables in El Suburbio’s market. They work from 5am until 2pm every day. He will use the loan to buy onions and tomatoes for his business and will start to sell rice too. In the future, he’d like to have a store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Onions, tomatoes, rice.

loans.name: Felicito

texts.en:
Felicito B. is from the village of Brgy, Gingoog City. He is 48 years old. Felicito is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Felicito owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling scrap metal and other used products in the local community. Felicito has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Felicito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Felicito is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Felicito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business and support his children's education.. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: María

texts.es: María, de 44 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, vive sola en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es tener un mejor futuro. El puesto de comida de María es el más concurrido del mercado Asunción de la ciudad de Tarma, todos los días sus clientes se dan cita en su puesto para degustar los deliciosos menús que prepara. Ella es una cocinera muy hábil y es que desde muy pequeña le nació el amor por la cocina y ahora se siente muy feliz realizando este trabajo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar es por eso que lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 36 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todas las personas que entran a su restaurante, ya que muchas veces tiene que trabajar sola.  Con el paso de los meses, espera mejorar la infraestructura de su restaurante y así tener más clientes. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que desea acceder a más créditos, en su grupo comunal es una socia muy participativa. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará nuevas ollas y utensilios, ya que los que usaba, se han deteriorado con el paso del tiempo.
texts.en:
María is 44 years old and a hardworking responsible woman. She lives alone in the house of her parents and what she wants most is to have a better future. María operates a food establishment that is the most well-known in the Asunción Market in the city of Tarma. Every day her customers come by her business to taste the delicious food she prepares. She is an expert cook who developed a love for food at a very young age. Now she is very happy to be doing this line of work. What she enjoys most about her job is cooking because she does it with great care. María has been doing this for 36 years and considers the most difficult part to be attending to everyone who comes by her restaurant since she works alone most of the time. Within the next few months, she hopes to improve the infrastructure of her restaurant so that she can serve more customers.

This is her second loan with MFP. María expects to be prompt with her payments so that she can access more loans. In her Communal Bank, she is an extremely active participant. The loan of 2000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy new pots and utensils since the ones she has now have deteriorated with use over time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pots & utensils

loans.name: Pay As You Call Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Pay As You Call. She is 49 years old, is married, and has four children who range from 15 to 30 years old. She also cares for two siblings. She was only able to attend school through 10th grade due to lack of financial support.

For three years, Elizabeth has been selling charcoal in Congo Town community on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

Elizabeth describes herself as peaceful. Her dream is to improve her business, build a house, and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Enkhbayar

texts.en:
Enkhbayar, S. is a humble, helpful and open-minded person. She is divorced and lives with her mother and 2 daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They all live together in a traditional Mongolian, nomadic tent. Her oldest daughter, Sodgerel, is 10 years old and attends secondary school. Her younger daughter, Khulan, is 5 years old and stays at home with her grandmother. 


Enkhbayar operates a taxi service in her town. She enjoys transporting people. She says, “I must be very responsible and careful when driving my car in order to provide a safe ride for my customers”. Also, she says, “The most important thing to me is to provide a good education for my children". 



She is requesting a loan to purchase four tires and other spare parts for her car.

loans.use: to purchase four tires and other spare parts for her car

loans.name: Ngô's Group

texts.en:
T. Ngô Thị (20209050027) is a 59-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. T. is the group leader of a 4-member group L. offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Vọng Nguyệt nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).

T. is married and has 1 adult -aged child. She owns and operates a business raising livestock for sale. T. has been engaged in this business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from it.

In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous L. of 4,704,000 VND from SEDA. This previous L. was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She is now requesting a new L. of 7,392,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the 4th L. taken out by T. from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  Ngô Thị L. (0) is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND L. to support her service-based business.

2.  Chu Thị X. (0) is a 59-year-old female who is requesting a 2,016,000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock.

3.  Ngô Thị T. (0) is a 57-year-old female who is requesting a 2,016,000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Nguyễn Thị (20209050027) là 59 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Vọng Nguyệt nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03 ).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 25 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Ngô Thị L. (0) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


2.  Chu Thị X. (0) là 59 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.016.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Ngô Thị T. (0) là 57 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.016.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Yaklin Yessica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, Provincia del Cusco y Departamento Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yaklin ; ella tiene 28 Años de edad y tiene 1 hijos. La socia alterna sus actividades con el arte ella es conviviente y se dedica a la venta de cuadros hechos en oleo, ella tiene un local frente a la escuela de bellas artes en el segundo piso, hay están expuestas las obras de pintores nuevos hechos en oleo. La socia quiere comprar marcos, pinturas.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pinturas y algunos marcos.

La socia agradece y valora esté préstamo el cual le permite realizar sus metas, La socia se compromete a cumplir el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Progreso (Progress) communal bank. This bank is located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Cusco Department. The member is Yaklin; she is 28 years old and has one son. The member divides her time between homemaking and art. She has a live-in partner, and her business is selling oil paintings. She has a second-floor shop in front of the fine arts school, where oil paintings by new painters are exhibited. The member wants to buy frames and paints. She is asking for the loan to buy paints and some frames. She is grateful for and values the loan, which will allow her to reach her goals. The member promises to pay off her loan on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paints and frames

loans.name: Angelita Paulina

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y la calidez de su gente. Se  reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo.

La señora Angelita lleva en el Banco Comunal 16 años dice que le gusta porque dan los créditos sin muchos tramites y los intereses son bajos.

Mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, es una ama de casa que se da tiempo para hacer muchas cosas,  ya que además de atender su hogar también estudia párvulo en la Universidad Eloy Alfaro de Manta los Sábados Y Domingos.

Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa el cual inicio con uno de los créditos de la Fundación Espoir hace 10 años. Además elabora muñecas las mismas que vende a sus compañeras de la Universidad. Vende ropa 3 días a la semana en Jipijapa su tierra natal. La mercadería la compra en Guayaquil ya que allá salen más baratas y le dejan mejores ganancias.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar ropa de mujeres y ciertos productos para elaborar sus muñecas.7

Su sueño es ser una profesional y ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its rich cultural and the quality of its people, members of the Community Bank Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo (With Love and Faith Toward Development) meet every 15 days. Angelita has been a member for the past 16 years and says she enjoys it because she gets the loan without many formalities and the interest rates are low. She lives with her partner and has two children. She is a housewife and spends her time doing many things because along with tending to her home she also is studying child care at the local university on Saturdays and Sundays. She has a business selling clothing, which she started with a loan from Kiva partner Fundación Espoir 10 years ago. She also makes dolls, which she sells to her classmates at the university. She sells clothing three days a week in Jipijapa, her hometown. She buys the merchandise in Guayaquil because it's cheaper there and gives her better profits. She plans to use this loan to purchase women's clothing as well as certain supplies to make her dolls. Her dream is to earn a degree and practice her profession.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase skirts, blouses, pants, dresses, fabric, buttons, thread, etc.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov P. has had a farming job for many years. She owns a piece of land where she plants various crops from which she always gets an income to serve the needs of her family. Pov P. has a life partner who works with her at the farm, and they have four children: one child is already married and the other three are single. 

Pov P. wishes to invest in another business. Through this new business, she believes she will be able to generate extra income to ensure that her family attains a better standard of living. Because she lacks money to use as capital, Pov P. has requested a loan from Kiva’s project partner so she can buy salt and fish paste to resell.

loans.use: To buy salt and fish paste

loans.name: Eloglan

texts.ru:
Eloglan A. 39 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey, sin kotormu 10 let on uchitsya v shkole, i doch kotoroy 8 let ona uchitsya v shkole. Eloglan yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli region vmeste so svoyey semyoy.

Eto uje vtoroy ssud Eloglana,  koqda on bral perviy loan on pomenyal svoy bizness, no uje proyda vremya on opat reshil zanatsya skotovodstvom potomu chto on tak lubit svoyu rabotu chto uje ne smoq bez neyo. Eloglan etomu bizneesu skotovodstva nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca. Seychas Eloglan nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupi korovi.
texts.en:
Eloglan A. is 39 years old. He is married and has two children: a 10-year old son who attends school and an 8-year old daughter who is also in school. Eloglan is an Internally Displaced Person. He is a refugee from [the town of] Fuzuli. Now he lives in Fuzuli region with his family.

This is already Eloglan second loan. After taking out his first loan,  he had changed his line of business but after some time he decided to return to raising cattle again because he enjoys this work and cannot abandon it. He learned this trade from his father. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy a cow.

loans.use: Purchasing a cow

loans.name: Hab

texts.en: Hab C., 65, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. C. is a housewife while her husband is a farmer, earning an income of about USD $2.50 per day. One of her children is employed as a sale person for a private company, earning an income of about USD $3 per day. The family has to spend USD $33 on food, USD $10 on electricity and water supplies, and USD $15 on other necessary expenses every month.  C. is requesting a loan of USD $800 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. C.'s husband and son appear in the photograph because C. was not available.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Liwanag

texts.en:
Since joining ASHI, Liwanag B. has ventured into selling fish and a fishing business. The idea of having this kind of business crossed her mind when her husband who is also fisherman caught more fish in the lake, located in Talim Island, in the province of Rizal. Liwanag sold those in their neighborhood and she realized that selling fish earns profits bigger and faster than any other kind of business she had had in the past years of her life using her loan from ASHI. Unlike other products sold, fish is salable because it is one of the most basic needs of the human being, especially for people who live in very remote areas of the province. They are far from the municipal market thus the possibility of buying from vendors who come to their community is very high. Also, most people choose to buy fish rather than any other meat because it is cheaper and healthier.

From then on, Liwanag used her loans from ASHI in her fishing business. From the profits she earned, she was able to invest in her home and support her family financially, specially the tuition fees of her five children which are very expensive. 

She kept on borrowing from ASHI to keep her business growing. Now, she plans to use her newly received loan in buying additional materials needed for her fishing business such as fishing nets and other supplies so that her husband will catch more fish to sell.
